column4: >The StreeXB Entertainment Group's goal is to raise funds to expand the membership site, hire more programmers to accommodate our growth and the continual functions related to StreeXB systems. In addition to expansion related cost,  we will use a portion of the funds to cover upfront expenses relating to the 2016 Vancouver Indie Artist Conference. Funds will be used for developing the StreeXB Public Relations and PR departments which is an integral part of our systems to promote and publicize up and coming indie artists.

column1: ","""Artistry is like a bird that needs to soar""

The StreeXB mission is to break the chains and provide a platform that allows the artist to create the definition of artistry. To accomplish this we've created a platform that we call the StreeXB The Indie Artist Hub. The StreeXB has been created to serve the needs of the Artists and the fans that supports the music movement.
Platforms that Currently Supports the Artists
The StreeXB music platform will give the artists the ability to publish their music and increase their fan base.
A comprehensive training platform that will cater to the needs of the novice and the season accomplish artist.
With Your DonationsWe will be able to provide more services to artists
Annual artist conference
We will provide artists with landing pages
Ambassador platform page
StreeXB Concerts
Article Features and Recognitions
Conclusion

The StreeXB Entertainment Group's goal is to raise funds to expand the membership site, hire more programmers to accommodate our growth and the continual functions related to StreeXB systems. In addition to expansion related cost,  we will use a portion of the funds to cover upfront expenses relating to the 2016 Vancouver Indie Artist Conference. Funds will be used for developing the StreeXB Public Relations and PR departments which is an integral part of our systems to promote and publicize up and coming indie artists.",19.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Vancouver, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/streexb-providing-independence-for-musical-artists/pica

column2: by CinemaPro1.2""> celebrates the awesomeness of video games, the

Who is Admiral Dawg?
A musician for the people... a rapper for the nerds. My
first album Cue the Horns! was released in 2011 amongst my friends and fans

column10: by CinemaPro1.2""> for free. Ne’er existed a person who listened to my album and looked at me the

column1: same again. With such hits as “Chug a 6 pack and take a girl to the symphony,”
and “Diamonds in my mustache” I can’t blame people for questioning my purpose in

this curious world. Cue the Horns! helped me discover my voice and paved the way for Brews, Weed, RPG's. So who is the Dawg and what the hell is a Nerdgasm? Behold, friends. Visit my new soundcloud and experience a rapping bard - fit for musical battle (links below).
https://soundcloud.com/admiraldawg/sets/cue-the-horns-1
Whence the funded warrior's foes hath been slain, he shall rain loot upon his brethren
What’s my guac gonna’
do for The Dawg?

What's the guac gonna' do, Dawg!!!? Hell, hopefully allow me to quit my desk job  and let me shower Middle Earth with rappin lore. I have some of the greatest fans a nerd like me could ask for – fans who would follow me into rap battle riding a griffon wielding a microphone in the shape of a sword hilt with 2 dirty wenches at their side. But the addition of fan-raised guac will make help the album lunch be dexterous, swift, and sharp like a rogue’s dagger. 

One realm under Dawg
Say Dawg…What’s my guac gonna’ do for me!?

Fear not treasure goblins, there will be loot. Check out The Gallery and set your eyes on my self-designed memorabilia! Your Guac is gonna get you some badass swag and help free a caged beast. Your Rupees, your gold pieces, will set forth the campaign the internet has been waiting for! The album is here, brethren! Help me unleash it!
Check out the gallery for pictures of the goods!

column5:
>https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/admiral-dawg...

The treacherous journey

The journey began after graduating from
column6: by CinemaPro1.2""> the University of Houston in the summer of 2014. I accepted an internship at a logistics company and quickly realized my time was being underutilized and must be put to good use. I began writing the album at work in December of 2014 and began producing the music 2 months later. It struck me after creating the title track this is what I was destined to do... Thus, I put my wit to the test and poured my soul into a truly epic musical album detailing the gamer in his most natural forms. My most apparent obstacle is/was quite clearly myself and the tendency to play video games in my spare time... My most apparent strength, is quite clearly Brews, Weed, and RPG's.

column7: >A bard is only as strong as his companions

column1: Was there ne'er a battle where the countrymen fought with double edged hoes and two handed broom handles, battling the most ferocious foe with sheer will power and courage? Spreading the glorious sounds of The Dawg will always be the most important quest. A Share, a like, a heckling comment, a bold statement at the office, or restaurant, or high school lunch

Let me know what city, small or large, would fancy a live show, because you can bet your ass I'll be there with a fifth of mead and a cheap ass microphone.

Short Summary
Ropeadope Records recording artist Jim Stephens Full Tilt
Boogie Band (JSFTBB) is a funk, jazz, blues, and gospel ensemble with some of the
most accomplished musicians in American music featured and with guest
appearances. Led by the compositions, production, and song writing of lap steel player, guitarist, and harmonica virtuoso, Jim
Stephens, the band features touring and studio musicians from bands as diverse
as<sup>:</sup> Bad Brains, Aretha Franklin , Ms. Lauren Hill, Teena Maria, Sun Ra Arkestra
to Billy Joel’s band to LL Cool J and Nina Simone’s band, and many more. It's truly an all-world family band.
JSFTBB is recording dual debut releases, ""On Our Way to
Forever"" and ""Philasippiola Soul"" which are 90% completed for Ropeadope Records (Snarky Puppy, Taj Mahal, Dirty Dozen Brass Band, etc...)
Gradually formed in Philadelphia between touring commitments
and Jim’s non-profit work through his own ER3, the band came together for the
first time in 2010 as a unit for an all-star benefit for Haiti Relief, and has been
performing together ever since.
The band consist of:
Jim Stephens: lap steel, guitar, and harmonica

Chuck Treece: Drums

Rah Sungee, Stan Davis, Greg Moore, Jake Dean: bass

Scott Coulter: piano, organ, Rhodes       

Monique Canniere: violin

Greg Moore, Andre Coles, Col. Mike Tyler: Guitar
Winston Byrd: Trumpet, Flugelhorn
Elliott Levin: sax and flute
Jimmy Parker: Sousaphone
Kinyon Lanier, Sarah Kane, Andre Coles, Monique Canniere:
vocals
Lucky Thompson: Drums

Ian Dunlap: Drums

Several guest artists will be gracing the records and contributing from NOLA and beyond as they
become completed and for release. Please check back for updates, perks, and
thank you for any contributions to help bring these albums to the world.
<h3>What We Need &amp
$16,000 to complete 2
debut albums, “Philasippiola Soul” and “On Our Way To Forever.” With 24 tracks
between the two albums, both are 90% complete and will be released
simultaneously.
Approximately half of
the needed funds ($7,500) will go solely to the mixing and mastering process
for both albums.
Of the remaining,
$2,000 are for printing cds – $1,000 per album.
There is
approximately $2,000 left for finishing up the albums between studio time,
musician travel, etc.
There will be $4,500
needed for Public Relations and advertising. If people don’t KNOW about the
music, they can’t support it or see it, right?
If the goal is not
reached, all funds that are donated will go to finishing what can be and mixing
and mastering, with priority going towards completing and releasing any one or
few of several potential singles across genres and formats to generate sales to
generate the needed balance in full. All the while giving the ability to be
getting some songs out there in the meantime.
You will be able to
help a truly unique and all-star band be able to release positive and emotional
and beautiful and dancing and funking music to a world much in need of healing,
through a record label whose reputation is impeccable since its inception.
Also the more we
reach and the better we do, the more we can help others through all of our
non-profit and charity activities. This band really does do the work. All of
us.
In addition to above,
these albums have been sitting unfinished and just longing to be released. Philasippiola Soul is a 15
year in the making album, On Our Way to forever was written and composed within
a few short days the last week of September 2014. And there is a
part two of each still to come. We’ve exhausted everything to date, and we just
want to get them out to people to share our art and hopefully healing with
people.
<h3>Risks &amp
The obstacles are
obviously we need 16k, and we may get $160.00. Then we’re really delayed,
delayed, delayed. That’s really our only obstacle. They’re 90% done and just about to be finished and released.
We’ve literally came
this far on nothing. And managed to squeeze out….well, we can’t even say the
amount to date, and the cooperation from everyone involved has been amazing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our music and Indiegogo campaign with your friends with this link:  http://igg.me/at/ForeverSoul

column4: > Recorded So Far!
column11:
>About Mark

In Soul Searching, Mark Miller stakes his claim on the music that is his birthright, the music he grew up with on the streets of the South Side of Chicago, and the music his father created  (“For Once in My Life,” “Touch Me In The Morning,” “Heaven Help Us All” and a string of other major hits).  But Soul Searching is more than an album.

“It’s been awhile coming.  I grew up with this music, and loved it way before my father was even in my life in any meaningful way.  Our relationship was complicated.  He struggled with a gambling addiction, which took... everything.  And it took me some time to come around to this project, to really claim it on my own terms,” says the singer.

Mark grew up with his sister, mother, and grandparents.  He had a visceral connection to soul music he couldn’t explain until he heard Stevie Wonder’s 1968 single “For Once in My Life” one day and saw Ron Miller's name on the record label.  He would point at the 45 and tell his South Side friends: “That's my dad!”  Less than three hundred miles away in Detroit, his estranged father was creating a catalogue of Soul treasures.  In the 1970’s, the Miller teenagers re-connected with their dad and moved with him to Los Angeles when Motown relocated their headquarters.

Mark’s early career was focused on athletics and acting.  He co-founded both the Reflections Theatre Ensemble in Chicago and The Road Theater Company in Los Angeles where he acted in plays, on television, and in films.  But he always sang, and sang well -- so well that his father would often have Mark sing demos of his songs. In 1994 Mark began singing and performing in Los Angeles clubs, Ron Miller was almost always in the audience until his death in 2007.  

Mark experimented with musical styles over the years, but ultimately surrendered to the sounds he grew up with. 

“I love music, period,” says Mark.  “I started out singing jazz, and I love Sondheim and rock and pop. But I found myself turning every arrangement into Rhythm &
column12:
Blues.  The truth is, that's my heart, and I'm ready to show it to the world.”

From Mark

Hi everyone!  Mark Arthur Miller here, and I would love you to join us in finishing the CD, SOUL SEARCHING!  The album is a tribute to Soul music, with all-new arrangements to classic Soul and Motown hits, songs from my Father’s songbook, and BRAND NEW SONGS written by myself and co-writer Peter Smith.  The CD would also be the completion of the soundtrack for the live stage show “SOUL SEARCHING”!  Read the reviews: Broadway World &
column13:
Music Connection This project is halfway there and what we've done so far is really exciting!  Please check out the Soul Searching EP! We've come a long way, but now we need your help to cross that finish line! 

Where The Money Goes

Many people who have never been involved in making a record are surprised by the work and funds it takes to complete it.  The funding goal is based on what the first half of project cost and all that will need to be accomplished for the finished product to be in your hands.  Also, as in any project, there are extra costs that I will have to take care of.  This budget does not take into account PR costs which are so important in getting your music heard, so anything we raise over our goal will mainly go to that end.

musicians and engineer
important of all) They are some of the best in the biz!

Enjoy The Perks! 

There are some great ones!  Obviously the more you give, the bigger the prize, but every last donation is one I will feel blessed to receive.  Check out the list of PERKS on your right and see how you would like to take part!
Take This Journey With Us

The creation of this album is something we have worked on for a long time -- arranging, writing, producing and performing with a group of artists I have known for years and am proud to call friends and family.  It's something I think you would be proud to be part of!  Come join us!
From Peter
<div><div><div>

I’m very proud to be Musical Director, co-arranger, co-writer and co-producer on this project! Mark has an extremely specific, unique and profound connection to soul music. His story, the story of his show and the story of his album, is one that needs to be seen and heard. The second half of the album— the part yet to be recorded— features not only more revamped arrangements of soul classics (including some by Ron Miller), but also original music in the tradition of Mark’s father, written by Mark and myself. Have a listen on this indie gogo page to the first half of the record and you’ll get a sense of what we are doing. By pre-ordering/supporting, you are making the project happen— straight up! And that includes not just Mark and myself but also Maiya Sykes, Will Artope, Erich Gobel, Laura Mace, Frank Abraham, Jon Stuart, Adam Hawley, Gene Coye and many, many other great musicians who will be gainfully employed and utilized by your support. Thanks for checking it out!
Other Ways You Can Help

The best compliment I can receive is when someone recommends my music to their friends.  A ""Hey, you have to check this music out"" to a friend is every artist's dream.  Helping spread the word to people who would like what I do is the best gift of all!  Let's make some music!
<div>
Thank you all for your support,
Mark

The second half of the album— the part yet to be recorded— features not only more revamped arrangements of soul classics (including some by Ron Miller), but also original music in the tradition of Mark’s father, written by Mark and myself. Have a listen on this indie gogo page to the first half of the record and you’ll get a sense of what we are doing. By pre-ordering/supporting, you are making the project happen— straight up! And that includes not just Mark and myself but also Maiya Sykes, Will Artope, Erich Gobel, Laura Mace, Frank Abraham, Jon Stuart, Adam Hawley, Gene Coye and many, many other great musicians who will be gainfully employed and utilized by your support. Thanks for checking it out!
Other Ways You Can Help

The best compliment I can receive is when someone recommends my music to their friends.  A ""Hey, you have to check this music out"" to a friend is every artist's dream.  Helping spread the word to people who would like what I do is the best gift of all!  Let's make some music!
Thank you all for your support,
Mark",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","LosAngeles, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/soul-searching-the-cd/pica

Bride if you do not know them are one of the first Christian Metal bands to be recognized in their genre of music. Bride was a band for over 30 years and won 4 Dove awards the equivalent of a Grammy. This release 'Show No Mercy"" is long out of print and is being repressed by Blastzone Entertainment for the first time in 30 some years. ""Show No Mercy"" will be released with 11 songs including the demo ""Missing Children"". There will only be 500 copies pressed on mixed vinyl.

Blastzone Entertainment has the rights to release the entire Bride catalog on vinyl over the next 2 years. We are starting with ""Show No Mercy"", ""Live To Die"" and ""Silence Is Madness"".

Show No Mercy is the debut album by the American heavy metal band Bride. It was the band's debut on the label Pure Metal Records. Less commercial than Bride's later works, the album received a mixed reception in its time, as it was somewhat
more extreme and darker than many Christian releases coming out at the
time.
The band line-up for this album was:
Dale Thompson: vocals Steve Osborne: lead guitar Troy Thompson:

guitar, keyboards, violin Scott Hall: bass Stephan Rolland: drums


For more information on this release or any future releases please contact Blastzone Entertainment at blastzoneentertainment@yahoo.com

column5: >Do you like music? Are you looking for exclusive music? Or simply do you work into

column1: the world of music?
Loverbeat.com is your site, it’s the biggest social network it has never been created for
fans of any kind of music, or for people who work in the music world like djs, radio
stations, booking agencies, producers, singers, events promoters, labels, ...
Do you know Youtube, Soundcloud, Mixcloud, Beatport, Resident Advisor, Facebook,
Twitter and other social nets? Now you can mix the best things of them and you’ll have
Loverbeat.com.
That's not all, furthermore, you’ll have tens of novelties that you won’t find in other sites,
all in only one social net... Your videos, your music and a lot more...
A site where you can manage your career as an artist and communicate directly with
people in musical industry, who you are looking for, a site where you can sell and earn
money with your music.
<div>
You can also share your tutorial videos, upload your podcast or broadcast your lives
and/or radio shows in live, in addition to send your demos by video or by audio to the
labels, and to create your own lists in order to send your promos and receive some
feedbacks. You can also upload your press kit and you can configurate all this with just
some clicks!
<div>
Are you an agency? Perfect! We also are the solution. You can receive booking requests
directly in your e-mail and manage your artists’ gigs quickly, even you can publish all
your artists dates in your profile so that everybody can see them.
Are you, maybe, an events promoter or a club’s owner? In Loverbeat.com you can
announce your events free of charge and make them public for all musical community.
Everybody, in the musical industry, has a place in Loverbeat.com, a social network or
rather a tool by which you can be informed about the last newness of your favourite
artists and about everything is happening around you.
In conclusion, you can communicate with whoever you want, listen to the best music
and take your business or your musical career to the next level.
Loverbeat.com is even a tool by which you can sell your own music as an independent
producer or label without intermediaries, directly to your account.
Are you an amateur or do you simply love music? You are lucky! Loverbeat.com will
give you the possibility of downloading a lot of free music, 100% exclusive from
independent producers, or getting a lot of this music with low prices. You can create
your own favourite artists and songs playlists and listen to them wherever you want...
Do you think it is not enough? Well, we have another surprise
interacting in Loverbeat.com you’ll win some points which will be accumulated so that
you can buy free music, even you can obtain free Premium accounts!
<div>
INVESTMENT FIGURE
<div>
For Premium users there are many other advantages, including to obtain your own
space in the cloud where you can receive demos, promos, or simply share private music
with your friends.
As you can see, all this and more, you can do it in the same site...it’s not necessary to
be in five or six webs at the same time. Furthermore, Loverbeat.com will allow you to
include and import quickly your videos and audios from other websites.
We have many others utilities and characteristics for the web which we won’t reveal by
the moment in order to keep our privacy project. We shall update them from time to
time and we will give the opportunity to try to everyone who wants to contribute to this
ambitious project.
We will design a special wall in the website where the names or the pseudonyms of
everybody who wants collaborate with us will be included, furthermore they will have
an exclusive access to the web before its launch so that you can try it and contribute
with your ideas.
We will give monthly Premium accounts, anual accounts or accounts for life to many
collaborators, according to their contribution.
And some presents like cups, T-shirts, and power bank.
All this and more in Loverbeat.com.
If you want to be a partner of loverbeat.com, please visit www.loverbeat.com or send a email to info@loverbeat.com

Who is Jimmy Willden?
Jimmy Willden, award-winning writer, filmmaker and songwriter, returns after a six-year hiatus with his brand new CD, ""Melodies of the Aftermath - THE EP"" released DEC. 16, 2014!

The journey through that long hiatus included personal struggles and set backs that directly influenced and inspired Willden. In return, the songs that came from that period of upheaval are some of his most accomplished, and most intimate.

But of course, that journey started somewhere. For Willden, it began with the release of his debut album ""Beginnings"" at fourteen. Since then, he has released four solo albums, two EPs, toured the western half of U.S., and attracted the attention of MTV, with one of his songs making it onto the soundtrack of the popular dating show, 'Next'.

In his spare time, Willden has also founded the #ccsongwriters group in Corpus Christi, and has written and directed a handful of award-winning films.

 Willden is ready to share his new music with you, AND NOW, with the release of ""Melodies of the Aftermath-THE EP"", Willden plans to hit the road to promote the new record, and that's what this campaign is for, and this is why YOU are so important!
The Tour

Hey guys! This is Jimmy...I wanted to let you know about the specifics of the 'Melodies of the Aftermath' (MOTA) Tour! This summer, I will be hitting the road, beginning in late-May of this year, traveling to 10 states and 16 cities all throughout the eastern half of the Unites States. The tour begins May 25 in Oklahoma City, then I will travel back down through several cities in Texas (Dallas, Austin, Corpus Christi). In June, I’ll be off to Nashville, Tennessee, followed by Indianapolis, Indiana
column6: Washington, D.C. and finally, New York (New York City and Seacliff).

column1: The last time I hit the road for a national tour was 9 years ago (2006) with fellow songwriters David Martinez (Corpus Christi, TX) and Hope Cassity (Nashville, TN). The tour was highly successful, leading to several contacts and opportunities for me for the next few years, including signing a licensing contract with MTV to use my songs in the soundtracks of several of their television shows.

This time, I plan to include a major radio and in-store promotional tour in the midst of the show dates, to further promote the tour, the music, and my brand. And I hope you guys support the journey! :)
The Campaign
For 30 days, we will be running this campaign to raise the initial funds needed to hit the road for over a month. In total, I will need $2,500 for the trip.
The total would go directly to  the travel expenses needed for the entire 5,400 mile trek (including gas, lodging and food) and tour marketing materials (posters, stickers, t-shirts, etc.)

In return for your extremely generous donations toward our goal, we have some FANTASTIC PERKS lined up for you, including exclusive digital downloads, access to a password-protected TOUR BLOG, signed copies of our EP and t-shirts, etc...and MY FAVORITE PERK: THE TOUR BOOKLET (At the end of the tour, I will be making special scrapbooks for our
dedicated supporters and fans (such as you, for their loving
contribution), that will lay out the whole adventure from beginning to end.
The Impact

The whole point of planning this extremely grass-roots, independently-built music tour is continue the overall goals I have for my musical career over the next five years. 2015 is the beginning of a five year process where I will continue to travel, record, travel, record and work as hard as I can to push my music as far as it will go.
With your help, and your amazing support, I can succeed at achieving these goals.
The Beyond
If you feel moved to donate, check out the perks. We happen to think
they're pretty cool. But also, think about sharing this with all those
other righteously awesome people you know. The more people who hear

about me and my little dream of traveling These United States of America to get my music heard, the more difference it makes. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to support the success of the 'Melodies of the Aftermath' Summer 2015 US Tour, and helping me take that next step! - JIMMY

column14: > is a well known Latvian rock singer, and several of his songs have become Latvian rock classics.

column1: Now, Jānis Bukums returns to rock scene with his new project: eponymous ""JĀNIS BUKUMS"" and new album ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" (Alive and Different). The album release event happened on 26th of March 2015 and the album is now available in all physical and digital music stores. Album contains 10 original compositions with Latvian lyrics and original cover version of Radiohead's ""Creep"".

The album consists of both current impressions as well as memories and life stories of Jānis Bukums, a sort of a résumé. It was and is true rock music: good and alive, honest and powerful. Even after many years of silence true rockers return – alive and different!
What We've Done So Far?

Currently we have recorded album ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" (Alive and Different) in Latvian, and shot 2 music videos, one of which is for our original cover version of Radiohead's ""Creep"". We are working on our second album, preparing for summer tours, and working on English version of album ""Alive and Different"".

What Is This About?

The goal of this campaign is to record and release ""Alive and Different"" for international audiences, by recording the songs with English lyrics.

column5: >Since ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" has been a local success, we feel the necessity to break down the language barrier and convey Jānis Bukums message and life story across international audiences by re-recording ""Alive and Different"" in English.

column1: We are currently working with experienced English native speaking lyricist to not simply translate songs, but to transform them so that the original message and feeling is preserved, so that you, the listener, may experience it as intended.

column5: >The finished album will be released as a separate entity from the original, with unique extras not found in the original album.

column1: Where Your Contribution Goes

<div>This project's expenses are: recording studio expenses, participation of guest artists already present in the Latvian version, rent of gear and studio time, consultant fees, campaign fees and fees associated with registering and distributing the album in digital stores, as well as rights management, which<span style=""background-color: initial
column3: > brings the budget to approximately $8000. We have successfully managed to keep our expenses surprisingly low, and so far maximised
column4: > the investment to return ratio in terms of social reach and popularity.

column1: <ul>
What You Get

All contributors will receive the finished English version of the album ""Alive and Different"". Additional perks such as videos and photos from ""making of"" in the studio will be available with the Digipak perk. We are open to cooperation with those who wish to contribute more, and have done mutually beneficial deals in the past with local beneficiaries (your business or name heavily featured in all media and public events).

The Impact

Completion of this campaign will result in a music album that successfully conveys Jānis Bukums life story to international audiences, and we have barely scratched the surface with this release. We are already working on our second album.

Spread the word! You are always welcome to share our message with the world by any means at your disposal! Also, contact us on info@janisbukums.com if you have interesting offers, ideas for cooperation or would just like to drop a line! We are open to offers from festivals, bands, labels, music agencies and record labels.
www.janisbukums.com
www.facebook.com/janisbukumsband
www.twitter.com/janisbukums
www.instagram.com/janis.bukums
www.youtube.com/c/janisbukums
","Short Summary
Jānis Bukums is a well known Latvian rock singer, and several of his songs have become Latvian rock classics.

Now, Jānis Bukums returns to rock scene with his new project: eponymous ""JĀNIS BUKUMS"" and new album ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" (Alive and Different). The album release event happened on 26th of March 2015 and the album is now available in all physical and digital music stores. Album contains 10 original compositions with Latvian lyrics and original cover version of Radiohead's ""Creep"".

The album consists of both current impressions as well as memories and life stories of Jānis Bukums, a sort of a résumé. It was and is true rock music: good and alive, honest and powerful. Even after many years of silence true rockers return – alive and different!
What We've Done So Far?

Currently we have recorded album ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" (Alive and Different) in Latvian, and shot 2 music videos, one of which is for our original cover version of Radiohead's ""Creep"". We are working on our second album, preparing for summer tours, and working on English version of album ""Alive and Different"".   What Is This About? The goal of this campaign is to record and release ""Alive and Different"" for international audiences, by recording the songs with English lyrics.

Since ""Dzīvs un Savādāks"" has been a local success, we feel the necessity to break down the language barrier and convey Jānis Bukums message and life story across international audiences by re-recording ""Alive and Different"" in English.

We are currently working with experienced English native speaking lyricist to not simply translate songs, but to transform them so that the original message and feeling is preserved, so that you, the listener, may experience it as intended.
The finished album will be released as a separate entity from the original, with unique extras not found in the original album.
Where Your Contribution Goes

This project's expenses are: recording studio expenses, participation of guest artists already present in the Latvian version, rent of gear and studio time, consultant fees, campaign fees and fees associated with registering and distributing the album in digital stores, as well as rights management, which brings the budget to approximately $8000. We have successfully managed to keep our expenses surprisingly low, and so far maximised the investment to return ratio in terms of social reach and popularity.
What You Get

All contributors will receive the finished English version of the album ""Alive and Different"". Additional perks such as videos and photos from ""making of"" in the studio will be available with the Digipak perk. We are open to cooperation with those who wish to contribute more, and have done mutually beneficial deals in the past with local beneficiaries (your business or name heavily featured in all media and public events).

The Impact Completion of this campaign will result in a music album that successfully conveys Jānis Bukums life story to international audiences, and we have barely scratched the surface with this release. We are already working on our second album.
Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! You are always welcome to share our message with the world by any means at your disposal! Also, contact us on info@janisbukums.com if you have interesting offers, ideas for cooperation or would just like to drop a line! We are open to offers from festivals, bands, labels, music agencies and record labels.
www.janisbukums.com
www.facebook.com/janisbukumsband
www.twitter.com/janisbukums
www.instagram.com/janis.bukums
www.youtube.com/c/janisbukums",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Rīga, Latvia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/janis-bukums-alive-and-different/pica

column5: >Imagine if you'd had more support when you were younger.
column9:
>What might you have achieved?

If you are a young person who has no support, no family, if you are abused or neglected, homeless or poor, imagine how much more that support might help.

That is what we offer.

were astounded by the amount of talent and enthusiasm that we found
here.
all ages gigs for young bands to play at and gain experience. It also
gave people who lived in the area, no matter what their age the
chance to hear what was going on around them.
grow, and now, we feel the best way to serve the young musicians we
work with is to take the project to the next step and form our very
own label, XYZ RECORDS.
This will enable us to
take young aspiring musicians through the entire creative process,
from writing the song, to recording the song to distributing the
song. The whole time, the young people involved will be completely involved in the process,
learning along the way, whilst keeping complete control over their
own creations and helping to run the label itself.
BUT we need your help
to make this happen.
XYZ is a volunteer run
organization with a staff of, uh, one (that would be me) and up until this point, I have been very willingly putting my hand in my own pocket.
Now though, with the initial
costs needed to set up an independent label, we don’t have the funds
to cover the initial outlay.
And how much is that
initial outlay? How much will it cost to set up this social
enterprise, completely unique independent label?
That’s it. $2000
dollars.
This will cover our
initial recording costs (we work lo-fi and we work efficiently) and physical printing of CD’s, posters,
badges as well as the administrative fees for online sales.
It’s not much in the
great scheme of things, but it would enable us to empower, encourage

and possibly change the lives of a great many young people.

We believe that what we are attempting is pretty unique in the
world

of their own music.<div style=""text-align: center
We don’t know if this
has ever been done before and we would like, with your help to make
it a reality.
We have the business
plan. We have the talent. We have the enthusiasm.
We’re ready to go,
all we need are the resources to start.
If you can, please dig deep and help these young people take control of their own music, their own passions and their own lives.
PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!PERKS!
Of course,
we here at XYZ KNOW that kindness and generosity of spirit are their own
reward… but we’d be FOOLS to live by that on a crowd funding campaign, wouldn’t
So we’ve
got LOADS of fantastic PERKS for digging deep and helping us build this mini empire.
Of course,
being a music label, we want to reward you with free music, free albums and, if
you donate over a MILLION dollars we will personally play at every birth,
birthday, wedding, funeral, graduation and/or bar mitzvah you or your loved
ones should EVER have in your lifetime!
Short of
the million we would very sincerely like to thank you by offering free digital
singles, free digital albums and even the chance to have a lifetime membership
of free CD’s from XYZ.
We also
have a range of T-Shirts we’re putting together for you lucky, lucky people (<i>so
you can wear them around town and show all the cool kids that you were into XYZ
waaay before they were) as well as a collection of posters (so you can stick
them up on your bedroom wall and show all the cool kids that you were into XYZ
waaay before they were) and an awesome collection of band badges (so you can
stick them on your face and show all the cool kids in town that you had lost
your mind waaay before they did).
Most of
all, we just want to offer you the chance to be a part of something important that will make a MASSIVE difference to the lives of many kids for a long time to come.
The names of ALL those who donated will be included
within our Charter and will be framed and hung on the wall in eternal honour of
your kindness. We will daily salute it, sing our pledge allegiance (it sounds a bit like the Ghostbusters Theme but with much more swearing)  and, when appropriate we shall dance in
a rather uncoordinated fashion to hits of the eighties whilst chanting your
names alphabetically.
The footage
of these sessions will be available on youtube and can be viewed at
a very reasonable price.
<h2>THE FUTURE!
THE FUTURE! THE FUTURE! THE FUTURE! THE FUTURE!
We’re not sure what the future holds, but we
think it looks a little bit like this
Scary, no?
For XYZ,
the future means always moving forward and with the forming of XYZ RECORDS, we
know we’re moving in the right direction. We want to be able to provide
whatever the young people we work with need
column2: to help them grow, find new ways out of bad situations, do for themselves

column1: and gain a sense of worth and meaning in what they do.
We also
want to help them melt people’s faces with the sheer awesomeness of their music
(sorry, didn’t want to get too maudlin there).
I know how
hard these young people work at what they do and I know how good the results of
those efforts are. XYZ RECORDS will enable us to show the rest of the world
this too. So check the pitch, check the perks, take a couple more minutes
looking at the dancing GIF (hypnotic, isn’t it?), then, please dig deep and be a part
of something that really matters.

column3:
/>

Questions? You have questions? Go for it...

column1: What happens if you don't reach your campaign goal?

Well, firstly we will openly weep. 
But then once we've pulled ourselves together, we will carry on regardless. We very much preach a 'do it yourself' philosophy through this program and part of that, is facing adversity and carrying on regardless (while we're on the subject, how much does a kidney sell for these days?) 
In all seriousness though, we will just have to work on a much smaller scale, using whatever funds we do receive and using this whole experience as a learning tool for the young people involved and finding ways to make it work in future. We don't really have the option here to just stop and say, oh well. This label is too important.

What is the money actually for?

We want to be able to better maintain the studio space we have, providing young people at risk a secure and safe place to regularly go. 
We are looking to release the recordings we already have as a physical and digital product. This requires costs for printing and online administration (subscription fees and such). 
Your money will procure us ongoing resources to put on our ALL AGES GIGS regularly, where young musicians can gain experience and self worth, whilst those not playing have somewhere meaningful to go and something meaningful to participate in. 
This is grass roots stuff. We're not looking for the most polished product here or to compete with Iggy azalea (although i look FABulous in hot pants). We are looking for raw, unpolished talent, energy and enthusiasm and we've got that by the bucketload.

Is 2000 dollars going to be enough?

Absolutely. This budget has been measured out to the dollar to accommodate for the first three releases of the label (as well as the accompanying All Ages shows), allowing us then the latitude to promote, record, recoup our costs and proceed with the next portion of our releases.
Of course, more will always help. The more funds we raise, the more we can help our young people. So if you see that amount hit $2000, please don't stop as the more you give, the more we can do.

Who the hell are you?

My name is Richard. Nice to meet'cha :)

I'm a 40 year old dad of two boys who works as a co-ordinator in the healthcare industry by day and tries to crowd fund social enterprising, independent record labels by night. I spend every minute outside of my day job helping the young people of my area and listening to their stories, their problems and their amazing music. 
I have played music all my life and know first hand the difference music can make to a young persons life. I started the XYZ project to help the huge amount of young people i've seen here in the Blue Mountains feel supported, encouraged and accepted through music, allowing me the privilege of listening to their music first hand, being able to help them realise it and being allowed the gift of seeing who they really are.

Why 'Flexible Funding?'

Because, no matter what, we're going to make and release these young musicians tunes!
However much we make, it is ALL going to go towards this label, EVERY cent and come hell or high water (whatever that means) we're going to see these young bands through the entire process.
So, when will this label actually start?
Unofficially? We're already running all the behind the scenes shenanigans and administrative duties and will continue to do so up until the cut off date.
Officially? The second the campaign finishes and we tally up what we've made. Then we'll know exactly where we stand and we'll be hitting the ground running.

","Imagine if you'd had more support when you were younger.What might you have achieved?If you are a young person who has no support, no family, if you are abused or neglected, homeless or poor, imagine how much more that support might help.That is what we offer.18 months ago, we
started a music program called XYZ in the Blue Mountains of New South
Wales to support and encourage 12 to 21 year old's through the writing, rehearsing and recording of their own music. In an area with high youth unemployment,
high drug use and very few resources dedicated to young people, we
were astounded by the amount of talent and enthusiasm that we found
here. The program expanded to arranging local,
all ages gigs for young bands to play at and gain experience. It also
gave people who lived in the area, no matter what their age the
chance to hear what was going on around them.
The project has continued to
grow, and now, we feel the best way to serve the young musicians we
work with is to take the project to the next step and form our very
own label, XYZ RECORDS.
This will enable us to
take young aspiring musicians through the entire creative process,
from writing the song, to recording the song to distributing the
song. The whole time, the young people involved will be completely involved in the process,
learning along the way, whilst keeping complete control over their
own creations and helping to run the label itself.
BUT we need your help
to make this happen.
XYZ is a volunteer run
organization with a staff of, uh, one (that would be me) and up until this point, I have been very willingly putting my hand in my own pocket.
Now though, with the initial
costs needed to set up an independent label, we don’t have the funds
to cover the initial outlay.
And how much is that
initial outlay? How much will it cost to set up this social
enterprise, completely unique independent label?
$2000 dollars.
That’s it. $2000
dollars.
This will cover our
initial recording costs (we work lo-fi and we work efficiently) and physical printing of CD’s, posters,
badges as well as the administrative fees for online sales.
It’s not much in the
great scheme of things, but it would enable us to empower, encourage
and possibly change the lives of a great many young people.We believe that what we are attempting is pretty unique in the
world

Who We Are

<div>The Fair Trade Chamber Music Society was founded in 2015 by musicians dedicated to performing a broad range of chamber music for diverse audiences and in non-traditional settings.  Inspired by the Fair Trade social movement, we believe that by fairly compensating musicians for their artistic endeavors, we will increase the value of the music being performed and therefore help secure a place for classical music in today’s society and increase its sustainability.<span style=""background-color: initial

We are particularly passionate about creating accessible programs for young audiences that are designed to engage and ignite budding classical music lovers. We are working to secure special funding for educational performances to enable us to reach all interested young audiences.

","Who We Are

The Fair Trade Chamber Music Society was founded in 2015 by musicians dedicated to performing a broad range of chamber music for diverse audiences and in non-traditional settings.  Inspired by the Fair Trade social movement, we believe that by fairly compensating musicians for their artistic endeavors, we will increase the value of the music being performed and therefore help secure a place for classical music in today’s society and increase its sustainability.

We are particularly passionate about creating accessible programs for young audiences that are designed to engage and ignite budding classical music lovers. We are working to secure special funding for educational performances to enable us to reach all interested young audiences.
Our Tour

In late July 2015, the Fair Trade Trio (the founding musicians of the Fair Trade Chamber Music Society) will be touring the Pacific Northwest. We're thrilled to have booked concerts in Vancouver, Victoria, Portland, and Seattle, including an educational performance.
How You Can Help
We need to raise $3,500* to cover the cost of our tour. Your contribution will help us fund:
Plane tickets (including a fourth ticket for Dmitri, the cello!)
On-the-ground transportation (gas, ferries, etc.)
Hotels in Vancouver and Victoria
Rehearsals (we compensate our musicians for their time!)
Every dollar brings us closer to our goal, and we're so grateful for contributions at every level!
Can't make a donation but want to support our tour? Share a link to this page on social media and help us spread the word!
*Any funds raised beyond the $3,500 for the tour will support our upcoming 2015/2016 season.
Please note that contributions to the Fair Trade Chamber Music Society are not tax-deductible.",2.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","United States, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fair-trade-trio-west-coast-tour/pica

L.A.W. (LYRICAL ASSAULT WEAPON)
WHAT'S UP WORLD! IT'S L.A.W. (LYRICAL ASSAULT WEAPON). I HAVE BEEN DOING MUSIC FOR ALMOST 20 YEARS NOW. I AM VERY GOOD AT WHAT I DO, AND MUSIC HAS ALWAYS BEEN MY GREATEST PASSION. I HAVE ALWAYS WRITTEN MY OWN LYRICS, AND I EVEN PRODUCE ALOT OF MY OWN TRACKS AS WELL. IV'E COMPOSED THE MAJORITY OF MY WORKS, AS WELL AS WRITE LYRICS FOR OTHER ARTISTS. IV'E RELEASED 4 MIXTAPES ON WWW.DATPIFF.COM , INCLUDING BY TITLE, ""THE BARRY SANDERS OF RAP"", ""N.O.2 THE BONE"", "" N.S.B. (NO SLEEP BOYZ) COMPILATION"", AND ""BLACK AND GOLD"". IV'E ALSO WORKED WITH SOME GREAT ARTISTS SUCH AS, DJ ICE MIKE OF THE DEFINITION DJ'S, WHO HOSTED 2 OF MY 4 MIXTAPES, CITYWIDE SOZAI, RICH GANG, THE GHETTO TWINS, BLACK MENACE, THE LATE TIM SMOOTH, BOOT CAMP CLICC, AND MANY OTHERS. I HAVE ALSO ALWAYS RECIEVED GOOD RESPONSES TO MY MUSIC, AND I HAVE INDEPENDENTLY GENERATED A VERY GOOD FAN BASE, WHICH I WOULD LIKE TO SEE GROW IN GREAT NUMBERS IN THE NEXT 2 YEARS OR SO.  IV'E WON NUMEROUS OPEN MIC CONTEST LOCALLY, AND IV'E HAD ENCORE APPLAUSES IN ALMOST EVERY LIVE PERFORMANCE IV'E DONE, AND NOT JUST TO TOOT MY OWN HORN, BUT I HAVE STOLEN THE SHOW AT ALMOST EVERY PERFORMANCE I HAVE GIVEN, EVEN WHEN I HAVE OPENED UP FOR MAJOR ACTS, SUCH AS, LIL FLIP, THE HOT BOYS, AND DJ JUBILEE, I ALWAYS RECIEVED A STANDING OVATION. IV'E ALSO RELEASED AND DIRECTED MY OWN VIDEOS ON MY YOUTUBE CHANNEL AND GENERATED BETWEEN 5,000 AND 40,000 VIEWS ON MY VIDEOS WITHOUT RECEIVING 1 DISLIKE OR ANY NEGATIVE FEEDBACK WHICH IN MY OPINION IS AN ABSOLUTE GREAT FETE TO ACCOMPLISH.
FOR THOSE WHOM HAVE NEVER HEARD OF ME, OR HAVE NEVER HAD THE PLEASURE TO HEAR ANY OF MY MUSIC, I CAN BE FOUND ON REVERBNATION, SOUNDCLOUD, UNITED MUSIC, TWITTER FACEBOOK, AND OF COURSE MY YOUTUBE CHANNEL. IV'E OFTEN BEEN COMPARED TO ARTIST SUCH AS, TUPAC SHAKUR, DMX, RAKIM, AND NAS, BECAUSE OF MY INFLUENTIAL CONTENT. IV'E ALSO BEEN COMPLIMENTED BY MANY OF MY FANS IN SAYING THAT, WITH THE RIGHT PEOPLE BEHIND ME, I COULD BE RANKED AMONGST THE BEST TO EVER DO IT LIKE, JAY-Z, NOTORIOUS B.I.G., AND MYSTIKAL, WHICH IS ABSOLUTELY GREAT COMPLIMENTS TO RECEIVE, AND IS ALSO THE REASON I NEED YOUR HELP!
WHY I NEED YOUR HELP!!
RELEASING A REAL RECORD/ ALBUM INDEPENDENTLY CAN BE REALLY EXPENSIVE, AND I DON'T HAVE THE ACCESSIBLE FUNDS THAT IT TAKES TO RELEASE AN ALBUM EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY, AS WOULD BE NEEDED TO CONTEND WITH SUCH A LARGE NUMBER OF ARTISTS THAT IS IN THE RAP/ HIP-HOP GENRE NATION WIDE. I AM VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT I DO, AND MY REASONS FOR EXPOSURE GOES WAY BEYOND FAME AND FORTUNE. MY PASSION IS EMBRACED IN HEALING AND COMPASSIONATELY TOUCHING THE HEARTS AND MINDS OF FANS ALL OVER THE WORLD. I WANT TO USE MY GOD-GIVEN TALENTS TO SPEAK COMFORT AND LOVE TO ALL WHO WOULD LISTEN, AND EVERYTHING I DO IS FROM MY SPIRIT WITHIN, AND EVERYONE WHO KNOWS ME CAN ATTEST TO THIS TRUTH. I DESIRE GREATLY TO TAKE MY CAREER TO THE NEXT LEVEL. I'M GETTING OLDER, I HAVE 2 SMALL CHILDREN THAT I'M RAISING, AND I WOULD LOVE NOTHING MORE THAN TO HAVE MY DREAMS BECOME A REALITY WITH YOUR HELP, WHICH WILL ALSO GIVE ME A GREATER ABILITY TO PURSUE MY DREAMS, AS WELL AS BE A GREATER PROVIDER AS A FATHER TO MY LITTLE ONES. IV'E ALWAYS BEEN A PERSON WHO GOES OUT AND WORKS HARD TOWARD MY GOALS AND DREAMS, AND I HAVE NEVER BEEN THE TYPE OF PERSON TO JUST SIT BACK AND LOOK FOR HANDOUTS FROM ANYONE. I'M A FIRM BELIEVER IN THE OLE SAYING, ""IF YOU DON'T WORK, THEN YOU DON'T EAT"". AND YES IT IS TRUE, THAT MY HARD WORK HAS PAID OFF AND ALLOWED ME TO MAKE SOME POSITIVE STRIDES, BUT REACHING THE NEXT LEVEL CAN BE VERY CHALLENGING. A VERY HIGH MOUNTAIN TO CLIMB! IV'E COME TO LEARN NO ONE CAN DO IT ALONE, AND EVERYONE NEEDS HELP SOMETIMES, AND WITHOUT YOUR HELP THIS RECORD MAY NEVER BECOME A REALITY.
MY GOAL
MY GOAL FOR THIS CAMPAIGN IS  $7,000.00, BUT THIS GOAL IS JUST TO BE ABLE TO GIVE ME THE ABILITY TO COVER THE MAJOR EXPENSES THAT IT TAKES TO BE EFFECTIVE AS AN ARTIST IN SUCH A COMPETITIVE FIELD.  I SAY WITH CONFIDENCE THAT, I AM ONE OF THE BEST AT WHAT I DO, BUT  IT TAKES FINANCIAL ABILITY TO PUT TOGETHER A GOOD PROMOTIONAL BLUE PRINT, AS WELL AS A PROFESSIONAL, VISUAL, AND APPEALING PROJECT. MY ARTISTRY SPEAKS FOR ITSELF, BUT I NEED THE ABILITY TO REACH A GREATER AUDIENCE , AND BUILD A BIGGER FAN BASE.
THIS IS WHAT MY CAMPAIGN WILL COVER, WITH THE HELP OF YOUR GENEROSITY WHICH WILL GREATLY BE APPRECIATED
1. RECORDING WITH PROFESSIONAL MIXING AND MASTERING
2. PROMOTION/ VIDEOS, INTERVIEWS, PHOTO SHOOTS, ETC.
3. WEBSITE
4. DISTRIBUTION 
5. PRESSING
6. DESIGNS/ ARTWORK
7.PROMOTIONAL TOOLS AND MATERIAL 
WHAT DO YOU GET IN RETURN??
APART FROM MY MOST HUMBLE APPRECIATION AND GRATITUDE, I WILL ALSO BE GIVING AWAY AUTOGRAPHED ORIGINAL WRITTEN LYRICS TO YOUR FAVORITE SONG. I WILL ALSO  BE DOING PERSONAL SHOUT OUTS IN INTERVIEWS , AS WELL AS ON SOCIAL MEDIA SITES, SUCH AS TWITTER AND FACEBOOK. AND FOR MY SUPPORTERS WHO ARE ALSO IN THE MUSIC INDUSTRY, I WILL BE DOING FREE FEATURES WITH YOU , AND EVEN A REMIX WITH YOU ON YOUR FAVORITE SONG IV'E PREVIOUSLY RECORDED. THAT'S RIGHT!! A FEATURE OF YOU ON YOUR FAVORITE L.A.W. ( LYRICAL ASSAULT WEAPON) SONG! I WILL ALSO HAVE YOUR NAME LISTED ON THE INSIDE COVER OF THE ALBUM. AND NOT ONLY WILL YOU HAVE A NEW FAVORITE ARTIST, BUT ALSO A FRIEND. I DON'T THINK I'M BETTER THAN ANYONE, OR TOO GOOD TO TALK  TO ANYONE. WE ARE ALL EQUALLY GOD'S CHILDREN IN MY OPINION.
I KNOW EVERYONE CAN'T FINANCIALLY AFFORD TO CONTRIBUTE, BUT YOU CAN STILL ASSIST ME IN MAKING THIS CAMPAIGN A SUCCESS BY SHARING IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY. PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN ON YOUR TWITTER, FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, OR ANY WAY THAT YOU CAN. I WILL GREATLY APPRECIATE ANY HELP THAT YOU CAN PROVIDE.
TO HEAR MY PAST  WORKS OR EVEN SOME EXCLUSIVE  CONTENT  FROM ME, LOG ON TO:

column8: >Hello, we are Friends of Kegger, a relatively new non-profit organization based here in the Imperial Valley. We are here to ask you for your help in making our first major fundraiser a reality. Lupepalooza Chuckfest is a music festival featuring local musicians to raise money for at least one scholarship for a music major at Imperial Valley College. The event is named in honor of our fallen brothers Guadalupe Espinoza de los Monteros and Carlos Alberto Gerardo Cital, who passed away 10 years ago due to a car accident. As you can see, i
column15: >t has taken us too many years to make Lupepalooza Chuckfest a reality.

column1: <span style=""font-size: 16px
column6: >Lupepalooza Chuckfest was originally scheduled to be on January 31, 2015, which would have been the day after the 10 year anniversary of the car accident that took their lives, but the venue that had agreed (in September) to host the event (at no cost to us) underwent a change of management. We are now asking our friends, families, and community members to help us raise money to secure a new venue for this event. We hope that this event will become an annual event, that will not only help us raise money for scholarships for local students, but will also showcase local musicians.

column3: >We already have commitments from seven local bands and musicians who will be donating their talents for our inaugural Lupepalooza Chuckfest! All money raised, up to $500 will be used to secure a venue for the festival. If we are able to raise more than $500, we will attempt find a bigger venue for the event. If we are able to secure a venue for less than the amount of funds raised, then any money left over would be used for any equipment the venue does not provide for the event or added to the scholarship amount we award.
column4: >We are confident that if we do not meet our $500 goal we will still be able to put on the event, but on a smaller scale. In a smaller venue. And we will still follow through with the perks we listed for those of you that contribute to our campaign.
column5:
>So, please help us make our Lupepalooza Chuckfest a reality and a success. Help us make at least one Imperial Valley College student's college experience a little more affordable. Please share this campaign with all your friends and family. 
Thank you,
Friends of Kegger

","Hello, we are Friends of Kegger, a relatively new non-profit organization based here in the Imperial Valley. We are here to ask you for your help in making our first major fundraiser a reality. Lupepalooza Chuckfest is a music festival featuring local musicians to raise money for at least one scholarship for a music major at Imperial Valley College. The event is named in honor of our fallen brothers Guadalupe Espinoza de los Monteros and Carlos Alberto Gerardo Cital, who passed away 10 years ago due to a car accident. As you can see, it has taken us too many years to make Lupepalooza Chuckfest a reality.

column1: Lupepalooza Chuckfest was originally scheduled to be on January 31, 2015, which would have been the day after the 10 year anniversary of the car accident that took their lives, but the venue that had agreed (in September) to host the event (at no cost to us) underwent a change of management. We are now asking our friends, families, and community members to help us raise money to secure a new venue for this event. We hope that this event will become an annual event, that will not only help us raise money for scholarships for local students, but will also showcase local musicians.

We already have commitments from seven local bands and musicians who will be donating their talents for our inaugural Lupepalooza Chuckfest! All money raised, up to $500 will be used to secure a venue for the festival. If we are able to raise more than $500, we will attempt find a bigger venue for the event. If we are able to secure a venue for less than the amount of funds raised, then any money left over would be used for any equipment the venue does not provide for the event or added to the scholarship amount we award.We are confident that if we do not meet our $500 goal we will still be able to put on the event, but on a smaller scale. In a smaller venue. And we will still follow through with the perks we listed for those of you that contribute to our campaign. So, please help us make our Lupepalooza Chuckfest a reality and a success. Help us make at least one Imperial Valley College student's college experience a little more affordable. Please share this campaign with all your friends and family. Thank you,Friends of Kegger",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Tony Atlas Experience:  March 25th!
column5: >As Tony has faced possibile foreclosure on his home this winter, the challenge of this installment of our growing Studio Shoot Interview series is to be able to produce as much original content as possible with Tony Atlas (and others in the series) so he can tell the story of his career his way, through his own eyes.  It's imperative to have professional wrestling history documented beyond WWE's vision and story of it.  Ideally, we'd like to have Tony with us in three or four different sessions (we've already filmed est. four and a half hours in December &amp
column6:
February). This is a chance for fans and wrestlers alike to have wrestling history produced in a different style. With more and more of the wrestling brotherhood passing away younger and younger, their own unique stories, opinions and experiences go along with them.

We have a proven track record of over a dozen studio shoot interview-style documentaries produced, seen by millions around the world and the Howard Stern Show! We sincerely look forward to your support to continuing that success and growing the series.


What We Need &

column1: • To produce our Tony Atlas Experience video, there are appearance fees, travel and hotel accommodations.
• Along with talent, we have our own equipment needs, building the studio set, rentals, staffing, printing, advertising and every tiny cost that can add up big!
• Fans participating in this endeavor will be rewarded with awesome, interactive rewards and perks!
Make An Impact!

WWE Hall of Famer.  Bodybuilding Hall of Famer.  Half of the first African American WWE Tag Team Champions.  A career and life filled with the highest of highs, the lowest of lows and everywhere in between around the world!
If everyone that watched our Tony Atlas sitdown studio shoot Christmas night donated just a dollar, we'd be more than funded to have this project continue!
Other Ways You Can Help!
It's 2015 - let's be realistic.  Times are still tough for a lot of folks.  Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Short Summary

Gothic-Americana powerhouse Bakelite 78 has a repertoire that is an eclectic mix of swing, dixieland, blues, jass, proto-country, klezmer and cabaret, as well as a plethora of originals in hybrids of these styles.  They have wowed audiences from Chicago to Seattle, and put out three full length albums to date.  Founding member Robert Rial invites you to take part in the next chapter for Bakelite 78, a stunning new 5 song collection, 5 Hits From Heck, available in compact disc and download formats as well as limited quantities on 12"" 45 r.p.m. vinyl record, with hand silk screened covers by legendary silk screener &
column2:
illustrator Jason Frederick!  Share in the legacy of fine art that has been produced for past Bakelite 78 showbills and promo materials via our variety of perks!
Producing an album D.I.Y. is not cheap, and even after we've already paid for recording, mixing, mastering and replication, we are still trying to pay some of the various costs associated with such an endeavor, including merchandising, a typically expensive ($6000.00) three month publicity campaign, and if any is left over, we can always use more guitar cords, cymbals, and trumpet valve oil. Your contribution, no matter how big or small, will help us meet our goal.  
THE PERKS
We are very excited to be offering as perks for this campaign, different numbered 2011 Bakelite 78 showbills from artist Jeffrey Rial, and a very limited amount of numbered copies of a 2008 Jared Metzner Delta Disc CD Release Show showbills (Black Bear Combo and Jimbo Mathus fans, heads up!).  These art pieces are in the more expensive price range, but we are still offering in addition to that, 5 Hits From Heck t-shirts, 5 Hits From Heck CDs, vinyl EPs, and 5 Hits From Heck CD Release Party posters at the lower tiers.  And ALL of you will receive a 5 Hits From Heck lapel pin, just because.

It's okay if you just cannot even afford to buy a CD or a download today!  You can still help Bakelite 78 achieve their goal!  Spread the word to your friends who you think would love this band!  Share this link on your social media pages!
column4: >et the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

column6: >Did you know that New Orleans, the city where jazz was born, does not have a museum dedicated to this wonderful art form?

column7: > grew up in the Treme neighborhood of New Orleans, and has made it his life's work to study New Orleans' musical history.

What You'll See at the Museum:
column8: >In 1997, Al and his business partner Paul Sylvester (owner of Sweet Lorraine’s Jazz Club) purchased the building at 1480 N. Claiborne Ave., the former home of Local #496. They were unfortunately unable to save the structure, and the building has since been demolished.

These discoveries include: a ledger of performances inside the New Orleans city limits for the years 1939-1968, hundreds of performance contracts for local and visiting artists (Louis Armstrong, Ray Charles, B.B. King, Professor Longhair and many more), dozens of recording contracts from local producer Cosimo Matassa's studio (Fats Domino, Little Richard, Dr. John, and Allen Toussaint to name a few).

column1: Copies of these items - most of which have never been displayed or seen anywhere - are on offer as ""perks"" for pledging to this project.
column2:
>
In addition to these artifacts, Al has commissioned local artists to create original paintings to help illustrate the story of pre-1900 New Orleans musicians, whose unique traditions, compositions and historical context set the scene for the invention of jazz, in the early 20th century.

column1: <div><span style=""font-weight: normal
What We Need &

In April, Al purchased and began renovations on a historic two-story building at 1500 Governor Nicholls St. in Treme. The building is located a few blocks from from the former home of Local 496, a few more from Congo Square, and within a mile of the birthplaces and former homes of Jelly Roll Morton, Louis Armstrong, Sidney Bechet, and countless other New Orleanians whose music changed the world.
column4:
>Planned renovations would allow the full two-story structure to be curated with historical exhibits and art pieces, and made accessible to the public. In addition to museum exhibits, we hope to use the building as a community center, lecture hall, and music venue. We are in collaboration with several local vendors who have committed to providing food and refreshments at the museum on a semi-regular basis, allowing visitors to enjoy a drink on the balcony between exhibits.

The one-bedroom apartment above the museum will also be renovated, and operated year-round as a Bed and Breakfast. 'Albin's B&
column5:
B' will provide museum donors and other visitors with a unique local New Orleans experience, just down the hall from the museum.

The museum is already under renovation, and we were able to open the first floor to the public for our ""soft opening"" on June 19th, 2016. We expect to officially open the museum in summer of 2016.

The Money Stuff:

column1: <li><span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column4: >All of the money raised during this campaign will contribute to the cost of renovating the property.

column1: <li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
• The full cost of the renovation project is estimated at $200k.
• Whatever we aren't able to raise during this campaign will be raised from other sources, including fundraising events in New Orleans, private donations, and grants.
• All funds contributed to this campaign will go towards the project, whether or not we meet our funding goal.
<span style=""background-color: initial
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >The music of New Orleans has made an immeasurable impact on music and culture throughout the 20th century (and beyond), all around the world. New Orleans musicians were instrumental in creating and shaping the genres we now know as jazz, blues, R&amp
column3: B, soul, and rock and roll. New Orleans composers have been covered by countless artists over the years, from Duke Ellington to The Beatles and David Bowie.
column4: >We feel that it's important to share this story with the residents of Treme and greater New Orleans, old and new, as well as with the 10 million+ annual visitors to our beloved city. This project is for everyone who hopes to gain a better understanding of our unique musical and cultural heritage.

column1: <div>

Other Ways You Can Help:

Whether or not you choose to contribute, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family, especially those who are New Orleanians, Orleanophiles, musicians and/or music enthusiasts! Help us share this project with the world.
","Did you know that New Orleans, the city where jazz was born, does not have a museum dedicated to this wonderful art form? We think it's time to change that, and we need your help.

Al Jackson grew up in the Treme neighborhood of New Orleans, and has made it his life's work to study New Orleans' musical history. After working on many other projects all over the world (six years in the U.S. Air Force, data analysis to help create the Saturn IB rocket, and time in the New Orleans city government), Al has turned his attention to achieving his long-time dream: opening a museum dedicated to the history of jazz, right here in Treme.

Along with a group of local musicians and enthusiasts, Al has created the Treme's Petit Jazz Museum Foundation, currently pending 501c3 nonprofit status. We expect our status to be granted before the close of this campaign, making all pledges tax-deductible.

Photo by Eric WatersWhat You'll See at the Museum:In 1997, Al and his business partner Paul Sylvester (owner of Sweet Lorraine’s Jazz Club) purchased the building at 1480 N. Claiborne Ave., the former home of Local #496. They were unfortunately unable to save the structure, and the building has since been demolished.

Al and Paul were surprised and pleased to find a treasure trove of artifacts on the property, attesting to the rich history of New Orleans music. These discoveries include: a ledger of performances inside the New Orleans city limits for the years 1939-1968, hundreds of performance contracts for local and visiting artists (Louis Armstrong, Ray Charles, B.B. King, Professor Longhair and many more), dozens of recording contracts from local producer Cosimo Matassa's studio (Fats Domino, Little Richard, Dr. John, and Allen Toussaint to name a few).

Copies of these items - most of which have never been displayed or seen anywhere - are on offer as ""perks"" for pledging to this project.In addition to these artifacts, Al has commissioned local artists to create original paintings to help illustrate the story of pre-1900 New Orleans musicians, whose unique traditions, compositions and historical context set the scene for the invention of jazz, in the early 20th century.
What We Need & What You Get:

In April, Al purchased and began renovations on a historic two-story building at 1500 Governor Nicholls St. in Treme. The building is located a few blocks from from the former home of Local 496, a few more from Congo Square, and within a mile of the birthplaces and former homes of Jelly Roll Morton, Louis Armstrong, Sidney Bechet, and countless other New Orleanians whose music changed the world. Planned renovations would allow the full two-story structure to be curated with historical exhibits and art pieces, and made accessible to the public. In addition to museum exhibits, we hope to use the building as a community center, lecture hall, and music venue. We are in collaboration with several local vendors who have committed to providing food and refreshments at the museum on a semi-regular basis, allowing visitors to enjoy a drink on the balcony between exhibits.The one-bedroom apartment above the museum will also be renovated, and operated year-round as a Bed and Breakfast. 'Albin's B&B' will provide museum donors and other visitors with a unique local New Orleans experience, just down the hall from the museum.The museum is already under renovation, and we were able to open the first floor to the public for our ""soft opening"" on June 19th, 2016. We expect to officially open the museum in summer of 2016.The Money Stuff:
All of the money raised during this campaign will contribute to the cost of renovating the property.
All donations are fully tax-deductible.
The full cost of the renovation project is estimated at $200k.
Whatever we aren't able to raise during this campaign will be raised from other sources, including fundraising events in New Orleans, private donations, and grants.
All funds contributed to this campaign will go towards the project, whether or not we meet our funding goal.
The Impact:

The music of New Orleans has made an immeasurable impact on music and culture throughout the 20th century (and beyond), all around the world. New Orleans musicians were instrumental in creating and shaping the genres we now know as jazz, blues, R&B, soul, and rock and roll. New Orleans composers have been covered by countless artists over the years, from Duke Ellington to The Beatles and David Bowie.We feel that it's important to share this story with the residents of Treme and greater New Orleans, old and new, as well as with the 10 million+ annual visitors to our beloved city. This project is for everyone who hopes to gain a better understanding of our unique musical and cultural heritage.

Other Ways You Can Help: Whether or not you choose to contribute, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends and family, especially those who are New Orleanians, Orleanophiles, musicians and/or music enthusiasts! Help us share this project with the world.
Photo by Eric Waters",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","New Orleans, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/treme-jazz-museum/pica

Summary

My name is Gregory Makamian, and I am an Armenian-Cypriot Jazz double bassist.

In the past 3 years I have been working really hard to push Jazz music forward in Cyprus. Why? Because it's beautiful music, and I truly believe it has it's place in on this island. I have been really inspired by some of the older musicians like Charis Ioannou, Marios Toumbas, Yiannos Vafeas, Michalis Messios who have been pushing the scene forward for years.

It has been hard to promote this music and its history because of the lack of help from most places. However some of us cannot accept it, and have been finding different ways to push it forward. Whether it's by playing in the streets, local bars, or in schools. The idea is to put this music in people's heads.
Jazz is the most important thing in my life. Although it's very challenging to make a living out of it, I have been true to the music, and refuse to do anything else.

By helping me raise some money, I will be able to go around Cyprus and perform and teach Jazz in schools and in the streets. You see, it's very difficult to raise money doing this. I have spent most of my money in putting the music forward, and I have seen great results, however funding has always been the main problem. We all have worked countless times without any pay. As difficult as it is to continue doing this without any financial help from somewhere, I have never gave up on this idea of a better music education on this island.

A small push like this would mean everything for me to continue doing what I do.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

3000 dollars is enough money to help me continue playing music, and promoting it for the next 6 months. During this time I will create a chain reaction through playing music for people.

column1: A small amount of the money will go in doing a recording session, which will then go online and be free for everyone to listen.  The rest of the whole amount will be used for the band to play music around the island in the streets, and to teach Jazz in schools.

If I don't hit my goal, I will use whatever I raised to take the band around in schools and in the streets of Cyprus.

The Impact

This project will directly involve everyday people into listening to Jazz. Think about it, people walking in the parks and listening to music. Children who have 0 exposure to this music, will have a Jazz band coming to perform at their school and teaching them more about it. It helps us spread this music but also gives so much to the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has to contribute with money! If you can get me a spot on the radio,TV, or a website it would also tremendously help me. Even word of mouth, of what I am trying to do will be of great help!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column5: >A once full time touring band, the members of A Love Not Lost traded their traveling lifestyle to begin families. However, we have not put down our instruments. After taking a more relaxed and methodical approach to our music, we are finally ready to share what we are convinced is the best ALNL album yet!

column1: We need your support! Finishing an album is expensive and we cannot do it without you. Simply put, we want you to be as involved as possible with this project. This is why we have set up some very personal prize levels that will allow us to get to know you better.
What We Need &

We need to raise $6500 in order to finish recording this album. All of the money raised goes straight to the project! Upon completion of the fundraiser, we will go into the studio to finish up the album. As incentive, we have set up some prize levels ranging from a copy of the album, to a chance to help record on the album itself!
The Impact

ALNL has never been just a band. Our focus has always been loving others and loving God. We want to share that passion one more time with you! Help us complete  this next chapter of a musical ministry spanning nearly a decade!
Risks &
If we do not raise all of the funds, we cannot complete the entire album. WE CAN ONLY RECORD AS MANY SONGS AS WE RAISE THE MONEY FOR! We will do as much as we can with the money we raise.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if money is tight. If you are not able to donate, you can still help by sharing this project with your friends and family on social media and through word of mouth! This is one of the most important parts of this campaign. So let anyone and everyone know about it! Please help us on this journey of reaching our goal!


Email us at: alovenotlostrocks@gmail.com

Who we are:
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >Warriors of the underground! We are Cobra, a five-pieced heavy metal band based in Lima, Peru.

column5: >With almost ten years of existence, a couple of demo tapes, two full lenght albums ""Lethal Stike"" and ""To Hell"", touring around Peru, Chile, Bolivia, Ecuador and Colombia, sharing stage with glorious acts such as Overkill, Whiplash, Sabbat, Satan, Bulldozer, Artillery and Onslaught
column6: now we have the opportunity to take a big step in our carreer and hit Europe.

column5: >In February of last year, we received the invitation to one of the most important metal festivals in the world: Keep It True Festival. We are the first band from Latin America to perform at this show.

>After this notice, we started to get mails from different countries with gig offers around Europe, so we decided to take this chance and organize what it's going to be our first European tour. This is the third time in history that a metal act from Peru tours around Eruope.
>As an independent band, we don't have a big sponsorship that covers all the costs of a tour, so we are the ones that are running with all the expenses: plane tickets, van rental, gas, tolls, etc.

>We've received the support from our German label Ván Records, from the booking agency Swamp Booking and from the promoters of the shows in order to have the propper documentation to get the Schengen visa. Now we need the support from the heavy metal maniacs around the world to reach this goal.
>Every donation in this campaign is very important for us because it will help us to cover the costs that a propper tour implicates.

The impact:
<h3><span style=""font-size: 16px
column5: >Having a well-done tour is an open gate for more Peruvian metal bands to have the chance to tour across Europe and develop a strong international music scene.

column1: Each action is meaningful:

We know better than anyone that not everyone can be a backer in this kind of projects. If this is your case, we will be very grateful if you can help us in a useful way: spread the word around and generate buzz between your friends, contacts and people who might be intersted. You can use all the social media channels you want and also the Indiegogo sharing tools.
