","Who we are:
Warriors of the underground! We are Cobra, a five-pieced heavy metal band based in Lima, Peru.

With almost ten years of existence, a couple of demo tapes, two full lenght albums ""Lethal Stike"" and ""To Hell"", touring around Peru, Chile, Bolivia, Ecuador and Colombia, sharing stage with glorious acts such as Overkill, Whiplash, Sabbat, Satan, Bulldozer, Artillery and Onslaught
column2: now we have the opportunity to take a big step in our carreer and hit Europe.

column1: In February of last year, we received the invitation to one of the most important metal festivals in the world: Keep It True Festival. We are the first band from Latin America to perform at this show.

After this notice, we started to get mails from different countries with gig offers around Europe, so we decided to take this chance and organize what it's going to be our first European tour. This is the third time in history that a metal act from Peru tours around Eruope.
As an independent band, we don't have a big sponsorship that covers all the costs of a tour, so we are the ones that are running with all the expenses: plane tickets, van rental, gas, tolls, etc.

We've received the support from our German label Ván Records, from the booking agency Swamp Booking and from the promoters of the shows in order to have the propper documentation to get the Schengen visa. Now we need the support from the heavy metal maniacs around the world to reach this goal.
Every donation in this campaign is very important for us because it will help us to cover the costs that a propper tour implicates.
About Rough Riding Europe Tour 2015:
One month on the road between Germany, Belgium, Italy, Switzerland, Spain and France.
Shows in Keep It True Festival, Raging Death Date Festival, Metalmería Fest and more die-hard venues.
Sharing stage with great acts such as Exciter, Riot, Death Strike, The Mentors, Possession, Triumphant, Diabolic Night, Attic, Uli Jon Roth, Nocturnal and more.
Where your colaboration goes to:
We need to collect at least €2,000 to cover the following costs:
Van rental
Driver and tour manager daily fee
Gasoline
Tolls
Beside those, we also are running with the flying ticket expenses by our own, so any extra support from you will be greately appreciated.
Rewards for your support:
Each person who backs this campaign will receive a reward according to the amount of money they donate. We want you to be part of this experience and we want you to know it.
The impact:
Having a well-done tour is an open gate for more Peruvian metal bands to have the chance to tour across Europe and develop a strong international music scene.
Each action is meaningful:

We know better than anyone that not everyone can be a backer in this kind of projects. If this is your case, we will be very grateful if you can help us in a useful way: spread the word around and generate buzz between your friends, contacts and people who might be intersted. You can use all the social media channels you want and also the Indiegogo sharing tools.
More information about the tour:
Check out the confirmed dates so far here.
Visit our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/CobraPeruHeavyMetal
The only law in this life is rock and roll",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Lima, Peru",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cobra-rough-riding-europe-tour-2015/pica

My Story

I have been singing since I was little, and have been pursuing it for the last 13 years. I love so many genres of music, but I primarily sing country and classic rock during live performances. I guess I can blame that on the love of music I got from my Dad.  I have previously recorded two full length country albums which were self funded with the help of family, and a couple of close friends. I have been writing quite a bit of new music in the past couple of years, and I'm itching to get some of it out to the public. I have been asked many times when I will have something new to share, and now that time is coming very soon!  I am going to record a few new songs, and make an EP to try and reach out to the music industry, and build a new team so I can reach my musical goals. These few songs will be part of a full album in the near future.
Since I'm not good at talking about myself...only in songs, here's some beautiful words from one of my best friends and fellow artist Amber Haydey:
""I had the pleasure of meeting Erin Haley 8+ years ago, at a show that Global Country was hosting at the Winspear. I was competing in the Global Country Star Search, and Erin was set to perform that night alongside many other talented artists. What started out as friendly conversation, turned into a life long friendship with one of my peers.
Erin is not only an incredible person, she is business savvy, intelligent, and a compelling singer/songwriter. The things she has taught me are invaluable.
Erin has helped me to grow as an artist, and has supported my journey no matter the obstacles.
When it comes to Erin Haley, there is no shortage of talent.
I whole heartedly believe that with her beauty (inside and out), charm, and unique sound, she has every thing it takes to succeed.
I support Erin and her music 100%! I would encourage everyone I know to do the same.
Erin has poured her heart and soul into her music, and I would love nothing more than to see her every dream become reality. There is no one more deserving than Erin Haley.  Help my musical soul sister out!""
What I Need &
column2:
What You GetEach song costs approximately $2,500 to record. I am planning on 3 or 4 songs at the moment, but if I raise enough money to accomplish more than that, I will most certainly do so! Every single penny raised will go directly to my music. If I'm lucky enough to raise more than I require right now, it will be saved to do the rest of the album and possibly complete a new website, as I only have a splash page at the moment.
I don't have a lot to offer in return, as I do not have much for merch at the moment, but I would like to get my music out to anyone who supports me so I will be sending my previous albums out to those who donate certain amounts. I know it will cost you more to get a cd this way, but I want to be able to cover the shipping costs, or half of the money you are wanting me to put towards new music will go towards shipping alone. (I should also let everyone know that I am charged a % on funds that I earn...4% if I reach my goal and 9% if I don't, hence the higher price of the cd's).  I will also be listing higher contributors on my splash page, and eventually on a new website, as well as on the album itself. I am also offering receipts for those who have companies and can write this off as advertising on my website and/or album.
As a side note, if you are a friend or family member who already has all or some of my music and do not wish to receive another cd or want one and not the other, please let me know.

column1:
The Impact

I will be so grateful to anyone who takes the plunge to help me at all! Every single dollar helps, and is more than appreciated. I don't want to give up on my dream of music, but as all artists know it is a very expensive process  to record, and to do so with the standards I have set for myself. I only want to release high quality music, and with your help I can!

Risks &

There are always challenges in the music industry, like hiring the wrong team to help get the music out to people, or picking the wrong songs. I feel I have learned in my many years to pick songs that people can relate to, and that maybe even those who don't necessarily love country music will like. I have also been around long enough that I can admit I have made mistakes just like everyone else, but have absolutely learned from them. The only main risk with raising money for this project is that if I don't raise enough, I will be further into music debt. There won't be many challenges in the studio because I have an amazing producer to work with, and we will create some cool new music that we will both be proud to put our names on.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

I understand that not everyone can afford to help me with this project. I feel the effects of the oil industry as well, so I know even $20 may be hard for some. If you can't afford to put any money into this crazy dream of mine but you still want to give me a hand, please pass this on to friends and family who you think might enjoy my music. I want to thank each and every one of you in advance for ANY support you show me! Don't be surprised if you get a thank-you message...

|","Whitecourt, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/new-music-from-erin-haley/pica

THE PROJECT

I am Thomas Cadenazzi, a 23 years old italian composer. I
compose, piano and orchestral musics, well designed for soundtracks and
trailers. I have been playing music since I have memories...I grew up in a musician family! Infact my parents are both musicians, graduates at the Como’s
conservatory, and two of my sisters are musicians too. I started playing
piano when I was 5 and when I was around 14, I started playing guitar
too. I approached the music composition when I was 17, while I was
playing in a band. Since that moment, I never stopped composing! I
compose piano classical music and orchestral music that are well
designed for movies. In fact I like to think my compositions as

soundtracks.

THE FIRST STUDIO WORK - FANTASIA
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Fantasia has been my first studio work! In this album you can find a wide genre of music from relaxing piano tracks to some more ""pop"" works, including some other ""epic"" tracks, which offers to this work a colorful tone. I was told that some tracks reminds people

column1: of musicians like Tiersen, Einaudi, Glass, Nyman, and others, especially

the orchestrated ones, reminds Ennio Morricone.

FANTASIA - ITUNES

THE SECOND ALBUM - THE CHANCE YOU NEVER HAD
column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

In 2014 I have released my second album ""The Chance You Never Had""  which was a more public success in some digital store like Amazon or Itunes, including Spotify!
column9:
sr=1-1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">THE CHANCE YOU NEVER HAD - PHYSICAL CD BY AMAZON

SPOTIFY_THOMAS CADENAZZI

The Chance You Never Had is a more epic album, well designed for epic movies or trailers
column10:
it has been recordered in a small studio with some real instruments played live.

Here are some of my compositions you can also find online, in my Youtube Channel.
column25:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

THE NEXT ALBUM - CRYSTALLIZED

With the next album, I want to reach the perfection in my sound, and for this reason I need some funds to improving my studio's strumentations.

The money, infact, will be used for the cost of the studio time, for all the strumentation required, paying for the orchestrations and the musicians, for the mixing and mastering process and then for the production costs, the promotion and graphic design!

Thank you in advance for any help you can provide, for check out my indiegogo page, and for the support I receive!

Best,

Thomas

","THE PROJECTI am Thomas Cadenazzi, a 23 years old italian composer. I

column1: compose, piano and orchestral musics, well designed for soundtracks and
trailers. I have been playing music since I have memories...I grew up in a musician family! Infact my parents are both musicians, graduates at the Como’s
conservatory, and two of my sisters are musicians too. I started playing
piano when I was 5 and when I was around 14, I started playing guitar
too. I approached the music composition when I was 17, while I was
playing in a band. Since that moment, I never stopped composing! I
compose piano classical music and orchestral music that are well
designed for movies. In fact I like to think my compositions as

soundtracks. THE FIRST STUDIO WORK - FANTASIAFantasia has been my first studio work! In this album you can find a wide genre of music from relaxing piano tracks to some more ""pop"" works, including some other ""epic"" tracks, which offers to this work a colorful tone. I was told that some tracks reminds people
of musicians like Tiersen, Einaudi, Glass, Nyman, and others, especially

the orchestrated ones, reminds Ennio Morricone.FANTASIA - ITUNESTHE SECOND ALBUM - THE CHANCE YOU NEVER HADIn 2014 I have released my second album ""The Chance You Never Had""  which was a more public success in some digital store like Amazon or Itunes, including Spotify!THE CHANCE YOU NEVER HAD - PHYSICAL CD BY AMAZONSPOTIFY_THOMAS CADENAZZIThe Chance You Never Had is a more epic album, well designed for epic movies or trailers
column2: it has been recordered in a small studio with some real instruments played live. Here are some of my compositions you can also find online, in my Youtube Channel.THE NEXT ALBUM - CRYSTALLIZEDWith the next album, I want to reach the perfection in my sound, and for this reason I need some funds to improving my studio's strumentations.The money, infact, will be used for the cost of the studio time, for all the strumentation required, paying for the orchestrations and the musicians, for the mixing and mastering process and then for the production costs, the promotion and graphic design!Thank you in advance for any help you can provide, for check out my indiegogo page, and for the support I receive!Best,ThomasFollow THOMAS:

Dear friends,

I am a guitar player/song-writer from Latvia. From the first humble chords in the beginning of 2008, to playing with professional musicians, like Dave Goodman, Innes Sibun, Phil Spalding among many others, I've always loved music, and all there is to it. This is my profession, my worldview, my way of saying thank you, and spreading love.

I've played gigs in large concert halls, small cafes, busked in the streets, played alone, played in bands, composed music for movies and plays.The greatest thing that keeps me going is the opportunity to share inspiration through my music, no matter how big/small the audience is. 
I would like to thank everyone, who has supported and encouraged me throughout my journey, and given me the opportunity to do what I love. 
 The time has come for the next big step - a full scale album. It's not my debut, but after 2 years of hard work the album will be the best musical adventure I've ventured on so far. Up till now, I've released one solo album, RL Elektronix (early 2015), which I completed alone,a limited edition. 
However, the upcoming material demands an entirely different approach. That's why I have put my heart and soul to collaborating with 10 other fantastic musicians and friends from the local Latvian music scene, and together we have created something fantastic. I couldn't be more excited about working with these people, and their talent has made the music so much more than I imagined it could be. 
To make this album the way it should be, a lot of expenses are involved, and since every single one of us is living off music, it's hard to meet the costs of a full scale studio album, so, a serious financial support is needed. From studio fees, to mixing and mastering, and finally releasing the album (detailed breakdown of planned expenses is included below).

Your support can play an important role to fulfill this dream. By donating, pre-ordering the album, or simply by sharing this information with your friends and family. Also, if you enjoy the music, feel free to share it with someone, who could connect with it, as there is nothing better for an aspiring musician.
Again, thank you all for your support!
Cheers,
Rihards

Exactly 10 years ago 4 guys came together and Vordan Karmir was born in
the city of Vanadzor, Armenia. Our town is small but our dreams are big.
Few weeks ago we received the grandest invitation of them all – to
perform at the 2015 SXSW Festival in Austin, Texas. Now we need your help to
reach Austin from Vanadzor, where we will show the world what big will in a
small town looks like.
Vahan Poghosyan – vocals
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
Our music
From the very first day of Vordan
Karmir’s existence, we have striven to create a new form of art within the
Armenian musical sphere.
We have faced many challenges on the road to pave a
diverse path through convention and well-established musical traditions. But we
have made that path visible and acceptable to the public.
Now we are ready to
share it with the world.
We are intent on forging our own rules in the
contemporary metal game, hell-bent to have our voices heard!
Where will the money go?

Short Summary

 Singer-Songwriter, Jason Terry, is no rookie to the country music scene.  In 2010, Jason released his debut EP entitled, ""Where I Belong"".  He quickly began catching the ear of listeners of all ages with his eclectic style that brings a new sound to modern Country Music.  In 2014, Jason released his sophomore EP entitled, ""Letting Go"", which shared his battle with addiction and depression.  Now, Jason is in the studio with producer Ben McCamis (Life Wide Open) to record his 3rd EP set to be titled ""Green Light Go"".  Jason is passionate about his writing and writes nearly 90% of his material on his own, but he is active in the co-writing world as well.  WIth your help, Jason will record the awaited 5 song EP and release the title track, ""Green Light Go"" to secondary and satellite radio.
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2: What You Get In order to successfully complete this project, we will need a total of $5000.00.  The following explains how the funds will be allocated:

column1: - 4 remaining songs to be recorded @ $1000 per song
- 500 disc packages to be pressed (4 panel digipack) for retail @
approximately $935
Now you are asking ""What's in it for me?"" ....

We have three different donation amounts with EXCLUSIVE perks. Click ""PERKS"" on the left hand column.

 

The Impact

 

Jason has released two EPs and one single over the past five years. It has been been made possible by people like you! Jason believes that music is about bringing people together through lyrics and melodies. If you can join the #JTFamily and be a part of this EP, you will be GREATLY appreciated!

 

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

 Today's economy is in turmoil and Jason and his crew sincerely understand that. This brings forth obvious hurdles in the music industry.  A great sounding EP costs A LOT of money and placing a single into radio play costs even more money. Without the help of people who believe in Jason's mission it is not possible to continue releasing high quality music.

column1:
To combat the challenge of completing the campaign, please share on all of your social media outlets that you are connected to, tell your friends about your discovery, and tell your family too!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are reading this and you are unable to contribute a monetary donation, please use the IndieGoGo ""Share Tools"" to help spread the word!

WATCH THE VIDEO TO SEE THE GROUND-BREAKING TECHNOLOGY USED IN GETTING MIKE TO PLAY MORE THAN ONE INSTRUMENT!!!!!

THE
ALBUM
This
project is all about music. With, what will be, my seventh album
under my own name, I am setting out to create a whole new recording
of original music written and arranged for 11 brass and 5 rhythm.
Essentially, it’s a big band without the saxophone section. The
reason for this is simple: I can’t play the saxophone.
With
the “Off the Road” album, which many of you very generously
supported, I wanted to meet my own challenge of making a recording on
which I perform most of the instruments. As a result, with the help
of a few wonderful guests, I was able to record “Off the Road” by
playing trumpet (my first instrument), french horn, trombone,
acoustic and electric bass, piano, and some percussion.
This
new album is all new music, written specifically for this album and
to be performed live by my new Toronto-based ensemble, <b>Mike
Herriott &amp
would guess that it's safe to say that it is a selfish desire for
most composers to hear their own music exactly as they intended it to
be performed. For that reason, I have chosen to, once again, perform
the majority of instruments here with the help of my good friend
Richard Moore on drums. However, my main reason for recording this
way is because I have so much fun in the challenge of it. Often, I
will write something and then wonder if it's playable on the given
instrument. After cursing myself a few times and then accomplishing
the goal, I know that it is possible to be played by another who is
more proficient than me.
However,
as I said originally, this album is about music and not the antics
that go into recording. It is my hope that the recording that results
from your contribution will produce music that brings smiles to the
faces of all who listen to the album.
THE
COST
As
with any recording, there are expenses that arise from the
production, mixing, mastering, design, manufacturing, and release.
For this album, we are looking to raise $10,000 to help cover these
costs. Your contribution will make it possible to bring this music to
life. From the smallest amounts that get you the music itself, to the
largest contributions that help bring direction to the album and get
you the end product in a number of different forms (CD, vinyl,
printed musical scores), you will be helping to create something that
contributes to our musical landscape and hopefully brings happiness
to those who hear the music.
We're
not promising that anyone will get rich or famous from this project
we don't promise that this project will help you lose or gain weight,
see into the future, transport your pet across the observable galaxy,
or get you to work any faster. Nor do we promise that you will love
every single note on the album. But we do promise that this will be
music that will move you, groove you, and something else that rhymes
with “oove” you.
THE
RESULT
We
are putting together a great team to record, mix, master, and then
get this album out to the public. The recording, mixing, mastering
process will be finished by the end of July, 2015. Our release date
is set for September, 2015. There will be a release concert in
Toronto around that time where the music will be performed live by
Mike Herriott &amp
column2: The OTR Band. Everyone who contributes on one of

column1: the “Producer” levels will be invited as our guest to this
release concert.
ONE
EXTRA PERK!!!
We are offering a

full digital copy of the “pre-mastering” recording of “Gravity”, which you heard in the pitch video, to the first 25 contributors of any level!!! 

This is the first piece to be

recorded for this brand new album and you get to hear it FIRST!!!

<div>
WE WILL NOT BE SILENCED.
<div>
South Africa is no stranger to intimidation and segregation. 20 years after the
release of Former President Nelson Mandela, our freedom of expression is
still being compromised.
Our metal music scene is under threat.
Witchdoctor Productions had a dream to bring a Metal Festival to our country.
An opportunity to grow the already thriving scene. Create jobs. Give our own
metal bands a much needed platform, and share our beautiful country and
love for music with some of the world’s biggest names in metal. From various
groups. We have been bullied. Terrorized. Attacked. Our shows have been
cancelled. Our venues closed down.
This year, our venue was shut down three times. Which has had a massive
impact on us financially, as we have no sponsors willing to associate their brand with metal. And while we refuse to be
intimidated, and have fought with every strength to continue with this project,
we really need help to ensure that we can make WItchfest Festival an annual

event within the budget of the fans.
One that can celebrate the same success as Wacken Open Air in
Germany.
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>
<div>
We are looking to raise around $100 000 to recover the money that was lost
due to all the venue moves, deposits, advertising, re branding.This way we can fund

Witchfest 2016 without passing costs onto fans.

Our goal is to
column5: >make it a bigger and better experience than the

column1: last. Any money raised over and above the amount needed will go towards
reducing the ticket prices for 2016, legal fee's and getting the festival into other African countries.
Witchdoctor Productions have a proven track record when it comes to
breaking new ground in the South African metal scene, having been the
company responsible for bringing over bands like Sepultura, Behemoth,
Ministry, Soulfly,Entombed and Kataklysm.
</tr>
<tr>
<td>
<div>
The aim is to take Witchfest into other African countries like Botswana,
Angola and Mozambique. Helping to spread the music and the message to
fans that previously had no way of being able to see the best that the metal
world has to offer. By contributing to the campaign you’ll be a big part of this,
helping to unite 1st and 3rd world metals fans.

column5: >If you can’t contribute to the campaign financially, that’s okay. You can help

column1: us get the message out there by using the Indiegogo share tools.
You can find this campaign on www.facebook.com/WitchfestFestival ,
www.twitter.com/witchfestSA and www.witchfest.co.za
</tr>
</tbody>

What is Moonbend?

Our goal is for Moonbend to become a leading-edge recording studio, community, and platform to release forward-minded music. We are looking to open a studio in the Detroit area to create projects of our own as well as those of our clients.
Adam Shepard - 20

column5: >Adam is an avid musician who has been involved with orchestras, studios, and local bands since elementary school. Most recently he has been focusing on creating professional recordings for various projects including solo work, his band Dauden i Mørke, and clients at

column1: https://soundcloud.com/adamshepard
Luke Torvinen - 20

Luke has been studying different areas of music since a young age and is currently working toward a degree in Sound Recording Technology at Schoolcraft College. He has been working in the local audio field since March 2014. His recent creative works have been in hip-hop and electronic production.
https://soundcloud.com/lukesuperior

The name ""Moonbend"" is a fusion of our individual projects: Adam's Studio, Moonskull and Luke's label and production collective, Timebend.

By donating to our project, you have the chance to be a part of something that will progress the local music scene, as well as help to pave the way for the next generation of creative individuals.

Expenses and Rewards

We need to raise at least $4000 to get the essentials for our project. This includes analog preamps, microphones, plug-ins, and various outboard gear to complete our ideal recording setup.
The 2015 Promo EP is our first release and showcases what we're capable of. We have been actively working on this project since 2013.
Our T-Shirts were designed to simply, effectively, and stylishly display our Moonbend logo.
Although our services meet the industry standard, the studio time perk is priced at a major discount. This is an incentive to get people in the door &

The Studio

We are currently working out of bedroom studios as well as other people's studios. We would like to bring our project into a more stable environment. There are a few locations available for Moonbend depending on our funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to fund and would still like to help, please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media you use!
Contact us at Moonbendstudios@gmail.com if you have any questions.
If none of our perks appeal to you, but you have an idea of your own, contact us. We are willing to negotiate custom perks.
","https://soundcloud.com/moonbend

What is Moonbend? Our goal is for Moonbend to become a leading-edge recording studio, community, and platform to release forward-minded music. We are looking to open a studio in the Detroit area to create projects of our own as well as those of our clients.
The Team:
Adam Shepard - 20

Adam is an avid musician who has been involved with orchestras, studios, and local bands since elementary school. Most recently he has been focusing on creating professional recordings for various projects including solo work, his band Dauden i Mørke, and clients at his studio ""Moonskull Recordings"".

Luke Torvinen - 20

column2:
>THE BUDGET: where your money will go

To present musicians of such high artistic attainment in public concerts, ticket sales are not sufficient to cover costs. This festival can be sustained only with the help of enthusiastic and generous supporters. A festival of such high artistic quality requires a considerable sum of money to finance the artists, the venue and the publicity campaign.
column3:
>Help us become a permanent fixture of the Bay Area musical scene. 

We have 30 days to raise $5000.

Our goals are:

column1: • to present the great masterpieces of French music to the San Francisco Bay Area public
• to present performances of exceptional quality by the finest musicians and singers in the San Francisco Bay Area
• to continue presenting this festival as an annual highlight of musical life in the San Francisco/San Jose Bay Area

Our hope is to attract a loyal following of music enthusiasts to back this project. Lovers of French Classical Music, unite!!! 

Both big and small, your contributions will help create a stable financial environment for this festival.

ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE - THE ALLIANCE FRANCAISE OF SILICON VALLEY IS A CALIFORNIA 501 (C) 3-NOT FOR-PROFIT ASSOCIATION ESTABLISHED SINCE 1970

column1: It is the mission of the Alliance Française Silicon Valley to strengthen ties between France and the multitude of cultures present in Silicon Valley. We also work hard to create bridges between French culture and new technologies.

","THE BUDGET: where your money will goTo present musicians of such high artistic attainment in public concerts, ticket sales are not sufficient to cover costs. This festival can be sustained only with the help of enthusiastic and generous supporters. A festival of such high artistic quality requires a considerable sum of money to finance the artists, the venue and the publicity campaign. Help us become a permanent fixture of the Bay Area musical scene. We have 30 days to raise $5000.Our goals are:
to present the great masterpieces of French music to the San Francisco Bay Area public
to present performances of exceptional quality by the finest musicians and singers in the San Francisco Bay Area
to continue presenting this festival as an annual highlight of musical life in the San Francisco/San Jose Bay Area

Our hope is to attract a loyal following of music enthusiasts to back this project. Lovers of French Classical Music, unite!!! Both big and small, your contributions will help create a stable financial environment for this festival.ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE - THE ALLIANCE FRANCAISE OF SILICON VALLEY IS A CALIFORNIA 501 (C) 3-NOT FOR-PROFIT ASSOCIATION ESTABLISHED SINCE 1970
THE STORYTwo years ago, conductor Mark Starr and French flutist Isabelle Chapuis - filled
with a love for French classical music - asked the Alliance Française of Silicon
Valley (AFSCV) to create an annual musical event devoted to French music. In 2014, we inaugurated the festival in Tateuchi Recital Hall in Mountain View.
Mark Starr, festival co-musical director, says: “It is important to note
that there are no other festivals dedicated to French classical music,
featuring top local musicians, in the San Francisco Bay Area - or even in the
United States. There, lovers of French music can indulge their
passion for masterpieces by French composers, and noted local
musicians and singers can perform for you the great French masterpieces they
love so much. Our festival is an elite showcase. Our aim now is to make this festival a permanent annual event.”
Mark Starr
In the first season, on June 20th, 2014, the festival presented music by Darius Milhaud, Maurice Ravel, Francis
Poulenc, Gabriel Fauré and Edith Piaf, all performed by the brilliant Bay
Area chamber music group Ensemble San
Francisco.
Ensemble San Francisco performs Gabriel Faure Piano Quartet No. 1
On June 21st 2014, a second program presented a wide variety of
virtuoso works by French composers Charles-Valentin
Alkan, Maurice Ravel, André Jolivet, and Ernest Chausson. Performers included the young violin sensation
Stephen Waarts, brilliant pianist and Ravel expert Gwendolyn Mok, the Festival
Percussion Ensemble, conducted by Mark Starr, French flute soloist Isabelle
Chapuis, celebrated mezzo-soprano Layna Chiankis, the Festival String Quartet, and noted Bay Area pianist Dmitrij Cogan.
Stephen Waarts, violin, and Gwendolyn Mok, piano, are soloists with the
Festival String Quartet, in Ernest Chausson’s Concert pour violon, piano et
Quatuor à cordes.
THEY TALKED ABOUT IT
Richard Scheinin, music Critic of the San Jose Mercury News, called our first season “an appealing startup festival.”

Michael Strickland, writer/musician wrote on his blog: “Ensemble San Francisco performed A Parisian Evening of music by French composers that was marvelous. (...) The entire event was so enjoyable that I can't wait to see what they do next.""
AN ELITE EVENT FOR EVERYONE (at moderate ticket prices)

The co-musical directors would like to develop this new festival into an annual rendez-vous for French classical music lovers in Northern California. We believe there is a public in the San Francisco Bay Area consisting of lovers of French music and French culture. Moreover, we are committed to featuring musicians and singers from the San Francisco Bay Area. As Mark Starr has noted: “New York does not have a monopoly on first-rate musicians. The Bay Area is filled with extraordinary soloists, superb singers and fresh young talent. And when you ask many of them what music they would like to perform most, the lion’s share often goes to works by French composers.”
2015: TWO CONCERTS IN EIGHT DAYS
The concerts will again take place at the
Tateuchi Recital Hall in the Community School of Music and Arts, 230 San
Antonio Circle, Mountain View.
In this intimate atmosphere, eleven outstanding musicians will perform the
works of seven composers from France and francophone countries:
1. On June 19: ""Three summits of French
chamber music"" will include the Debussy Sonata for cello and piano, Ravel’s Piano Trio, and Franck’s Piano Quintet. Featured artists from Ensemble
San Francisco:
2. On June 27: ""Jewels of French Music"" will focus on shorter masterpieces,
including Ravel’s Sonata for violin and piano, Poulenc’s Sonata for Two Pianos, Messiaen’s Le merle noir, Varese’s Density 21.5
Violin No. 3 (“Ballade”).
A festival at the intersection of French culture and technologies

It is the mission of the Alliance Française Silicon Valley to strengthen ties between France and the multitude of cultures present in Silicon Valley. We also work hard to create bridges between French culture and new technologies.",6.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","Mountain View, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/2nd-silicon-valley-french-classical-music-festival/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Hey there!

We are Uncle Dad's Art Collective: a Chico, CA-based, community-focused arts organization whose goal is to support and empower North State artists. This September we will be producing the 4th annual installment of Small Town, Big Sound -- a show where lush, orchestral strings, brass, and winds team up with angelic backup vocalists and a rockin’ rhythm section to shine a light on some of the most exciting music coming out of our region today.
This year is extra special for us.

It's always been a dream of ours to make the North State a little bit smaller by taking our shows on the road and showcasing then in our neighboring towns. This year we are terribly excited to get this amazing show -- featuring all North State performers and crew -- in front of audiences in Chico, Weaverville, Orland, and Redding. The downside to traveling, and the reason we haven't taken shows on the road before, is the intense cost.
The bottom line: This show is simply way too expensive for us to do on our own.

Part of our mission is to pay all of the artists we work with. With 4 performances, a 20-ish piece band, and 15 featured songwriters, costs add up really quickly. By supporting this production with a contribution, you will essentially be putting your money directly into the pocket (or shoe box/bank account/sock drawer) of some of the most talented musicians that our community has to offer.
That's a big deal -- a really big deal -- and we hope that you feel as strongly about that as we do.
Plus, for helping out, you get cool things like these snazzy pins! More information on those down at the bottom (and a higher resolution version of the mockup is at https://imgur.com/a/dAuuT4u)
Alright, but how much of that $7,600 goal is really going to artists?
All of it! Well, except for the ~8% that goes to IndieGoGo and payment processing. The real cost of making this show happen for 4 nights is about $13,500. That includes (roughly):
<ul>
• $8,300 for the band and songwriters
• $1,500 for our arrangers (they're the ones who put the orchestra behind the songwriters)
• $1,900 for our music director, a top notch tech crew, and all the gear we need to bring and rent.
• $1,800 for other expenses including printing our books, t-shirts, travel, marketing, and graphic design.

So, assuming we reach our goal (which we really hope you'll help us do), this campaign will put about $7,000 toward paying our band and songwriters. We weren't kidding -- you're putting money in their pockets (or shoe box/bank...you get it).
Okay, I get it, it's expensive. But what happens if you don't raise all that money?
The world will end. No, really, it will.

Okay, the world won't really end. The reality is that the show will still happen. We will still figure out how to pay everybody involved, because that's the right way to do things, but it will put our organization in a tough spot. Instead of looking to the future to figure out what our next fun, over-the-top, community-serving endeavor will be, we will be spending our time figuring out how to put on events that make money so that we can offset our debt.

That is obviously the risk of pursuing goals that seem just out of reach. But ya know what? It's worth it even thought it's scary, and we are hopeful that you and the rest of our community will help support us as we venture into this uncharted territory.
Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everybody can afford to contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help us out in other ways. Anything you can do to share this campaign (maybe with those handy buttons IndieGoGo conveniently placed up top) or the show itself is very helpful and very appreciated. Tweet, gram, pin, bark, growl, talk, or do whatever it is you do to tell your social circles about things you think are worthwhile.
Thank you!

Seriously, thank you. Everything that Uncle Dad's Art Collective has ever produced has been made possible by the outpouring of support that we've gotten from the community. Small Town, Big Sound 2018 is just one of many shows to come that could not have happened without you.
So again, thank you so very much!
So how about those pins?

Our Small Town, Big Sound 2018 ""Singer"" needs some overall cleanup to make it pin-ready, so that'll end up being a bit different -- but not by much! The Uncle Dad's Art Collective ""Masks 'n' Saxes"" design  is final. Higher-res mockup above at https://imgur.com/a/dAuuT4u.
The ""Singer"" will probably be 1.25"" to 1.5"" wide, and the ""Masks 'n' Saxes"" will probably be 1""-1.25"" wide.
Adopt-a-song Information

Facilitating this on IndieGoGo would mean creating 14 separate perks, which would really make that list unreadable. In lieu of that, we're maintaining a list of all songs' adoption statuses at: https://tinyurl.com/y765nyzn. We will do our absolute best to keep this as up to date as possible. When you make your contribution, leave a note regarding the artist/song you'd like to adopt and we will update our list accordingly.

However, please keep in mind that it is a huge pain to refund your contributions once they are submitted. So, if for some reason you choose to adopt a song that has already been picked up because there was a gap in our list updates, we'd really appreciate your willingness to adopt another song instead. If you have any questions/concerns about adoption availability, please contact us prior to contributing.

Short Summary

We are Mike and Lisa Jacob, aka Judah's Pride.  We have been doing Christian Hip Hop together now for almost 10 years.  Hip Hop is a powerfully influential culture that is truly shaping the lives of our young people.  We hear youth all the time singing/rapping lyrics to secular songs without fully understand the negative connotations in what they are saying, and sadly sometimes they do understand all too well what they are saying.  Our passion to create Hip Hop music that is not only appealing but that also provides a powerful positive message that encourages wisdom in making life decisions.  This album has been many years in the making and we are so excited to share it with the world.  We believe that the further this album reaches, the more lives that will be impacted.
<h3>What We Need &amp
We currently need $3,500 to complete this project.
This will provide funding for:
<ul>
• The replication, packaging, and distribution of this album
• Promotion for album sales
• and if there is any left over it will go towards the creation of a music video of one of the songs
Donate $10 or more and you will receive a CD from us as soon as we have them.
Donate $200 or more plus cover our travel expenses and we will do a concert at your venue. (Date and Time subject to our availability)
The Impact

God put it on Mike's heart years ago that our first album should be a seed offering into discipleship ministry.  Since then, God has put two very powerful ministries on our hearts to support.  100% of the proceeds of sales from this first album will be split 50/50 between these two ministries.  One of the ministries, Heroes Camp, uses basketball as a tool to help shape and mold the lives of so many young people in the South Bend area.  The other is Roma Learning to Fly, which is an organization that uses educational tools to empower the Roma people in Slovakia and several other countries throughout Europe.
Supporting this campaign will not just help get our music out there, it will also be supporting these two very influential ministries.
<h3>Risks &amp

At this time, the only thing delaying the album release is funding. Everything else is set and ready to go. Once we have reached our funding goal, we will be able to send off for the replication, packaging and distribution of the CD.  This process should take only a few weeks.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Here are some other needs we have:
<ul>
• A graphic designer to design our album cover and logo (time sensitive).
• Help with marketing the album to radio stations and other places.
• People to share our campaign on social media.
• People to help get us booked at different venues and services.

Background

Greg is a Jazz Vocalist from Atlanta, Georgia that is passionate about bringing hope and joy to the world and those around him. He does this by sharing and performing elegant and excellent music. He is excited to take a step from the stage to the studio to record his first-ever full length album as a way to share his music and his joy in music on a wider level.
<ul>
• Greg is an independent artist, well connected in the Jazz circuits of Atlanta.

• He is teaming up with Delbert Felix (Bass), Kevin Bales (Piano),  Justin Varnes (Drums), Melvin Jones (Trumpet), and John Sandfort (Tenor) to perform a blend of hiply arranged and lesser known Jazz Standards, original compositions, and Jazz arrangements of Alternative Rock tunes.
• He has co-written a tune with Delbert Felix (Arranged by composer/pianist Tyrone Jackson), which will be recorded with acclaimed Hip Hop Artist/Social Activist Sho Baraka.
• Greg will be recording his debut album in Atlanta, at The Studio with the renowned Engineer and Jazz Drummer, Marlon Patton.
• Justin Varnes, along with Greg, will produce the album.
• The album will be recorded in December 2017, and released in March 2018.
More About Greg
-For more info on Greg, videos, recordings, photos, and how to see him at a future performance, please visit http://gregrobbinsmusic.com.
-Videos of Greg can be found at gregrobbinsmusic.com/videos/ as well as facebook.com/gregrobbinsmusic.
What We Need
The total amount needed to produce this album is $12,250. The funds raised in this campaign will help fund:
<ul>
• Engineering, Mixing, and Recording Costs
• Musician Compensation
• Arrangement Compensation
• Post-Production Mastering
• CD and Vinyl Production
<li>Album Art &amp
• Mechanical Licenses
Impact Beyond the Music

Greg's passion lies not only for the music, but also for investing in the community around him. He has a heart for those who are marginalized in society and works to support organizations who are equipped to serve people in Atlanta in meaningful ways.
<ul>
• Greg will donate 10% of all album revenues to SafeHouse Outreach, an organization that Greg maintains a close relationship with.
• SafeHouse works to provide sustainable support to the homeless in Atlanta.
• To learn more about SafeHouse or how you can also get involved, visit SafeHouseOutreach.org
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
<ul>
• Share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter!
• Be on the lookout for updates and announcements along the way!

The Musicians 

Delbert Felix (Bass, Co-Songwriter)

Delbert Felix is one of the most legendary jazz bassists living today. Known for his distinct time, tone, and attack on the bass, he is celebrated by Jazz musicians and fans around the world as a true Great in the Jazz world. Delbert comes from St Helena Island, SC, near Hilton Head. After studying at Florida A&
column2:
M University, he went to the Berklee School of Music in Boston. He then spent time in the military with the US Navy, where he was playing in a band and taught Bass. After this he worked with Wynton Marsalis and toured with Joe Henderson and Branford Marsalis, among many other Jazz legends. Delbert has been involved in numerous recordings between 1980 and now, including the Branford-Marsalis albums Random Abstract (1988) and Trio Jeepy (1989) as well as recordings with Billy Cobham, Freddy Cole, Courtney Pine and Chris Potter. Today Delbert resides in Atlanta and maintains an impressive schedule of performing both in Atlanta and around the country as well as teaching locally.

Kevin Bales (Piano, Co-Arranger)

Kevin’s initial career move was to the University of North Florida and a budding if little-known jazz program. There he met and performed with, and went on to record and tour with, a number of monumental artists who had settled into that burgeoning North Florida jazz scene. Giants like Wynton Marsalis, Louie Bellson, Eddie Daniels, James Moody, Ben Tucker, Ira Sullivan, Sam Rivers, and Nat Adderley. He toured with Bunky Green for five years, he spent 15 years of spot tours and four albums with guitarist Nathen Page, he has developed a lifelong association with trumpeter extraordinaire Marcus Printup that has included recordings on Blue Note/Capital records, and he spent 10 years touring and recording with vocal iconoclast Rene Marie, which culminated in a Grammy Nominated album.

 Kevin has amassed a long list of awards and a reputation as one of the finest jazz pianists in the world. In 1994, less than a decade into jazz, he won the American Pianist Association’s Jazz Piano Competition. In addition to nearly every important jazz venue in the South, he has performed in some of the most acclaimed clubs and festivals in America and around the world: the JVC Jazz Festival in New York, The Bakery in Los Angeles, The Kennedy Center and Lincoln Center jazz series, the Toronto and Edinburgh jazz festivals, and the Moscow Center for the Performing Arts. Today, on top of his rigorous  performance and recording life, Kevin manages his own jazz program, overseeing an ambitious schedule of ambitious jazz students.

Justin Varnes (Drums, Co-Producer)

Born in Jacksonville, Florida, Justin Varnes studied music at the University of North Florida. After a brief stint with the Noel Freidline Quintet, he relocated to New York City to pursue a master’s degree in jazz studies at the New School. In New York, Justin toured for six years with vocalist Phoebe Snow, with whom he performed on the Roseanne Barr Show, on National Public Radio’s “World Cafe” (he would later perform on “World Cafe” with pop group “Five for Fighting”), and at Madison Square Garden, where he played alongside singers Jewel and Paula Cole.

Justin has performed with several jazz greats in New York, including: Ben Wolfe (Harry Connick, Jr), Aaron Goldberg (Joshua Redman), Wessell Anderson, Wycliffe Gordon, Marcus Printup, Steve Kirby (Cyrus Chestnut), Peter Bernstein, and Eric Lewis (Wynton Marsalis). He has also performed with Mose Allison, Kenny Barron, Ann Hampton Callaway, Victor Goines, Wycliffe Gordon, Audrey Shakir, Vincent Herring, The Earl Klugh Trio, Oscar Perez, Bob Reynolds, Lew Soloff, David Sanchez, Annie Sellick, Phoebe Snow, Ira Sullivan, Christian Tamburr, and Doug Wamble. Currently residing in Atlanta, Justin performs with Kevin Bales, Mace Hibbard, Joe Gransden and Gary Motley. Justin is also a top call sideman for touring artists through Atlanta.

Melvin Jones (Trumpet)

From Memphis, Tennessee, Melvin Jones has worked with a diverse range of musical icons in various settings such as Quincy Jones, Jon Faddis, Antonio Hart, Jennifer Lopez, Kirk Whalum, Ray Charles, Erykah Badu, Isaac Hayes, Marc Anthony, Stevie Wonder, Brian McKnight, Michael McDonald, Bill Cosby, Illinois Jacquet, George Bohannan, Clark Terry, Mike Burton, Sho Baraka, Lecrae, and Omar, to name a few. He has an Bachelor's Degree from Morehouse College in Atlanta, and a Master's Degree in Music from the Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University in New Brunswick, New Jersey.

For six years he was the Interim Director of Bands and Instrumental Studies at Morehouse College, until he resigned in 2010 to focus on his performance and recording career. Melvin is Artist in Residence for the ""Mentoring Through the Arts"" Program presented by the United Jazz Foundation and the U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Education, he toured with Tyler Perry's production of ""Madea's Big Happy Family,"" and holds numerous other highly impressive accomplishments and sponsorship endorsements, which can be found on his website. 

John Sandfort (Tenor)

John Sandfort is a jazz tenor saxophonist living in Atlanta, Georgia after spending portions of his career in Chicago, IL, Long Island, NY, and Buffalo, NY. He has a degree from Northwestern University in Evanston, IL, and is a former member of the critically acclaimed Sony recording group Mighty Blue Kings, having shared bills with B.B. King, Ray Charles, Diana Krall, Tony Bennett, Buddy Guy, and many others. John plays regularly with many of the Southeast’s finest musicians and groups including Joe Gransden, Justin Varnes, and Bumpin' The Mango, and he just recently recorded his debut CD, Southbound, for Hot Shoe Records.

Sho Baraka (Guest Artist)

Educated at Tuskegee University and the University of North Texas, Sho studied Television/Film, Anthropology, and Public Administration. He has become an artist, philosopher, and social-thought leader in contemporary culture. He has spent nine years traveling the world as a recording artist and public speaker. He has done numerous overseas activist work, ranging from race relations in South Africa to establishing musical cohorts in Indonesia. He is a founding member of nationally known Christian hip hop group 116 Clique. Sho Baraka is also the founder of Forth District.

He now desires to blend his artistic platform with his academic leanings to contribute a unique perspective in both arenas in hopes of raising the standard, thereby raising the culture. Sho currently lives in Atlanta, GA and co-leads a consulting network that is active in cultural renewal.

Who we are

Key Change Cabaret is devoted to building community through music. We strive to produce the highest quality musical events for locals and visitors to Savannah. We appreciate the contributions made by all of our artists and patrons that help us to grow as a company and as a city dedicated to the Arts.
We value Creativity, Collaboration and Passion.​
Started in June of 2013 by a group of artists and technicians, we produce cabaret-style music events ranging from the Great American Songbook to Rock n Roll and everything in between.
Why you should help

We are hoping to raise $2500 to help our keep our series going. Last year, we were forced to move out of our 5 year home in downtown Savannah. Our interim location worked out as a temporary location, but we are still looking for a comparable space to our original location. With a little help from our friends and patrons, we can raise the funds to create an intimate performance in a unique setting again.
All funds raised will go towards the continued production of the cabaret series, including artists fees, audio visual needs and equipment rental costs.
Your Impact

We have 6 years of experience producing high quality, live music performances that utilize local musicians and technicians. Over the years, we have learned that our patrons desired a venue where they could go and listen to music with state of the art sound design and amazing acoustics. We believe that by providing intimate experiences where audience members get to see a behind the scenes look, we are building a stronger community with our patrons and bridging the gap between the artist and patron. With shifts in the economy, many of our staff work as freelancers and depend upon job opportunities that we create to make ends meet. Your contribution will ensure that we are to continue to offer them employment.

Share the Love

We understand that you may not be able to make a contribution at this time, but spreading the word to friend, family and anyone else you think may be interested helps just as much!

Short Summary
Hello! If you watched the videos on this page then you already know a little about me and what is going on.

My name is Brock Davisson and I'm a musician/guitarist since 1992. I have dwarfism and clubfoot and get around with the help of a wheelchair/walker. When a guitar was presented to me and my brother in 1992 by my parents at a early age, I realized right away that I couldn't play like everyone else due to limited mobility in my wrists/joints from dwarfism so I did what came natural and just put my hand over the top of the fretboard and off I went and here I am today where music is my entire life and I'm still loving it!

I'm writing to say thanks to all the familiar people that know who I am today for showing support the past few years and helping us get out the 2015 album ""Outtakes From The Soul"" which has had great success online worldwide and made it #15 on the billboard blues chart May, 21st 2016, and for all the love on my youtube and facebook videos and posts and more. None of it would have happened without you and we greatly appreciate you believing in us and letting our passion for music come out to make you happy as well. For those who don't know me, please look me up on youtube and facebook and watch the many videos that are available and share them if you like them, leave me comments if you enjoy them, and friend request or follow me!

We now sit here in 2018 with a huge smile, and we want to let you know it's time for the 2nd album to become a reality! For awhile now we have had many people wanting to know when another album was going to come out and here we are! The plan is to showcase maturity and diversity and in the end create something that showcases mine and our skills and make a fuller production, experiment with tones and sounds a little more compared to the last album and much more. Just like the last album we will need your help to turn our passion and love into music and to get it out there to the world again. We did so great last time and we're hoping we can do great again because remember it's only possible with the help of you! The help that we recieve from you believing in us will determine how much we can do this time around. We have plans to make more CD's this time, and possibly reissue ""outtakes from the soul"" on CD as well since many has asked for a CD copy of it again and possibly more professional video content and more! I hope you consider giving something and enjoying this ride with us. Thanks!
Brock Davisson FACEBOOK fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/BrockstarDavisson/
Brock Davisson FACEBOOK personal page: https://www.facebook.com/Brokstar
Brock Davisson YOUTUBE page: https://www.youtube.com/user/BrockDavisson1978
Brock Davisson INSTAGRAM page: https://www.instagram.com/brockdavisson1978/
BrockDavisson TWITTER page: https://twitter.com/Brock_Davisson
Skylight Media HOMEPAGE: http://www.skylightmedia.com/
Skylight Media FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/SkylightMediaWV/
<h3>What We Need &amp

I will need at least $5000 to get the album started and finished. This also includes the price to order 500 CDs. I will be using Skylight Media again for the production (recording, mixing and mastering). Andy, Courtney and Josh of Skylight Media will be helping me write as well as playing some of the other instruments on the album. We may have a few other musicians as well. Some familiar faces, like Daniel and Todd, and my friend Dustin.

We have some awesome perks for donors! We will have signed physical CDs, album downloads, signed 10 inch mini guitars, shout-outs, and even a real USA custom built Roberts telecaster made in GA, USA and it will be signed by me too!

::::: DISCLAIMER ::::: There is no time limit set on perks because life happens. Most likely everything should be done by early spring 2019 and out by summer 2019 or earlier if all goes as planned. We will get them out as promised as soon as we can when the new album is recorded, mixed and mastered and we get them back etc. If you follow me on social media sites, you'll be updated there as well as here with progress and any changes.
<h3>Risks &amp

There isn't much risk really. I worked with the same studio on my last album 4 years ago. We learned a lot and have worked out most of the kinks in that process. All of the money is going to go into this project. if we go over $5000 we will use the extra to maybe order the album on vinyl or order more than 500 CDs. We can order the 1st album again and have those available once more for those who still want it on CD.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute we ask you to please share this campaign with others all over your social media accounts so that we can reach as many as possible.
","Short Summary
Hello! If you watched the videos on this page then you already know a little about me and what is going on.

My name is Brock Davisson and I'm a musician/guitarist since 1992. I have dwarfism and clubfoot and get around with the help of a wheelchair/walker. When a guitar was presented to me and my brother in 1992 by my parents at a early age, I realized right away that I couldn't play like everyone else due to limited mobility in my wrists/joints from dwarfism so I did what came natural and just put my hand over the top of the fretboard and off I went and here I am today where music is my entire life and I'm still loving it!

I'm writing to say thanks to all the familiar people that know who I am today for showing support the past few years and helping us get out the 2015 album ""Outtakes From The Soul"" which has had great success online worldwide and made it #15 on the billboard blues chart May, 21st 2016, and for all the love on my youtube and facebook videos and posts and more. None of it would have happened without you and we greatly appreciate you believing in us and letting our passion for music come out to make you happy as well. For those who don't know me, please look me up on youtube and facebook and watch the many videos that are available and share them if you like them, leave me comments if you enjoy them, and friend request or follow me!

We now sit here in 2018 with a huge smile, and we want to let you know it's time for the 2nd album to become a reality! For awhile now we have had many people wanting to know when another album was going to come out and here we are! The plan is to showcase maturity and diversity and in the end create something that showcases mine and our skills and make a fuller production, experiment with tones and sounds a little more compared to the last album and much more. Just like the last album we will need your help to turn our passion and love into music and to get it out there to the world again. We did so great last time and we're hoping we can do great again because remember it's only possible with the help of you! The help that we recieve from you believing in us will determine how much we can do this time around. We have plans to make more CD's this time, and possibly reissue ""outtakes from the soul"" on CD as well since many has asked for a CD copy of it again and possibly more professional video content and more! I hope you consider giving something and enjoying this ride with us. Thanks!
Brock Davisson FACEBOOK fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/BrockstarDavisson/
Brock Davisson FACEBOOK personal page: https://www.facebook.com/Brokstar
Brock Davisson YOUTUBE page: https://www.youtube.com/user/BrockDavisson1978
Brock Davisson INSTAGRAM page: https://www.instagram.com/brockdavisson1978/
BrockDavisson TWITTER page: https://twitter.com/Brock_Davisson
Skylight Media HOMEPAGE: http://www.skylightmedia.com/
Skylight Media FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/SkylightMediaWV/
What We Need & What You Get

I will need at least $5000 to get the album started and finished. This also includes the price to order 500 CDs. I will be using Skylight Media again for the production (recording, mixing and mastering). Andy, Courtney and Josh of Skylight Media will be helping me write as well as playing some of the other instruments on the album. We may have a few other musicians as well. Some familiar faces, like Daniel and Todd, and my friend Dustin.

We have some awesome perks for donors! We will have signed physical CDs, album downloads, signed 10 inch mini guitars, shout-outs, and even a real USA custom built Roberts telecaster made in GA, USA and it will be signed by me too!

::::: DISCLAIMER ::::: There is no time limit set on perks because life happens. Most likely everything should be done by early spring 2019 and out by summer 2019 or earlier if all goes as planned. We will get them out as promised as soon as we can when the new album is recorded, mixed and mastered and we get them back etc. If you follow me on social media sites, you'll be updated there as well as here with progress and any changes.
Risks & Challenges

There isn't much risk really. I worked with the same studio on my last album 4 years ago. We learned a lot and have worked out most of the kinks in that process. All of the money is going to go into this project. if we go over $5000 we will use the extra to maybe order the album on vinyl or order more than 500 CDs. We can order the 1st album again and have those available once more for those who still want it on CD.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute we ask you to please share this campaign with others all over your social media accounts so that we can reach as many as possible.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Marietta, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-keep-handicapped-man-s-musical-dream-alive/pica

Short Summary

In our last year of 2017, we were met with unprecedented rising costs to produce the event, while still wanting to keep the intimate family vibe everyone has come to love about Luminosity. Unfortunately, when all was said and done we lost a significant amount of money producing the event last year, and being a completely grassroots event created by artists, we did not ever have backend investors backing the project. As of today, we are still owing upwards to $10,000 from producing Luminosity and so we were unable to make the initial investments to produce another event this year. 

We have set up an Indegogo to reach our goals to clear previous debt to artists and crew from previous years. Once our debts have been cleared, we look forward to organizing a reunion in 2019 at a beautiful new piece of land back on Vancouver Island! Pics of the land below!
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• We are still owing $4400 to core production crew and artists, and an additional $5000 in land rental costs from Luminosity 2017.
• We have some amazing rewards for donations including Luminosity T-shirts designed by Inkspoon, Third Eye Tapestries, Luminosity stickers, camping gear, and discounts off of our next event.

• Our New Land
    We are looking towards 2019 and would LOVE to gather with you once again! We are envisioning going back to our roots in creating a 1-2 night outdoor campout in summer 2019! In order to do this, however, we need to raise the funds still owing from the last Luminosity. And so, we are reaching out to you, our family, for your support! If Luminosity has impacted your life in a positive way, and you would like to see this keep going, every contribution big or small really helps!
Other Ways You Can Help

• Help us get the word out! Share our campaign with your friends, family, and anyone else who has loved Luminosity Gathering over the years! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Short Summary
When I was young I always knew I wanted to be a singer, but I also knew I would need a stable job to provide a regular income too.

What if, when you are young and begin to realise your dream and passion is music, you can work 100% towards just that? Knowing there is a career available. Rather than splitting your enthusiasm, splitting your focus and splitting your energy (No, it's not just a hobby nan!)

This is the core reason we are building The Unsigned Library, to help fellow independent musicians and future generations to learn about the music industry from day 1 and know they can earn what they deserve for their musical talent and start to build a career in music licensing.

After many years as a singer, skating around the periphery of the music industry, I was lucky enough to work with some great Producers, write some great songs, learn about and most importantly fall totally and utterly in love with music placement - those songs on adverts that you just can't get out of your head or those songs on tear-jerking ITV dramas that have you feeling emotional for days! That's music licensing! Selling licenses for your incredible music to be used on advertisements, tv, films, radio &
column2: gaming. An industry that is thriving, however so many independent musicians don't know about it, don't know how to get started or they think they'll lose control of their music due to not understanding the intense legal language on licenses (let's be honest who can afford a lawyer to check things over before you sign on the dotted line?)

column1: We have been working on this project and brand identity for almost 2 years, to ensure it is focusing on the right direction, filling the gaps of the current, similar offerings and now we are ready to ask all you lovely people (musicians, bands, music lovers, independent music supporters, advertising agencies, music production companies, anyone really) to support us and make it a reality.
Built for musicians by musicians -  what a beautiful story!
Talking of stories, here's Leila's.
The Impact
* Let's increase the amount of independent music used on ad campaigns, TV &
column2: film. * Let's create a potential launch platform for budding artists * Let's connect brands and artists together and watch them grow.​

column1: I have been working within the Marketing industry for almost 10 years now, alongside this as a singer, songwriter. I have had the pleasure of meeting and working with many creative and strategic brains, music publishing companies, music licensing companies and talented musical masters.

Agencies and Producers often seek independent musicians to create a sound-a-like song for their campaign, or music on advertising, which is great for keeping the cost lower for the client but would still be a fair payment for independent musicians. On top of this it's great that agencies are more focused on the campaign as a whole. Fiona Gaiger (strategic planning consultant for Brand &
column2: Agency) says in her testimonial for The Unsigned Library, ""in keeping with the spirit of responsible business, the fair pricing policy and percentage return to the musician demonstrates a belief in rewarding raw talent fairly."" PERFECT!

column1: When I was asked by Glenn Keiles (award winning music composer and producer) to write a song overnight for a brief he was asked to compose for, I was instantly hooked and immediately wanted to find a way to help other musicians feel that rush. Writing a song to brief overnight, recording it the next day and knowing people would hear it on tv - what a buzz! This is when the brainstorming began...This was the opportunity of becoming a working musician without touring for months away from family and friends, I could still have a family and also follow my dreams in music and earn from music royalties.

Being surrounded by so much incredible undiscovered talent and seeing the work available for them is what drove the focus to the advertising industry. We will seek songs with that extra something, great songs that connect with you emotionally. We've seen the 'emotional connection with the audience' becoming a more important goal for brands
column2: Sainsburys, Marks and Spencer, John Lewis, and most recently Amazon and the high street banks are just some of the brands that have joined in on this advertising genius. Whether it's in the melody, lyrically or instrumentally, if a song grabs you emotionally it can result in significantly increased sales for the brand using it.

column1: <h3><strong>What We Need &amp
We are fundraising to build the website that will change our (independent musicians) lives and our music careers as we know it.

THE WEBSITE - it's a super duper one! with intense backend coding to ensure we can tag our music in as many ways as possible, we can upload, download, search, sell, discuss briefs with the client, make revisions to music, access a jobs board where the client can post jobs for musicians to pitch on, all at the same time! so that is why it will cost the grand sum of £30,000 but this is the entire ship! the rest of the funding will be for marketing and PR to launch the platform to both musicians and advertising agencies, music supervisors, production houses, etc (everyone that needs music for their content will hear about us, let's just say we've touched base with London Flashmob!) leaving £25,000 for marketing, PR and initial website running costs - Let's let the world know we are here!
Here's a marketing plan we had drawn up to show you that we are on top of things - you'll see potential marketing opportunities for when we launch The Unsigned Library.

Now take a look at how the website could look, bearing in mind we're no web designers! (we'll leave that to the professionals!) this is just a mock up so you can get a feel for the platform, super cool, easy to navigate and will be the host for some (hopefully all one day!) of the most current, relevant independent music available.

Yes we have high hopes and so much passion for this project! in the 5 year plan there's music venues, musicology research, innovative algorithms for a deeper search-ability, forefront of discovering musical trends – industry partnerships, studio &
column2: musician GPS. The ideas for the growth of this brand are big!

column1: THE BRAND - Cool, Current, Creative, Emerging, Exciting, Evolving...

We've always had the brand identity as a core focus, as we know how important it is to help aid the success of a new business and continuous growth in a competitive market. The Unsigned Library fits like a glove into the trendy unsigned music community and its relative companies i.e. BBC Introducing, Glastonbury unsigned stage, The Unsigned Guide and Unsigned Music Awards. Alongside being a marketing dream, this will instantly put us within the right space to attract the right artists and clients and become an integral part of the unsigned industry which is growing in size due to artists choosing to remain unsigned and in control of their music.
COMPANY POSITION &
column2: THE TEAM - The Unsigned Library is a Limited company and holds a trademark in the UK under 5 classes, which cover the key areas for business operations and for the potential areas of growth. Trademarks for the rest of Europe and US are next. I have personally invested £7,500 in the company on legal, trademarks, design, brand &
column3: social media support. I will also personally invest whatever I can, hiring interns &amp
column4: musicians until the company is generating an income.

column1: We have one of the most passionate teams, with personal drive and vision for the company, We are working &
column3: web developers, marketing consultant advisors, digital marketing consultant, accountant, musicians working on A&amp
column4: R, music producers, song writers, multi instrumentalists, singers and a potential A&amp
column5: R collaboration with a fabulous new music start up, who also make it their life mission to expose independent music.

column1: We've made you a little video to give you a little more insight into licensing, how it works and why you should get involved.

THE VISION - So with a successfully funded campaign, we will create a platform to recognise and magnify the quality of independent music. Actively promoting and pitching the library to advertising agencies &
column2: music production houses. With years of working around creative campaigns, we know the potential of work that is out there for us. Linking a brand with emerging talent can have invaluable and long term results for both and that is why a core focus is the advertising industry. Let's fill the library full of great tracks and let them speak for themselves......preferably on national tv!

column1: THE PERKS - Ok so we've done some thinking on this and after lots of research into what people want, we have decided to keep it personal, we want you to feel like a part of this family and be on this journey with us, so everyone that pledges will become a 'Founding Member' of The Unsigned Library and be recorded on our 'wall of love' on the website forever! We have a few different perks that will express our gratitude for supporting independent music
column2: from unlimited use of the platform for musicians to VIP invitations to join us at our AGM (which will of course be an epic launch party not a boring meeting) we know support like this is because you're interested in the company idea or a musician yourself and we want you around to watch the brand grow.

column1: NB: As some of the perks are dependent on the platform being built, we will add your pledges to a pot that we will continue to add to, holding events and thinking of other fabulous money making ideas!

CHARITY - We are delighted to say that we will be collaborating with a charity close to our hearts, but until the finer details are confirmed we can't officially announce it, but we're chuffed to bits to support them and you will be too.
What will you do if you don't reach your funding goal?

THE BACK UP PLAN - Although when you break down the funding goal to 2200 people kindly pledging £25+ each, it doesn't sound so scary!....should we not reach the target amount, we plan to break the journey down into smaller stages, should we raise enough for the website alone, that's amazing, we can begin to populate the library with music and with a fully functioning platform we can promote it to advertising agencies and music supervisors and start raising awareness prior to any marketing launch. Also we can set up a second round of fundraising for the marketing budget, by this time we will have the website to show potential supporters.
Be transparent and tell your potential supporters of any risks &
Risks &
We have identified 2 at this time:

Ensuring the volume of music and composers is available on the library prior to launching to the advertising agencies and music production companies (and communicating our position should we meet them at an earlier stage) We are aware that there are various avenues to source music, however we also know that the music seeker will hunt high and low, always using every avenue available to find that 'perfect piece'.

We will make a huge impact and standout by having quality music, great songs, killer tracks, a library full of emerging talent to work to brief, so should you not find the perfect song for your campaign they can create it for you. This is how we will be used again and again and become known for the place to find all (eventually!) incredible emerging talent.

The other area of challenge will be to clearly and effectively communicate our '100% pro-musician' values to independent musicians. Ensuring it is understood that we are musicians building this platform for musicians, no catches, no sneaky small print!
We're all running in the same music circles, the trust has been easier to build and the platform is being built for us as well as them. Win win!

There will always be obstacles to slow us down, but we don't mind reducing the speed if it means clarifying our message, ensuring we are on the right path and staying true to the values of The Unsigned Library. An organically grown company driven by passion and talent.
Other Ways You Can Help
I hope we have tantalised you enough to pledge your support to this great project, but if you would like to support us in other ways to help us achieve our funding goal, PLEEEASE DO!

We appreciate all the help you can offer, whether it's shouting from the rooftops on your social media platforms, or on actual rooftops (for professionals only - do not try this at home!) There are tools for sharing so please go right ahead and use them!
Supporting The Unsigned Library is supporting the independent music community. Help us help them earn what they deserve and build a financially rewarding career in music.

We will always try to improve everything we do and if you haven't pledged on our project we would love to know why? Please send us your feedback so we can learn and adapt. unsignedlibrary@musician.org

Supporting The Unsigned Library is supporting the independent music community. Help us help them earn what they deserve and build a financially rewarding career in music.

We will always try to improve everything we do and if you haven't pledged on our project we would love to know why? Please send us your feedback so we can learn and adapt. unsignedlibrary@musician.org",1.0,5,"1 Campaign
