0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
The Album

I'm excited about recording this collection of  my children's songs, ""Music All Around""!  If you can help out, just click on the perk of your choice, or click the red ""Back It"" button to make a donation of any amount.  Your contribution can be anonymous if you wish.  Produced and engineered by the brilliant team of Ken Whiteley and Nik Tjelios, the album will contain 15 clever, uplifting, participatory, audience-tested, kid-friendly songs!  The album will feature instrumental and vocal contributions from more than 35 people -- see the list below.  Please help cover the costs for the producer, musicians, recording and mastering engineers, graphic design, printing, manufacturing and distribution.  Your support will help get this music out into the world so that children of all ages can sing and smile along!  Thanks, Chris
The Producer

I'm delighted that legendary musician and producer Ken Whiteley agreed to produce this album.  With production credits on over 135 albums that have sold over 8 million copies, Ken is known for his brilliant work as a producer and performer on numerous projects, including fabulous children's albums by Raffi, Fred Penner, Kathy Reid Naiman, Al Simmons, The Junior Jug Band and more.
The Sound Engineer

Sound engineer and musician Nik Tjelios has been working with Ken since 1993.  He recorded and co-produced Jenny Whiteley's Juno Award-winning debut album in 2001, and has engineered Juno-nominated albums by Amos Garrett, Suzie Vinnick, The Sultans of String, The Traditional Arabic Music Ensemble and many more.  Ken and Nik – known as ""the Wizards of Ossington"" – have a kind of ESP when working together!
The Musicians

Anna Ludlow:  violin
Ben Whiteley:  double bass
Brothers Aloud (Eric Vernon):  voices
Bucky Berger:  drums
Chris White:  voice, acoustic guitar
Chris Whiteley:  harmonica
Christine Graves:  voice
ESP (Brenda Thibault, Louise Ashenden, Louisa Coates, Angelina Cacciato, Nick Le Pan):  voices
Iyabo Ameen:  bodhran, voice
Jack Hui Litster:  percussion
Jenny Whiteley:  voice
Jim Lawry:  voice
Ken Whiteley:  accordion, acoustic guitar, autoharp, banjo uke, bass harmonica, dobro, electric guitar, jaw harp, kazoo, mandolin, organ, percussion, piano, red-backed boinger, siren, tenor banjo, triangle, vacuum cleaner, vibraphone, washboard, washtub bass, xylophone, voice
Mary Gick:  banjo
Sid Ameen:  acoustic guitar, electric guitar, voice
The Merry Songsters (Cecilia De Souza, Lucy Goveas):  voices
The Sparrows (Sid Ameen, Iyabo Ameen, Eva Ludlow Hebbs, Daniel S. Aguilar, Ariana Moody, Hera Moody, Giulio Ferraguto, Mirriam Qureshi):  voices
The Wroxton Wramblers (Campbell Liu Munroe, Nathaniel ""Nate” Murphy, Aiden Lepri):   voice, kazoo
Tim White:  electric bass
Tony Turner:  voice
Turquoise (Sandy Shaw, Jean Shaw, Iain Baines, Lucie Sawczenko):  voices
The Songs
1.  Song Inside My Head – I made up this song while talking about musical concepts with a Grade 2 class.

2.  Joey – When I told Stewart I thought his dog Joey was lucky, he immediately answered, ""I'm the one who's lucky!""... and this song was born. I dedicate it to Turquoise, an inspiring music group of couples dealing with dementia.
3.  Bruce's Loose Tooth – This song about the loss of dental objects has a *molar*!
4.  Felix Unger – In this song, Molly Malone, the fish monger of ""Cockles and Mussels"" fame, meets Felix Unger, whose name happens to be an excellent vocal exercise!
5.  Bibliophile – This song is based on my very pleasant memories of going to the library with my mother as a child.
6.  Pink – This fun song was suggested by Mirriam, age 3 1/2. Ken Whiteley plays it in *four* different keys on the piano, with his brother Chris playing along brilliantly on the trumpet!
7.  Home School Kids – I wrote this one for The Sparrows, a group of home schoolers who wanted a school song!
8.  Music All Around – Dedicated to Sid Ameen and all children who bring music to life!
9.  Eat the Crust – The pizza song -- it's been a slice!
10.  Alex Austin – Alex celebrated his ninth birthday when I was a counselor at Camp Towhee.  We sang this song for him at lunch time in the dining hall.
11.  Look Around – An action song about being proud to be who you are.
12.  The Greedy Dog – The Sparrows and I made up this song with its a ""ruff-along"" chorus after reading one of Aesop's fables. The final verse is a salute to tofu lovers.
13.  Caterwaul – A protest song about our cat's biggest fear:  the vacuum cleaner! Thank you to Mary Gick for suggesting this song!
14.  Circle of Song – Everyone loves this sing-along anthem of hope written by Tony Turner. This version will feature a guitar intro by Sid, age 12, and some lovely violin playing by Anna Ludlow.
15.  Hold Fast to Your Memories – Jim Lawry wrote the words for this song at a magical place called Unicamp. He dedicates it to kind-hearted souls everywhere, past and present.
About Chris White
<div>

Chris White grew up in a musical family and has been involved in music for his whole life.  He played the recorder and sousaphone in elementary school, sang in his father's children's choir, and performed in a singing group with his brothers and sisters.  He started playing the guitar and writing songs as a teenager.  After acquiring degrees in English, Mathematics and Education, he worked as a high school teacher and high tech manager.  Chris co-founded the Ottawa Folk Festival in 1993 and guided its evolution for 16 years in the role of Artistic Director.  He coordinated the Writer's Bloc songwriting group and brought the Great Canadian Song-Along to Ottawa, and over the years has created countless concerts and events to connect people with music and musicians.  Since 2013, he has produced and hosted ""Canadian Spaces"" – Canada's longest-running folk radio show – heard Saturdays from 10 to noon on on CKCU FM and www.ckcufm.com.  Chris leads five ""just for fun"" weekly singing groups, including a group for home schooled children (The Sparrows) and a group for couples dealing with dementia (Turquoise).  He has released two previous albums:  ""Inner Voice"" and ""I'm a Poet... and I'm Aware of It"".  Chris received the Helen Verger Award in 2012 for his ""significant, sustained contributions for folk music"".

","Summary
Do something beautiful in the form that suits you best, according to your own temperament."" - Guy de Maupassant

Yes, ""Do something beautiful."" That is our mantra. whitewolfsonicprincess has been working for nearly 2 years on this new record entitled: ""The Alternate Boot - Vols. 1 & 2 !""  14 songs, 61 minutes. Recorded the old-fashioned way: musicians live in the recording studio, playing off the vibe of the room, connecting with each other, together creating a unique musical alchemy.

The finished project will be released on all the major digital platforms as well as a 2-CD album. We are working on the packaging now. We are reaching out to you, our friends and fans, to help us bring the project into the light.
We sometimes eclipse our own dreams with reality."" - Patti Smith

The Alternate Boot Vols. 1 & 2  spans a lot of time: writing, rehearsing, recording, mixing & mastering. The music explores songs of light & shadow, songs about the mystery of our existence, songs about our collective spiritual quest. A project created by an amazing community of creative, talented, soulful & inspiring musicians.
We are grateful and humbled by your support. Your dollars will help us complete the project: printing the packaging, and promoting the music to radio stations near & far.
We have been working with a group of truly extraordinary musicians. We believe that ""the good work,"" enriches us all
column2: those who do the work, those who listen, and those who are inspired to create too. Music & art touches us all
column3: deepens our experience, expands our imagination, enriches our lives, our minds, our hearts. We are inspired by artists of all kinds who are doing the ""good work"" every day. We are excited and honored to have an opportunity to bring our fully-realized music to the world. We want to give back to those who have inspired us, and we hope that we can inspire others too. ""You Must Believe!""

Short Summary

The Rossini Club, in an effort to put the heart back into classical music, hearkens to another age when chamber music was made in almost every home. With its multilayered creative process involving composers, performers, and laymen working together, the Club recreates this process, both with our programming and our concert settings. The Rossini Club is strongly invested in its Nantucket community, providing music for those who cannot access it as easily, such as seniors and young children. It is our mission to spread music to musicians and non-musicians from all walks of life.

Your contribution will not only help us this summer, but for future summers to come. If we meet our goal, we will be able to start a general fund to ensure future Rossini Club seasons. Help us make the Rossini Club a permanent fixture of Nantucket's cultural life!
<h3>What We Need &amp

In short, the expenses of Nantucket do provide a hurdle in terms of our financial burden. Most of our funding therefore is concerned with the practical aspects of bringing our musicians to the island and providing the supplies they need for their time here:
<ul>
• $1200 Musician Travel
• $1000 On-Island Transportation
• $1050 Food Stipends
• $750 Administrative Costs

If we are unable to complete our funding this year, our funds will still be used towards covering all of our practical costs for this summer. In thanks for your contribution, we are able to offer a number of unique items featuring our work and our musicians:
<ul>
• RC Logo T-Shirts
• RC Summer 2018 CD's
• Complimentary Tickets
• Rehearsal attendance
• Ambrosia Nantucket Tea
• A private concert in YOUR home!
The Impact

We have been curating events including music and food since 2012, and we wish to see our program expand to a more sustainable and permanent model for the Nantucket summer season. Through our collaborations with Ambrosia Nantucket, the Nantucket Music Center, the Nantucket Historical Association, the Nantucket Atheneum and the Nantucket Culinary Center, we have been fortunate to bring our arts to a wide variety of audiences. This summer we also continue our musical outreach to the retirement communities of Nantucket, and are excited to be debuting our educational program at the Nantucket Boys &
column2: Girls Club. We are also excited to be collaborating with the Theatre Workshop of Nantucket on a unique Cabaret Night as an ongoing effort to diversify and blend differing art forms. Our intent is to reinvigorate the classical music community on Nantucket through communication and connection with music.

column1: <h3>Risks &amp

We know Nantucket is a busy place with so many things going on it's hard to keep track! Our product is unique however in its flexibility. The purpose of these projects and concerts is to make our art form accessible, and in doing so re-identifying classical music as an integral part of our culture. By bringing the concerts to unusual locations and to pair them with unique events, we hope to foster a keen interest not just for our series, but for the arts in general.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't make a donation, come to our concerts this summer on Nantucket island! Spread the word about our fundraising efforts and thank you for your continued support.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

We are recording our first studio album and we need your help! Our passion for life has fueled these songs, which carry a message of hope in response to heartache and find magic in the everyday moments.

We have been gigging relentlessly for three years to hone our sound, polish our songs, and pinch all the pennies we could to prepare for this record. By winning Downtown Ithaca’s Battle of the Bands in September we earned a chunk of studio time at Pyramid Sound Recording Studios.

Now here’s where you come in! We need to top up our studio time and get this project past the goal line. Your contributions will directly help us finish recording and producing, create album art work, press CDs, and make this whole thing possible.

We are embarking on this campaign as a way to hopefully get a few of you lovelies to pre-order the album. But that is not the only thing we're offering! For the right price we will come to YOU and rock out for you and your friends!

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit our campaign page. It truly means a lot that you stopped by this page and that you will consider donating to make this record happen! Check us out on Facebook and Instagram for some more content and to keep up with progress.
Thanks!!
-Kitestring

Now here’s where you come in! We need to top up our studio time and get this project past the goal line. Your contributions will directly help us finish recording and producing, create album art work, press CDs, and make this whole thing possible.

We are embarking on this campaign as a way to hopefully get a few of you lovelies to pre-order the album. But that is not the only thing we're offering! For the right price we will come to YOU and rock out for you and your friends!

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit our campaign page. It truly means a lot that you stopped by this page and that you will consider donating to make this record happen! Check us out on Facebook and Instagram for some more content and to keep up with progress.
Thanks!!
-Kitestring",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Ithaca, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kitestring-s-first-studio-album--3/pica

Who We Are
Ayanna Moriah Eliza Allen aka AMEA
Performer, Speaker, Songwriter, Producer
Walter Montesinos
Career Navigator, Managerial Services, PR
Tori Alberta
Creative Director, Graphic Artist

With many collaborations in the works, mainly funded by our own expenses, we would like to offer a chance for supporters to give back, encourage new projects to be continued and collaborative efforts to be carried out
With much gratitude!
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• With your help, we will be utilizing these funds for travel expenses
• Partnering with various groups across the country seeking to make a positive impact in the lives of artists and in turn, the community
• If the goal is not reached, we will still plan to allocate the funds the same. Every bit helps! We appreciate it!
The Impact
<ul>
<li>We simply seek to uplift and continue to spread the space and mindset to be inspired by life while continuing the willingness to learn love, be love, and dream
column2: this includes continual collaborative efforts and providing artist mentorships and development

column1: • Since 2016, AMEA has been an artists to watch with accolades from the UK to Texas since her hit single, ""Vaycay"" and projects such as: ""Baggage Claim"" ""The Learning Tree"" ""Intimacy""

• Last summer, AMEA's first official video release sparked much acclaim throughout the city of San Antonio and beyond. Continuing this series of visual productions that stay with us throughout generations is the next step for the Inspire Love Dream Team
<h3>Risks &amp
<ul>
• Being a queer woman of color in the entertainment industry has presented various challenges. However, with many challenges come many lessons to learn and teach
• Our team mindset is to ever evolve in love, this means, we understand there will be many obstacles but that's the reason we began this journey, to be more than a conqueror in love
Other Ways You Can Help
If you would like to contribute but can't right now, don't worry!:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about ILD's campaign.
• Stream AMEA's music on Spotify, Apple Music, and More with your family and friends! --links above
• Watch AMEA's music videos on YouTube! --links above
<li>Share the message to Inspire Love &amp

With Much Gratitude,

The Inspire Love Dream Team

For Christmas this year I have recorded a charity single in aid of The Royal British Legion as a thank you for all the incredible work that they do.

To go with it we’re making a video set in the trenches in World War One with a professional team and have been lucky enough to get some phenomenal actors involved (some of whom you might recognize)!
Everybody on this project from the cast to the crew is a volunteer, but we still have the costs of costumes, props and equipment hire.
All the proceeds from this song will be donated to The Legion and we can't wait to share it with you.
We'd love it if you could help, and will be sending a signed DVD out to all those who donate.  So if you are kind enough to give a contribution, please e mail us at info@devonmayson.com, and give us the postal address where you’d like it sent.

Thank you so much,

Devon

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
A Musical Star that's Ready to Soar

Elle Renee is sixteen going on superstardom, and she's been working so hard to get there. Over the last two years Elle has been honing her craft as a singer/songwriter and spending long days in the studio to record her music. All while going to school full time, performing in local events, and doing her chores at home (okay, okay, she's still working on making her bed).

Elle is just a few months away from dropping her first ever EP, and she wants to mark this launch by staging a concert where she can meet her fans and perform her songs (did we mention she's also an awesome dancer?). So how about it -- give this talented and hardworking girl that first big boost she needs to break out and become the star she's meant to be.
Help Elle Renee stage her first concert

Elle Renee needs funding to cover concert venue rental, wages for band members, dancers and stage technicians, event insurance, marketing and all the other elements and moving parts that must come together to produce an engaging, high-quality event.

Elle's first concert will be held in Toronto in late spring / early summer 2018. Contributors who pitch in with at least $25 get a ticket to the event. Bigger donations are rewarded with perks such as in-person meet-and-greet with Elle and Skype or FaceTime chats.

Can't make it to Toronto for Elle's first concert? We've got your back. Show Elle some love and she'll do a shout out with your name on it during the concert or on a special occasion such as your birthday. You can even send a picture and we'll flash it on the screen onstage while Elle sings a song for you.
Be part of Elle's journey

Elle's been working so hard to make her dream come true. 16-hour days in the recording studio? Yup, with no complaints. Jam-packed weeks when she's so busy she doesn't even have time to hang with her friends? That's the life when you're so focused on your goal.
With the upcoming release of her first EP, Elle is finally getting to where she wants to be. Contribute to her campaign and be part of her journey.
Good to know we're good to go

If you've ever seen the movie Rocky, then you probably remember those scenes when Rocky jogs and drinks raw eggs to get ready for his big fight. Elle isn't exactly cracking uncooked eggs into her morning cup but she is training hard for her first concert. At the same time, the team of people supporting her has already started the process of planning this exciting event.
Can you keep a secret? Well that's no fun
There's a time for keeping quiet and a time for making noise. This is definitely one of those occasions that calls for extremely LOUD NOISE.
Please tell your peeps about Elle Renee and her crowdfunding campaign. Use those Indiegogo share tools and spread the word about this talented singer and songwriter (and she's adorable too, right?).

Hope to see you all at the concert.

Sigue hasta abajo para leer en Español
The Adventure!

The idea of ""SPACE"" is born as an album that represents the music I have been wanting to write for some time–a mixture of classical music, with influences of pop and film music. ""SPACE"", like me, is influenced by sci-fi culture. Introducing sonorities of peaceful distant worlds. Occasionally needing the time and space to get away from everything, to disconnect, to leave Earth and enter a calm mindset.
A task with a lot of Soul!

I have been working on this project for the past two years, pouring all my heart into its creation and finally launch is imminent.  It all started in 2016 when the idea of ""Captain K"" came to my mind and then to create a sonic universe for his story became a necessity. A universe that extends in mindfulness, perceptive and contemplative.
Lets Take Off!

When you contribute to this campaign, you help me achieve my lifelong dream of creating a cohesive album with a storyline. This project encapsulates my creative spirit. I hope it captures your imagination too.
You can participate by ordering any of the amazing perks
column2: there are piano and djing classes with me. You can also get a private concert for you and your friends... you could even have your own song in the style of ""SPACE"" and of course be the first to listen before the official release!

column1: Details

""SPACE"" goes into the studio in April and it will be pre released to all supporters once its production is finished–probably in late May.  Until then you can pledge for the demos as one of the perks offered for the campaign, in case you are dying to have a preview. The official launch will happen later on after the filming of the music video for ""Captain K""  and once ""SPACE"" has found a home label.
Where Is Your Support Going?

Your support will enable going to the studio, recording, paying musicians, the sound engineer who will also mix and master the whole thing. The creation of a visual identity for Space (album cover, poster and visuals) filming the music video for the first single of the album and the story of ""Captain K"".
The Risk

Having chosen flexible funding means that we will launch into space no matter what. In case we don't reach the goal I will adapt and maybe release fewer songs thus reducing costs. We could also go over the goal, which would mean more support for the official release of the album in terms of promotion. But ""SPACE"" is a reality no matter what happens.
Share Share Share!

Calm minds, less stress. 
Some days life hits you like a ton of bricks... Step back, take a deep breath, and give yourself some ""SPACE"".


If you are not able to support right now, please:
Share this campaign to your Facebook and tag me (https://www.facebook.com/rt.mateus/)
Tweet the link and tag me @juicymateus
Follow me on Instagram @mateus_music
Send me a message, let me hear what you think... I'm always open for ideas and thoughts!
Sobre ""Space""

¡Hola! Soy Ricardo Tovar Mateus y estoy a punto de embarcar en esta aventura de crear mi primer álbum. Se trata de un álbum enfocado en la reflexión, música concebida para abrir tu mente e inspirar estados de ánimo cinemáticos y evocar galaxias lejanas. En este proyecto he querido también regresar a mis raíces musicales usando el piano y la voz como instrumentos principales, y relatando historias cercanas a mi alma como la historia del ""Capitán K"". Recuerda que puedes obtener más de una Recompensa... combínalas a tu gusto!
La Aventura!

""SPACE"" nace como un álbum cargado de ideas musicales que he estado desarrollando desde hace un tiempo–una combinación de música clásica con pop y música de cine como principales influencias. ""SPACE"" refleja mi pasión por la ciencia ficción, y contiene sonoridades que evocan plácidos mundos distantes. A veces necesitamos encontrar ese punto en el espacio-tiempo en el cual poder perdernos sin miedo, alejarnos de todo lo terreno, desconectarnos y trascender a un estado de paz mental inaccesible de otro modo.
Un Trabajo Hecho Con el Corazon!

He dedicado los últimos 2 años de mi vida a la concepción y realización de este proyecto, poniéndole el alma entera, y ahora ha llegado el momento de su lanzamiento. Todo comenzó en 2016, cuando la idea detrás de ""Capitán K"" surgió en mi mente y así también la necesidad de crear un universo sonoro para presentar esta historia–un universo que se extiende en los confines de la mente y que además inspira en mí la más profunda conexión con mis sentidos.
Y Asi Arrancamos!

Sumarte a esta campaña es contribuir a hacer realidad mi gran sueño como artista: crear un álbum musical con un concepto narrativo y sólido. ""SPACE"" contiene gran parte de mi espíritu creativo. Espero que sea un trabajo igualmente capaz de capturar tu imaginación.

Puedes participar simplemente escogiendo alguna de las ""estelares"" recompensas que he puesto a tu disposición:  clases particulares de piano o DJ conmigo, o un concierto privado para ti y tus amigos... incluso podrías tener tu propia canción escrita en el estilo de ""SPACE"" y ser el primero en escuchar el álbum antes de su lanzamiento oficial!
En Detalle

""SPACE"" será grabado en Abril, y será lanzado anticipadamente para todos los patrocinadores una vez se haya finalizado su post producción hacia finales de Mayo. Hasta entonces podrás obtener los diferentes demos como parte de las recompensas ofrecidas como parte de la campaña, en caso de que no puedas esperar ni un minuto más para echar un vistazo a los avances del proyecto. El lanzamiento oficial se hará tras la filmación del video musical ""Captain K"" (""Capitan K"") y apenas hayamos encontrado un sello discográfico para ""SPACE"".
Cual es el destino de tu aporte?

Tu aporte nos permitirá acceder a los estudios de grabación, cubrir los honorarios de los músicos participantes así como del ingeniero de sonido encargado de mezclar y masterizar todo el material, además de posibilitar la creación de una identidad visual para ""SPACE"" (portada del álbum, afiches y visuales), la filmación del video musical del primer sencillo del álbum y la historia del ""Capitán K"".
Los Riesgos

Al escoger una meta de financiamiento flexible hemos querido dejar claro que lanzaremos este cohete al espacio pase lo que pase durante la campaña. En caso de no alcanzar la meta de financiamiento, habrá un lanzamiento reducido (menos canciones) para reducir costos. También podríamos ver superadas nuestras expectativas de financiamiento, lo que nos permitiría enfocar una mayor parte del presupuesto hacia la promoción del álbum y su lanzamiento. En cualquier caso, ""SPACE"" es y será una realidad.
Comparte!
Mentes calmadas, menos estrés.

En ocasiones, la vida te golpea con un ladrillo... detente, respira profundo y dáte un ""SPACE"".

Si no puedes contribuir, por favor:

Comparte esta campaña con tus amigos en Facebook y etiquétame   (https://www.facebook.com/rt.mateus/)
Twitea el link y etiquétame @juicymateus
Sígueme en Instagram @mateus_music

Escríbeme, dame tu opinión... Estoy abierto a nuevas ideas y comentarios!

↓  e n g l i s h   w i l l   f o l l o w  ↓
d r e a m r o o m

je conçois dreamroom comme un petit conte musical semblant provenir d'une époque à la fois très lointaine et actuelle. ses quatre chansons nous parlent de thèmes universels tels que la mélancolie, les nuages, l'autodestruction et la confiance. influencée par le jazz, la pop expérimentale, la musique contemporaine et le r&
column2: b, ma musique se situe sur la frontière entre le royaume des songes et le monde réel. dreamroom est écrit, composé, arrangé et interprété par moi et implique la participation de plusieurs musiciens invités.

column1: pourquoi ai-je besoin de vous ?

le projet est déjà bien entamé : les arrangements sont presque complétés et une séance au studio makina a servi à enregistrer le piano, la contrebasse et la batterie avec le trio misc. néanmoins, comme mon projet est complètement indépendant et autofinancé, j'ai besoin de votre aide pour couvrir plusieurs dépenses ultérieures qui serviront à :
<ul>
• engager une dizaine de musiciens (un quatuor à cordes, un quintette à vent ainsi que d'autres instruments additionnels)
• aller en studio à deux reprises ce printemps pour enregistrer les arrangements
• engager un mixeur
• faire de la promotion pour le projet
sur ce...

mon projet est ambitieux. j'aurais pu choisir de lancer ma carrière en produisant un album un peu plus sobre, n'impliquant que moi et un piano droit, mais ce n'est pas le cas! j'ai donc besoin de votre aide pour vous offrir un premier ep luxuriant et sans compromis.
merci en avance pour votre support. j'espère sincèrement que ma musique vous fera du bien!
xo
<div>
d r e a m r o o m

column2: b, my music is on the edge between the realm of dreams and the real world. dreamroom is written, composed, arranged and performed by me and involves the participation of several guest musicians.

column1: <div>
why do i need your help ?

the project is already well started : the arrangements are almost complete and a session at studio makina was done to record the piano, bass and drums with the misc trio. however, as my project is completely independent and self-financed, i need your help to cover several subsequent expenses that will be used to :
<ul>
• hire a dozen musicians (a string quartet, a wind quintet and other additional instruments)
• go to the studio twice this spring to record the arrangements
• engage a mixer
• promote the project

my project is ambitious. i could have chosen to start my career by producing a slightly more sober album, involving only me and an upright piano... but that's not the case! i therefore need your help in order to offer you a lush and uncompromising first ep.
thank you in advance for your support. i sincerely hope that my music will do you good!
xo

d r e a m r o o m

je conçois dreamroom comme un petit conte musical semblant provenir d'une époque à la fois très lointaine et actuelle. ses quatre chansons nous parlent de thèmes universels tels que la mélancolie, les nuages, l'autodestruction et la confiance. influencée par le jazz, la pop expérimentale, la musique contemporaine et le r&b, ma musique se situe sur la frontière entre le royaume des songes et le monde réel. dreamroom est écrit, composé, arrangé et interprété par moi et implique la participation de plusieurs musiciens invités.
pourquoi ai-je besoin de vous ?

le projet est déjà bien entamé : les arrangements sont presque complétés et une séance au studio makina a servi à enregistrer le piano, la contrebasse et la batterie avec le trio misc. néanmoins, comme mon projet est complètement indépendant et autofinancé, j'ai besoin de votre aide pour couvrir plusieurs dépenses ultérieures qui serviront à :
engager une dizaine de musiciens (un quatuor à cordes, un quintette à vent ainsi que d'autres instruments additionnels)
aller en studio à deux reprises ce printemps pour enregistrer les arrangements
engager un mixeur
faire de la promotion pour le projet
sur ce...

mon projet est ambitieux. j'aurais pu choisir de lancer ma carrière en produisant un album un peu plus sobre, n'impliquant que moi et un piano droit, mais ce n'est pas le cas! j'ai donc besoin de votre aide pour vous offrir un premier ep luxuriant et sans compromis.
merci en avance pour votre support. j'espère sincèrement que ma musique vous fera du bien!
xo

Hi everyone!

I’m Brooke, an LA based singer/songwriter/hustler originating from NYC. My single collaboration with Nicky Romero ""Heartbeat"" was #2 best dance record worldwide! I just signed my next two song releases to a record label and both songs were produced by Grammy award winner, Benny Reiner (drummer of Broadway's ""Hamilton""). I just returned from Tokyo and Iceland where I shot my next music videos and short film. I am very proud that the project was completely self-funded with an incredible team of cinematographers (they just shot Justin Bieber’s videos). Last year I booked my own international music tour without having management or booking agent and sold out shows in three countries (Japan, Indonesia and Singapore). Again just weeks ago, after hundreds of emails, rejections and cancellations, I didn’t give up and ended up booking a slot to perform at my biggest show yet, Ultra Japan Mainstage! Finally getting the yes and standing on that stage was the most rewarding moment of my life. There are no words to describe the thrill to sing and connect with a crowd of 100,000 people
column2:
it truly filled my whole heart!

I was just asked last minute for an opportunity of a lifetime to now perform Mainstage on the other side of the world at Ultra Brazil next week!!! This show is non-paid
column3:
I would be doing it solely out of love and as a huge platform to take my career to the next level. Having the chance to sing in front of a massive festival crowd in both South America and Asia could launch me to sign with a booking agency upon returning. Getting a visa to Brazil is extremely difficult as the consulate is backed up for two months but with immense tenacity, I wouldn’t take no for an answer and walked out of the consulate with a visa in my hand. That was a sign to me from the universe that I am meant to be there on that stage!

Having your support and love as contributors during such a time crunch when there is such an amazing last second opportunity waiting for me, would fill me with magnified gratitude. Since I was unable to prepare for flight costs to leave in a few days, hotels, visa fees and food, having your Indiegogo contributions could change my life and really make a difference in my career and provide me with an incredible life experience. This is everything I have been working so hard to obtain day in and day out. I am looking to raise $3,000 to go towards covering my travel expenses to get out there only for the sake of performing on October 12th. I feel confident that with your help and now that I have obtained pulling of getting an expedited visa, I can be on that stage singing at Ultra Music Festival Brazil! Spread the story to friends, family and loved ones, thank you guys!!

All the love,

Brooke

Summary
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/V6hh1WG3nqo?autohide=1&amp
Hello, everyone, I'm Evelyne.

I have been working with artists around the world and helping them to bring an edge to their pop music, for many years, with much success! I’ve even co-written an album published by West One Music, which was an amazing experience and I consider it a major achievement and milestone in my musical career.
But now, FINALLY, I have written a song, and started an album, which I know will serve as my first professional single as an artist…
Like most of us, I have demons
column2: and, while some of these demons come from within, others are born of traumatic circumstances.

column1: ""Wasted"", my first single, was written about one such incident, and when I played back the demo I'd recorded of it, I knew it was time to move forward as an artist. I'd found my ""sound"" (dark, moody, truth-telling soul-pop).

I was feeling exhausted and sad, reminiscing on an awful experience I’d previously had in my life that continues to haunt me today. I sat down to my keyboard. I dug deep into that pain and emotion and just played. What happened next was a state of flow and creativity that resulted in this song.

A few days later, still wondering what to do with this song, I got a call from James Sanger (http://www.vibeystudios.com/about-james-sanger....) and we discussed and decided that we would work together on this song.
James has worked with some of the most influential artists of our time
column2: Dido, Adele and Keane to name just a few, and these artists, incidentally, have been some of my main influencers growing up.

column1: ‘Wasted’ is a song that most of us can relate to, most of us have experienced the pain within the song. But the personal aspects I have weaved into the song make it a dark, sonic and soulful piece with a unique side that will have people asking for more to understand the full story. As a contributor to this initial campaign, you will allow me to begin what is likely to be the most difficult, beautiful and cathartic experience of my life. And you join me on the journey!
What We Need &

I have spent countless hours working on my songs in my bedroom and with friends in their home studios. I have the most beautiful experiences from these times and have created unique sounds. Especially with my friend Tarun:
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/vcwUQl8wtE8?autohide=1&amp

However, now that I have a shot at doing it pro, I must raise at least £3,000 for a full week of studio time plus production.  My professional overheads are estimated at £3,000, which includes a full week of professional studio time, fully production, mixing, mastering, vocal coaching and artist development.
What you'll get is exclusive updates on the progress of the song, a signed copy of the single when it releases - and sneak peaks into the music video we're shooting for the song. :)
The Impact

Music has been my sanctuary in hard and good times. I immerse myself in sounds which make my world richer and more colourful no matter what. I'm a synesthete - I see music in colors and I feel it all around me. I see it as the best way to explore what I've been through and to find an answer which makes everything feel clearer. I write songs for everything, every emotion, every experience.

When I set out writing this album I wanted to tell my own story, which is composed of all of these things and more, and I wanted to share that journey with the world. This album is about creating something beautiful from the most painful memories, for everyone who has been through pain, heartache, abuse, trauma, loss, love, joy, happiness... and how they triumphed in times of strife.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you might not feel able contributing with money, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Check it out:
<ul>

• You can help me to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign! Share on social media, blog about it - whatever you like. I will thank you with a signed copy of the single/ album if you pop me your details.
• Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. This is as real as it gets, guys. 

So. Shall we?

About Ronnie Eriic
I'm an artist, songwriter, and full-time go-getter from Scotch Plains, New Jersey. Since graduating with a bachelors degree from FAMU &
column2: a masters degree from Full Sail University, I've had the opportunity to perform at various well-known venues in Atlanta, Florida, and New York.  Music is my passion and has always been apart of my upbringing.  I went from playing the drums &amp
column3: singing in my church's choir to NOW recording my very own EP!

column1: R.E.A.L (Recognize Everything Aint Limited) is a collection of songs that are inspired by my lifestyle, my personal journey dealing with self-doubt and the sacrifices I've made. With your help, I can finish recording the project.  I consider this EP my debut.  Therefore, I want to curate a project that not only consists of good vibes but good quality as well. With the help of GRAMMY-nominated record producer and engineer Nick Chahwala of Bravo Ocean Studios in Atlanta, my project will be mixed, mastered and complete!
The Objective
The goal is to raise at least $3,000 to help cover the expenses.

This campaign is all about illuminating my talents by creating a project that will allow my supporters to experience (first-hand) the process leading up to the release of my EP.  With the help of you guys, I will be able to cover the remaining cost for the following:
>
>
>
>
column2: Launch Party at Bravo Ocean Studios (~$650)

column1: >
The Impact

Your contribution, whether it’s large or small, will not only change my life as an artist but will give me the tools to be able to give people an experience while listening to my music.  With your help, I will be able to go from local to international.

Music is a universal language that we all speak.  Through music, some speak love, some show vulnerability, and some find healing.  Me, I speak all of the above + my truth, which is why people can relate.  That’s why this project is so important to me!
So among all these things, your contribution will help my dream become a reality and will help my career excel to the next level.  Join me and let's share some great music with the world!
Perks

To the right are a list of Perks (offered to backers in exchange for their support) that you have the choice of claiming or not claiming at the time of your donation to my campaign.  Each perk is named after a song off of the EP to give you guys a feel for whats in store.  So, either way you decide, I truly appreciate your consideration and support.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to contribute, I STILL LOVE YOU. You are the reason I exist. You can help by sharing this page, and continue to like, comment, and share our content. Thank you!

Ciao!

I'm Giacomo from Venice, Italy. My stage name is Jack Moody because my songs are ""moody"", ranging from soft to heavy rock to classic ballads! I've been writing songs since I'm 16 y.o., but only now I'm ready and willing to present them to a larger audience than my friends!

I'm making the first rock album of my life! it's a big deal for me and an exciting new adventure.
I've already invested all my savings to record 5 songs, but now I need your help
to reach my goal of recording 10 songs in total, and record, print and distribute my first rock album! 

I've added the video of my song ""Venice"" in this campaign, please listen to it and 
if you like it and you want to hear more, please donate whatever sum you can!

If you'll donate 10 usd/euros I'll send you a downloadable online version of my album!

If you'll donate 20 usd/euros I'll send you a signed copy of my first album!

If you'll donate more, I'll add you the aknowledgements of my album and you'll get a copy asap!


Hope you'll like my music!

Peace&

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
What The Hell Is A Brass Band?
West Grand Brass Band is a 6-piece group based out of Oakland, CA, consisting of one Saxophone, one Trumpet, two Trombones, one Drummer, and a Tuba.

We have been partying throughout the Bay Area since 2014, when we got our start supporting the Hot Pink Feathers at Carnaval. Shortly after, we started busking at the park at Lake Merritt, bringing the party to the people enjoying their Saturday mornings at the park and the farmer's market. These busking sessions, in addition to allowing us to develop our sound in a low-pressure environment, led to a number of other opportunities (including the East Bay Jazz Festival.)

Despite our traditional brass band roots, we have been working hard to push the envelope with what can be done using brass instruments and electronic effects. This debut album will be a showcase of this new style, a genre we like to call BDM (Brass Dance Music).
The Birth Of BDM

Over the past year each of us has slowly been building up our pedalboards to create the biggest, fattest sound we can. The idea of running horns through some effects is certainly not new, but the scale we are bringing to this idea is. By using synth pedals, auto-wahs, delays, and electronic drums, we are able to turn the tunes we play acoustically into full-blown electronic soundscapes capable of boosting any party or DJ set.

We are super stoked on this sound and love performing at parties and bars around the Bay Area, but what we really want is to bring our show to the rest of the world. In addition to distributing our music on worldwide platforms like Spotify and iTunes, having a high-quality example of our unique sound will allow us to apply to your favorite festivals.

BDM may be a term that we are coining, but we also want to see how far this sound can go. By putting our ideas out there, we hope to inspire other brass musicians to explore the limits of their sound. There aren't many models to follow for horn players looking to incorporate electronic effects into their performances, and we would love to help make that knowledge more accessible.
Quid Pro Quo

Albums are expensive, especially with larger bands and lots of effects. Fortunately, we know just what it will take to make this happen. In the fall of 2017 we recorded a 3-song demo with David Simon-Baker at Allegiant Records (http://www.allegiantrecords.com). This was an opportunity for us to test the feasibility and cost of recording horns in a way not many people have done before. (If you're curious, you can find one of the songs from the demo in our video.) While we have saved up some of the money we need to make this album happen, there is quite a large price-tag involved with this type of recording:
<ul>
• Recording live is crucial to our sound. As a dance band, we just can't capture the energy without all playing together at the same time.
• Adding effects is a separate process, and the most experimental part of what we do. We want to make sure we have enough time to properly explore the boundaries of our sound in a studio setting.
• Each track needs to be properly mixed and mastered to make the most of the effects.

• In order to really satisfy your eardrums, we'll be skipping physical cds and offering our album on vinyl instead (as well as digital downloads in all the usual formats.) Producing vinyl requires an additional round of mastering to make the best use of the medium.

Of course, we don't expect you to give without getting anything back! We believe firmly in sharing the love, and have some awesome rewards to share with you. We've tailored these perks to help make sure that as much of your money as possible goes to what you really want: a great album.
<ul>
• Digital Downloads all come with handwritten thank you notes and stickers
• Buying Standard Merch (Posters, shirts, vinyl, scores) will come with a free digital download
• Lessons are available on the instrument of your choice, and can be done in person or via skype
• Signed Scores allow you to follow along with your favorite song and see what we're doing as we play
• Cover Video - We started as a cover band, and would love to record a personalized video of us playing your favorite pop song
• The obligatory Private Performance is a staple of indiegogo campaigns, and is the best way for us to really bring the party to you!!!!!!!!!!
Help Us Bring The Party To You

We've worked really hard to create a new sound that stands out from the plethora of great brass bands out there. The only thing standing in our way is the money to fully realize our dream of bringing our sound to a wider audience. Every little bit helps make our product better, and even though this album will happen in some form, meeting our goal means we can provide the full-length album you deserve to hear.
Short on cash? Have no fear! There are plenty of ways to help us out that won't hurt your wallet:
<ul>
• Follow us on Facebook and Instagram
• Sign up for our mailing list (we'll even give you a free download from our demo for it)
• Come to our shows
• Share this campaign with your friends, family, and household pets

If you're still reading this, go back and read the first letter of every paragraph. It doesn't spell anything, but it's a good excuse to see our perks again. Thank you for reading!!! We look forward to bringing our party to you!!!!!

 

 

 

","What The Hell Is A Brass Band?
West Grand Brass Band is a 6-piece group based out of Oakland, CA, consisting of one Saxophone, one Trumpet, two Trombones, one Drummer, and a Tuba.

We have been partying throughout the Bay Area since 2014, when we got our start supporting the Hot Pink Feathers at Carnaval. Shortly after, we started busking at the park at Lake Merritt, bringing the party to the people enjoying their Saturday mornings at the park and the farmer's market. These busking sessions, in addition to allowing us to develop our sound in a low-pressure environment, led to a number of other opportunities (including the East Bay Jazz Festival.)

Despite our traditional brass band roots, we have been working hard to push the envelope with what can be done using brass instruments and electronic effects. This debut album will be a showcase of this new style, a genre we like to call BDM (Brass Dance Music).
The Birth Of BDM

Over the past year each of us has slowly been building up our pedalboards to create the biggest, fattest sound we can. The idea of running horns through some effects is certainly not new, but the scale we are bringing to this idea is. By using synth pedals, auto-wahs, delays, and electronic drums, we are able to turn the tunes we play acoustically into full-blown electronic soundscapes capable of boosting any party or DJ set.

We are super stoked on this sound and love performing at parties and bars around the Bay Area, but what we really want is to bring our show to the rest of the world. In addition to distributing our music on worldwide platforms like Spotify and iTunes, having a high-quality example of our unique sound will allow us to apply to your favorite festivals.

BDM may be a term that we are coining, but we also want to see how far this sound can go. By putting our ideas out there, we hope to inspire other brass musicians to explore the limits of their sound. There aren't many models to follow for horn players looking to incorporate electronic effects into their performances, and we would love to help make that knowledge more accessible.
Quid Pro Quo

Albums are expensive, especially with larger bands and lots of effects. Fortunately, we know just what it will take to make this happen. In the fall of 2017 we recorded a 3-song demo with David Simon-Baker at Allegiant Records (http://www.allegiantrecords.com). This was an opportunity for us to test the feasibility and cost of recording horns in a way not many people have done before. (If you're curious, you can find one of the songs from the demo in our video.) While we have saved up some of the money we need to make this album happen, there is quite a large price-tag involved with this type of recording:
Recording live is crucial to our sound. As a dance band, we just can't capture the energy without all playing together at the same time.
Adding effects is a separate process, and the most experimental part of what we do. We want to make sure we have enough time to properly explore the boundaries of our sound in a studio setting.
Each track needs to be properly mixed and mastered to make the most of the effects.

In order to really satisfy your eardrums, we'll be skipping physical cds and offering our album on vinyl instead (as well as digital downloads in all the usual formats.) Producing vinyl requires an additional round of mastering to make the best use of the medium.

Of course, we don't expect you to give without getting anything back! We believe firmly in sharing the love, and have some awesome rewards to share with you. We've tailored these perks to help make sure that as much of your money as possible goes to what you really want: a great album.
Digital Downloads all come with handwritten thank you notes and stickers
Buying Standard Merch (Posters, shirts, vinyl, scores) will come with a free digital download
Lessons are available on the instrument of your choice, and can be done in person or via skype
Signed Scores allow you to follow along with your favorite song and see what we're doing as we play
Cover Video - We started as a cover band, and would love to record a personalized video of us playing your favorite pop song
The obligatory Private Performance is a staple of indiegogo campaigns, and is the best way for us to really bring the party to you!!!!!!!!!!
Help Us Bring The Party To You

We've worked really hard to create a new sound that stands out from the plethora of great brass bands out there. The only thing standing in our way is the money to fully realize our dream of bringing our sound to a wider audience. Every little bit helps make our product better, and even though this album will happen in some form, meeting our goal means we can provide the full-length album you deserve to hear.
Short on cash? Have no fear! There are plenty of ways to help us out that won't hurt your wallet:
Follow us on Facebook and Instagram
Sign up for our mailing list (we'll even give you a free download from our demo for it)
Come to our shows
Share this campaign with your friends, family, and household pets

If you're still reading this, go back and read the first letter of every paragraph. It doesn't spell anything, but it's a good excuse to see our perks again. Thank you for reading!!! We look forward to bringing our party to you!!!!!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

Short Summary

I've been playing music professionally full-time since 2009, and I've recorded two albums - ""Allons-y! Time Traveler's Tunes"" with songs from the 13th - 21st centuries, and ""Dance The Knight Away"" with dance songs from 1445-1657.  I play hurdy gurdy, bowed psaltery, flute, pennywhistle, bodhran, piano/toy piano, and dabble in many other instruments, like harp, trumpet, and guitar.  Having expressed my love of Medieval and Renaissance music, I now want to celebrate my inner (not-at-all hidden) geek through music! This album will pay tribute to my favorite board games, video games, RPGs, books, TV shows, and other things I enjoy, like pirates, knitting, unconventional pets, octopus baristas, and Renaissance faires.

In this campaign, I'm raising money to allow me to record this album at Soundwright Studio in Texas, with the amazing Tree Leom, and to get it professionally mixed and mastered.  This is where you come in!
<h3>What I Need &amp

My goal for this campaign is $1,500.  From past experience, the album will cost about $2,000 to record, but I have half of that in personal funds set aside to start the recording process.  The other $500 will go towards mixing and mastering the album.  If I can hit my stretch goal of $2,500, then the additional $1,000 will go towards having the album manufactured in eco-friendly, minimal-plastic cases with 6 panels (instead of the usual 4), so I can provide even more artwork, information, and lyrics.

As a thank you for backing this project, you can pick any of a number of perks, including the new CD in digital and/or physical form, t-shirts (with adorable hedgehog art), a gift pack of the new CD (all of your gift shopping for 10 people done in just a few clicks!), and my entire catalog of albums in digital and/or physical form.
The Impact

Since I'm an independent artist, I don't have large funds coming in from a label or other high-powered contributor.  It takes a community of individuals who all believe in what I'm doing to give life to my music, and allow me to continue to create beauty and joy!
<h3>Risks &amp

If I don't reach my goal, then all of the money raised will still go towards the production of the album, but I'll need to use personal money to finish it, which will delay the completion date.  All perks will be sent out, but you'd have to wait longer to receive them if the goal isn't met.
Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you can or can't contribute, you can still help!  Share this campaign with your friends and family, post about it on social media, and shout about it on the street corner (well, OK
column2: maybe not that last one).  The biggest downfall of many campaigns is that people just don't know about them.  With your help, we can make this geeky labor of love happen!  Allons-y!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

""I will tell you my life story -- it's a cautionary tale
All the years of guts and glory in the belly of the whale""

I'm a songwriter based in Somerville, MA. I started writing songs about 7 years ago and have been working on this collection for the last 3 or 4 years. We released a debut album in 2014, and since then I've been performing and touring throughout the eastern United States.

I've been working with several amazing musicians to help me make these songs come to life, many of whom have been with me since the beginning. Ariel Bernstein at Dimension Sound Studios, who has recently worked with Darlingside and the Ballroom Thieves, is producing and engineering. We are featuring Ethan Robbins, from Cold Chocolate, on guitar and vocals. The album contains 12 original songs, two of which I co-wrote with my friend Andrew Delaney.

I'm really excited about these songs. ""Until the Words Are Gone"" touches on themes of connection and communication. I feel like these songs are especially relevant to the world of 2017. Some of them are love songs, some are break-up songs, and some of them are topical songs. All of them come from my perspective as an artist and human struggling to find meaningful connections in a confusing world.

""Cunning Folk"" took me from humble beginnings to living as a professional songwriter and performer. I'm hoping this new project will take me and my music even further. Arts funding is endangered, and artists are relying more than ever on a community of devoted fans. Your contribution will help pay several working musicians and ensure I can take the next step in my career. It also ensures that we can get this album out into the hands of as many people as possible. For the first time, I'll be pressing vinyl LPs. We also have some cool exclusive swag for you to choose from.
<h3>What We Need &amp

""And if I feel lonely
I’m just longing for a constellation
A line between our bright suns burning""
Here's a breakdown of my anticipated costs:

Recording Studio:      $1300
Musicians:                    $2000
Production/Mixing:   $2000
Mastering:                     $500
Art &
TOTAL:         At least $15,300

That's a somewhat modest estimate, leaving out the cost of creating some of the perks and possible unanticipated shipping costs, and still more than my goal. But it leaves a little flexibility in the promotional side, so a full-fledged marketing campaign is more of a flex goal.
Some of our unique perks include laser-engraved flasks, tote bags, and T-shirts, all featuring my original artwork. I've updated my octopus &
column2: mermaid ""Friends With Benefits"" logo for this project, and you can now get it printed on a tote bag! I also have exclusive one-of-a-kind original artwork you can purchase (see the gallery for a photo), or you can have me come to your home and play a concert in your living room!

column1: The Songs

""Oh, lover, won't you sing me something in a different key
For the dreamers and the frogs, and Oscar Wilde and me...""
In case you're wondering, here are the 12 songs currently being recorded, in no particular order! I'll add links to some more live versions &
column2:
demos of these during the campaign as availability permits!
For Frogs &
column3:
Oscar Wilde
How I Became a Villain
Broken
Hoarse
AloneTogether
Catcallin' Blues
Arrows &
column4:
Slings
Someone (co-written with Andrew Delaney)
Like We Used To (co-written with Andrew Delaney)
99 Bottles
Perfect Rhyme
Everything But Love

column1: Impact

""And I’m afraid the world’s gone crazy
Where to go? Just what is true?
But I know, I can face it, babe,
If I stand right here with you…""

These 12 songs have been in the works for a few years now, and I know some folks have been waiting for me to make this record! Some of the lyrics got modified after the November election. These songs focus on communication, as well as celebrating individualism and the struggle to make positive change in the world. I also feel like ""Catcallin' Blues"" is a great, lighthearted take on a relevant topic.

In 2013, I ran a successful Kickstarter campaign to fund my first album, ""Cunning Folk,"" and released that album in July of 2014. Since then, I have ordered a second printing of that CD and continue to sell it at shows and online.

This is not an easy thing to do, and I will go unpaid for many hours I'm logging at the computer or stuffing envelopes. That stuff is a labor of love, and I consider it a great privilege to be able to earn a meagre living doing this. It's hard to quantify exactly what music is worth, especially when so much of it is available for free. But writing these songs has saved my life over and over again. I hope hearing them will mean just a fraction as much to you.
<h3>Risks &amp

""I have gambled with high stakes,
Seen accidents and earthquakes""

​I decided to do a flexible funding campaign for this project because I don't like the stress of an all-or-nothing campaign and feeling like I'm pushing something down people's throats. However, this means that I could potentially make a small portion of my goal and still have to produce an album. If this were to happen, the funds received will get me as far as possible with the recording project, but falling short of budget would delay the release considerably. Still, I'm confident we can meet this goal and either way we'll make a great record!

I'm also doing a lot of this on my own while continuing to book and play shows and work on graphic design projects, so I need some flexibility on the turnaround time. I'm waiting to set a firm release date until after the record is mixed and I've made a decision about publicity. But I'm confident that we will prevail! I have a great team of musicians and a wonderful network of friends, family, and fans. (Pssst: Help me spread the word!) 

In the worst-case scenario, I will have to do my publicity myself, which means things will move much more slowly with the release, and the album may not get into as many hands as quickly as hoped. It may take me up to a year (or more) to fulfill custom rewards. I've learned a lot since my Kickstarter, and now know to place a much higher value on rewards that require materials or customization. At the end of the day, as long as I can keep myself afloat, the art will go on!
Other Ways You Can Help

""And I'm not the kind to take a crutch,
But you'd still come through in the clutch""

Every dollar helps, and small contributions will add up. But even if you contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't still help:
<ul>
• Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign! You can share this on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.... and don't forget to use Indiegogo's easy share tools!
• Mention this campaign in your social circles and events.
• Come hang out with me at a live show during this campaign and grab a flyer to pass on to a friend or decorate your refrigerator!

WOOO! I'm excited!! Let's make a record. :)

column3: DOTS now has over 15,000 fans worldwide on ReverbNation. We are number #2 Nationally and Globally for Singer/Songwriter, Its the perfect time to release songs on iTunes and Spotify.

column1: <h3 style=""font-weight: normal

column2: >My name is Abby and I'm 16 years old. I've been writing and playing since I was 6 years old. For the past three years my dad and I have been studying and working at building my musical career. Its all I've ever wanted to do. Professionals explained what to do and with your help we've done it. Know I need your help again. I know we can take my career to the next level. They say it's time to produce my first real recordings for release.

>My previous recordings (which are just guitar and vocals) have been on satellite radio several times. One of my videos is on TV in Europe. But these are simply ""base tracks""  recordings (no arrangement).  As I said, we are #2 Globally and in the top

>The trend is to number 1. It is the right time.  Will you go there with me? 

What We Need &

column7: >I'm ready. But the process is complicated and expensive.
>As we did last year, we researched the team and the costs. This is how it breaks down...

column1: <h3 style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column7: >In an email from Nick at SkyFalls Studio  he broke down the costs per song like this

column1: <ol style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
• -pre production/writing (depending on how prepared the song is, hours could vary)  - (This doesn't include hiring additional musicians if needed.)
• -additional musicians, arrangers.
• -recording process (usually will be around 10-14 hours per song) -
• -editing (takes me around 6-8 hours, tuning/timing/fixing) -
• -mixing - (i usually spend around 6-10 hours per mix) -

• -mastering - (Andy Vandette, google him :) Rush/Skillet/Dream theatre/Sting/Paul McCartney/Hilary Duff/ One Direction) - very important to make sure it sounds good on all player, CD, iPod, iPhone, Radio, etc. It a very tricky thing to do. Nick can get it for $100/song

column2: >Subtotal cost per song : $2,700 (10 songs) plus pressing. graphic design and advertising

column1: <h3 style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column7: >Last year we were only able to deliver the handmade cards and the ""Oh, Baby"" CD's. But we posted hundreds of pics of the adventure as it unfolded!! This year we'll do better.  We've added video.

column1: <h4 style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
<ul style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

• A collage of our fan's selfies as the CD cover.  Be a part of a CD!! The name DOTS refers to all of us on the planet... So, our cover design  is a collage of faces of fans/donators, your face could be on the cover!  All for a $1
• If you donate $10, become a fan on Facebook and email a pix of yourself. You will be included in a collage on the cover and get the poster autographed! I am excited!
• We will have tie dyed T's with the Abby J FB cover pix on it. Autographed by me and the team.
<li>Various posters of the team and the Abby J group and the DOTS (you)

• Other Perks include, original promotional photos used by 60's band promoters on their first tours. Artists include the Rolling Stones, Bob Dylan, Cat Stevens, Lead Zeppelin, and more. Signed pix's of Abby and the band and CD's, lifelong show passes, and many more.

• If we don't reach our goals we will use the fund to complete as many songs as we can and use the album sale to finish even more later... half of each download from ReverbNation goes to The Heifer Foundation. A charity that helps poor communities by providing livestock to help feed them.
<h3 style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column7: >I've been writing since I was five. I'm 16 now. Your contributions will mean the difference between world class production and none at all, because I won't put out a halfway song:

column1: <ul style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

• Last year we moved slowly. Many artist jump from stage (or garage) to the studio.  I believe we have a successful track record with projects like this because we ask question and do what is suggested.
• Some criticized us for asking for help for lessons. We wanted to make it real. I think we've done that to build peoples trust. What do you think?
<h3 style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column7: >It won't be easy to complete 5 songs during a school year. My grades have to stay where they are 3.8 or higher. My friends are very dear to me and I need to keep their friendship. And there's always chores and the side jobs cleaning, babysitting, and now painting.
>I'd love to just play out for money, but there are age restrictions in the bars. And my dad is very careful about the places we play. But we have a plan for all these things.

column1: <ul style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

column1: <span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
","Its a year later and time for
Part 2
We are ready to Record the CD. We are number 16 Globally.

All the pieces are in place. People are responding. Abby J & DOTS now has over 15,000 fans worldwide on ReverbNation. We are number #2 Nationally and Globally for Singer/Songwriter, Its the perfect time to release songs on iTunes and Spotify.
Now

My name is Abby and I'm 16 years old. I've been writing and playing since I was 6 years old. For the past three years my dad and I have been studying and working at building my musical career. Its all I've ever wanted to do. Professionals explained what to do and with your help we've done it. Know I need your help again. I know we can take my career to the next level. They say it's time to produce my first real recordings for release.

My previous recordings (which are just guitar and vocals) have been on satellite radio several times. One of my videos is on TV in Europe. But these are simply ""base tracks""  recordings (no arrangement).  As I said, we are #2 Globally and in the top
20 globally for all Genres 34 million songs and 3.68 Million Musicians, Venues, Labels, and Industry Professionals
The trend is to number 1. It is the right time.  Will you go there with me? What We Need & What You Get
I'm ready. But the process is complicated and expensive.
As we did last year, we researched the team and the costs. This is how it breaks down...
Production Costs Per Song
In an email from Nick at SkyFalls Studio  he broke down the costs per song like this
-pre production/writing (depending on how prepared the song is, hours could vary)  - (This doesn't include hiring additional musicians if needed.)
-additional musicians, arrangers.
-recording process (usually will be around 10-14 hours per song) -
-editing (takes me around 6-8 hours, tuning/timing/fixing) -
-mixing - (i usually spend around 6-10 hours per mix) -

-mastering - (Andy Vandette, google him :) Rush/Skillet/Dream theatre/Sting/Paul McCartney/Hilary Duff/ One Direction) - very important to make sure it sounds good on all player, CD, iPod, iPhone, Radio, etc. It a very tricky thing to do. Nick can get it for $100/song
Subtotal cost per song : $2,700 (10 songs) plus pressing. graphic design and advertising.
Our goal is $ $34,000
PERKS
Last year we were only able to deliver the handmade cards and the ""Oh, Baby"" CD's. But we posted hundreds of pics of the adventure as it unfolded!! This year we'll do better.  We've added video.
This year

A collage of our fan's selfies as the CD cover.  Be a part of a CD!! The name DOTS refers to all of us on the planet... So, our cover design  is a collage of faces of fans/donators, your face could be on the cover!  All for a $1
If you donate $10, become a fan on Facebook and email a pix of yourself. You will be included in a collage on the cover and get the poster autographed! I am excited!
We will have tie dyed T's with the Abby J FB cover pix on it. Autographed by me and the team.
Various posters of the team and the Abby J group and the DOTS (you)

Other Perks include, original promotional photos used by 60's band promoters on their first tours. Artists include the Rolling Stones, Bob Dylan, Cat Stevens, Lead Zeppelin, and more. Signed pix's of Abby and the band and CD's, lifelong show passes, and many more.

If we don't reach our goals we will use the fund to complete as many songs as we can and use the album sale to finish even more later... half of each download from ReverbNation goes to The Heifer Foundation. A charity that helps poor communities by providing livestock to help feed them.
The Impact
I've been writing since I was five. I'm 16 now. Your contributions will mean the difference between world class production and none at all, because I won't put out a halfway song:

Last year we moved slowly. Many artist jump from stage (or garage) to the studio.  I believe we have a successful track record with projects like this because we ask question and do what is suggested.
Some criticized us for asking for help for lessons. We wanted to make it real. I think we've done that to build peoples trust. What do you think?
Risks & Challenges

It won't be easy to complete 5 songs during a school year. My grades have to stay where they are 3.8 or higher. My friends are very dear to me and I need to keep their friendship. And there's always chores and the side jobs cleaning, babysitting, and now painting.
I'd love to just play out for money, but there are age restrictions in the bars. And my dad is very careful about the places we play. But we have a plan for all these things.
The recording schedule will be set for my vocals and guitar on weekend sessions, in the afternoon.
Once the homeworks done, hanging out is OK... in fact I often hang out with my friends and we all do homework together.
I've been an A student through a lot of changes over the past years. My family helps a lot. And we won't be playing late night gigs during school nights. It always comes first.

About the side jobs, we are starting to book paying gigs. Yah!!! We'll play at restaurants - like The 5 O'clock Club, The Bay in Whitefish Bay, and Buck & Cheryl's Bar & Grill. Coffee shops, farmers markets and  are great places to play. House parties and festivals and finally SummerFest next year are all in the works.

We did one concert at The Miramar Theater in Jan and are booked for another on Feb 15th. We will continue to play smaller theaters like Turner Hall when ever possible. Fan/friends FRANS will get promo dicounts on tickets.
We are doing charity events. We are scheduled to play at Children's Hospital on June 3rd, 2015
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
I'm asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it.
