column9:
>Some of the hottest, most provocative artists in the world are waiting for you to discover them.  You can amplify the voices of a new generation. 

Help a local legend become a global name by contributing to this campaign, which will  cover amazing international artists in a behind-the-scenes reality series, offer them a chance to win a trip to the finale in Miami, and empower fans to amplify the voices of their favorite artists.  The old Music Business model is tired.  Let's change the game together. Let's Take Back the Mic.

What is
column10: >Take Back the Mic: the World Cup of Hip Hop?

column1: <div>
Take Back the Mic is the World Cup of Hip-Hop.
column2: >It’s a reality competition that puts fans in the driver’s seat to discover
column3: >and promote the most soulful hip-hop artists from around the
column4: >globe. TBTM fans will use the amp.it platform we've built to vote for their favorite acts — and to win their own fan competition. More than just a show, it’s a movement to amplify

column1: ""...the real lesson of hip hop is what it can teach us about the value of human capital. Many of the great hip hop entrepreneurs were kids who had been given the worst of everything: housing, schools and expectations. When they became successful, we were surprised...The untapped treasure is what it always was. It is that smart kid you never saw coming."" - Prof. Dan Charnas, NYU
http://www.ft.com/…/4282afc8-ab9f-11e4-b05a-00144feab7de.ht…
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

 Take Back the Mic: the World Cup of Hip Hop launches right now in Kingston, Jamaica
column4:
and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. On February 26 we will take you straight to the streets of these cities where the hottest local talents will compete to make it to the finale in Miami on May 4.  We put the power in your hands to make a star, as you vote on amp.it, a platform we built to reward fans for discovering and sharing new music.  The highest scoring artist from each city will win a trip to perform at the finale in Miami and the three highest scoring fans worldwide will win a trip to join them.

We already have significant partnerships to help cover the costs of pre-production, flying artists and fans to the finale, producing the finale at one of the top venues on Miami Beach, and promoting the show to audiences around the world. Your contribution will ensure that we can finish principal photography on location in each city and complete post-production in time to release the first 4-minute ""webisodes"" on April 6th and announce the winning artists &
column5:
fans on April 10.  With the first season in the proverbial “can,"" we hope to attract significant sponsors and strategic partners who can help us grow Take Back the Mic to global proportions.

In exchange for your generosity, you get some cool perks, from t-shirts, to original graffiti artwork, to a credit on the show, to VIP tix to the finale, to a 3-day/2-night stay in Miami to attend the finale.

With your support, we intend to surpass our fundraising goal.  But if for some reason, we don't make it all the way to $50,000, we will use the funds we have raised to shoot the series, while we raise more money to finish post-production.

The Impact

Our team has experience working with major media and tech companies including HBO, ABC/Univision, Google, LinkedIN, the NBA &
column6: the NFL.  YOU will complete the team that has what it takes to completely flip the script on how the next generation of music stars are discovered &
column7: promoted - to make a first season so hot it literally ""goes global""!
column10:
Challenges

To our knowledge no one has ever produced a Hip Hop competition that films the lives of young artists around the world and gives other young people the power to decide which artists best represent them.  Our team is producing an entire season of 36 mobisodes in 4 countries, 3 different languages, on 2 self-built web platforms, and promoting the whole damn thing around the world -- all in less than 12 months!

We've been told for years that the plan was impossible. 7 months into our development process, we have volunteer teams in 4 countries, 2 web sites built &
column12:
waiting, and we're poised to jump on a plane and bring back the stories of people who still make music about more than just guns and girls.  We have 30 days to raise these final $$, and 100 days to finish the mission.

We know this is a heavy lift, and we know we've taken a serious risk.  But our team is far from the usual suspects - we hail from the streets of Brooklyn
column18:
and Kingston, Jamaica.  We've made our careers doing ""the impossible"" again, and again, and again.  If we could do that, we have no doubt that, with your help, we can do this.

The DNA of Take Back the Mic

amp.it and Take Back the Mic Founding CEO, Derrick N Ashong, otherwise known as DNA, is a Hip Hop MC and musician who was born in a house with no running water in Accra, Ghana. When he first learned to speak, he'd shout: “A twa la la,” which means, “Play a song.” When his family fled a military coup and moved to Brooklyn and then the Middle East, it was Ice Cube, De La Soul and Eric B &
column19:
Rakim that helped him transcend everything from street thugs to political dictators. Hip Hop has always been a part of his DNA.

He made it to the Ivory Tower of Harvard, where he met some of the people who would form the Hip Hop and reggae band, Soulfège, that he plays with to this day.  He's acted in a Spielberg film, hosted an Emmy-nominated TV show, been a
column20: _r=0"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">YouTube Sensation, won a Billboard contest for best Hip Hop song, rocked his own radio show for Oprah, and been seen by some as a Master Communicator.
column22: >For the last 10 years, D has had a dream to create an international competition that amplifies the voices of the best and brightest artists in global Hip Hop, and helps bring authenticity and artistry back to the art form.  As his wife, I know him better than anyone and I can tell you, he is the truth.
column23: >If you want to be a part of creating a first-of-its-kind music competition that shows the Fuel, the Fashion, the Struggle and the Passion that it takes to go from local legend to global name, we need you. Join us on this quest to amplify the voices of a new generation.

column1: <b style=""font-size: 16px

This project is all about amplifying a new generation of authentic voices around the world.  You can also amplify those voices by talking loudly about us in public places, singing about us to strangers on the bus, standing on your desk, spitting HOT FIYAH about us at your job, or...you could use the INDIEGOGO share tools to spread the word about our campaign to friends &
column2:
fam!

column1: Take Back the Mic is the World Cup of Hip-Hop. It’s a reality competition that puts fans in the driver’s seat to discover and promote the most soulful hip-hop artists from around the globe. TBTM fans will use the amp.it platform we've built to vote for their favorite acts — and to win their own fan competition. More than just a show, it’s a movement to amplify  the voices of a new generation.
From the Financial Times:

...the real lesson of hip hop is what it can teach us about the value of human capital. Many of the great hip hop entrepreneurs were kids who had been given the worst of everything: housing, schools and expectations. When they became successful, we were surprised...The untapped treasure is what it always was. It is that smart kid you never saw coming."" - Prof. Dan Charnas, NYU

column1: ","Short Summary

Hi, we are Indie Rehab Records and between the four of us on the team we have over 20 years worth of experience on stage performing and behind the scenes recording others and now we want to take that to the next level.

The current business model in the record industry is years behind where it should be and we want to move things on by inviting people in to come up with new ideas and give credit where it is due by having an open office policy and arranging weekly open discussions with ordinary people with extraordinary ideas.

With your help we look to not only provide jobs and free training/experience in the local area to begin with but a new type of service for artists that are fed up of the current record industry standard. The money raised will go something like this
Where Will The Money Go?
The money raised will go something like this:
£10,000 on studio equipment
£3,000 on permanent residence and soundproofing
£4,000 to complete perk commitments (if the full target is reached)
£3,000 booking venues and arranging travel nationwide for artists to play
£5,000 for promotion and stalls at small festivals and on the radio/newspapers
Anything extra would go towards equipment for the radio show to do outside interviews and live recordings as well.
What We Need & What You Get

Most of the perks we have on offer are a discounted service that we will either invite you down to the studio in Manchester to complete or will send out to you with only a few options to show some love for nothing.

And, any and all the funds raised will be going towards new equipment, booking bigger venues and if you hit the intern perk then we will be taking more people along for the ride with us and we can spend more time training and we aim to keep everyone up to date with anything that is happening.
We also have a unique position of putting out a weekly radio show as well (The Indie Rehab Hour), offering air time and promotions through alternative methods as well.
T- Shirt Rough Designs
Made in red, black or white. In any size, anywhere in the world or choose one from our shop and put the size and colour in the order details http://1021473.spreadshirt.co.uk/
Risks & Challenges
We want to take our recordings from this:
to the next level and without your help it may take a lot longer to do.
Other Ways You Can Help

But even if you cant contribute financially then just having your support by sharing our visions on social media and by word of mouth is also helping in a big way and lets us get out information quicker to more people. If there is anything you want to ask, even if it is just the time or directions or mabey a perk idea of your own then let us know at indierehabrecords@gmail.com",5.0,1,"2 Campaigns
|","Manchester, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/indie-rehab-records-a-big-dream-for-four-people/pica

column1:
THE PROJECT

Hello everybody! My name is Daniel C. Wagner, Daniel C for short. I am a full time traveling musician and world nomad. I have fully dedicated my life to creating and sharing magical, beautiful, rhythmic music that is authentic to my way of life.

I have been playing the guitar and singing for 14 years now. During the last 6 years I have been traveling, performing in the streets for my daily bread, leading epic jams and sharing healing songs by fireside &
column5: >, as well as playing small gigs here and there. Now, I am ready to share my songs and my spirit with a wider audience, and I need your support to make it happen!

column1:
I have just finished laying down all the foundation tracks of my first full-length solo album, Changing of the Seasons. It's an intricate piece of music that moves through the feelings of the seasons as they transition, representing the journey of the heart as seasons of love, joy, and pain come and go. 

Changing of the Seasons is based on my guitar work and lyrics, and also features amazing contributions from friends playing a variety of instruments including bass, djembe, conga, handpan, shakuhachi flute, violin, and cello. There are 13 tracks, one for each of the 13 moons within the four seasons of a year, just one of many subtle patterns to be discovered in this album!

I have been writing, dreaming, and crafting these songs for several years now, and they are finally ripe and ready! Every part of every song has a history and a story behind it, and represents a chapter of my life. I am SO excited and proud to release Changing of the Seasons to the world as soon as I possibly can!
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

During the last 6 weeks, I have just put all of my available resources into recording all of the foundation tracks of Changing of the Seasons, plus much of the vocals, and most of the instrumental textures and solos. The record is already starting to sound fantastic, but I want to make sure that I can create and release the very best version of this album possible! I need your help to finish strong!
column9:
/>

^ In the studio at Flying Whale Recording, Grass Valley, CA

I still have to lay down final vocals and harmonies, and flesh out the songs with more guitar, percussion, and instrumental textures and solos, then make a beautiful, in-depth stereo mix from all of those tracks. Next, a solid mastering session is needed, to get everything sounding balanced, deep, and clear.
column12: >Finally, I need to order enough professionally printed CD's to fulfill all the orders from this campaign, as well as have enough to sell, give, and trade as I play the streets and stages. That will keep me, and everybody who gets the album, moving and grooving forward!

column4: >Yes! In that case, the priorities will look like this:

column1:
— Pay my generous guest musician friends for their contributions.

— Make a beautiful official music video for one or more of the songs.

— Fund a tour vehicle to take this music on the road.

WHAT IF WE DON'T HIT THE GOAL?

If the project is not completely funded, here's the strategy and priorities:

— Record the most essential pieces that remain, without getting too fancy.

— Do as much of the remaining mixing and editing as I can on my own computer on my own time, and then have a final mix and master done by a professional. 

— Order only 100 CD's, the minimum to fulfill the orders from this project, and do distribution and registration later.

— Play my heart out in the streets for the $$ I need to keep traveling and sharing!
column7:
>WHAT'S NEXT?

The very best way you can support this project is to share, share, share! Put out the word via Facebook, email, and tell your friends and family!  I will be starting an email list to keep everyone updated who wants to keep receiving news, videos, tour schedules, and music after this project is complete, so stay in touch!

Here are some key links to check out what I am up to, and stay in the loop as this project unfolds:

http://danielcmuse.com/wordpress/ - My brand new blog and creative portfolio--still under construction. Look here for updates, videos, music, etc!

http://danielC.bandcamp.com - The home of the humble musical offerings I have made so far!

http://soundcloud.com/danielcmuse - Tasty bites of sound from the last few years. Stay tuned for clips and teasers from the album!

http://facebook.com/danielcmuse - The official Daniel C Music facebook page. ""Like"" to receive regular updates. 

I want to make sure that everybody that wants to dance and heal to this music gets a chance to do so! If you aren't able to contribute financially to the project, but you want to get the music when it comes out, make sure to send me a message. Add your contribution by sharing and putting the word out, and I will send you a download code when the album is done. No one should be turned away for lack of funds!

I am so excited to see what unfolds as these Seasons change and unfold, and I look forward to staying in touch with you and continuing to share the journey of life, music and community.

column1:
Thank you so much for your love and support!

  - Daniel C

Wildflowers burst from the dirt.
column5:
>Six streams merge into one river.
Bare feet skip down a serpentine mountain trail.
Falling leaves, yellow and red, dance in the wind. 
The raven  calls, dives, and flips in a cloudy sky.
November's wind whispers about January's snowdrifts.
Sevens, elevens, fives, fours &
column6:
sixes dance in rhythm.
A lonely figure huddles by a fire in the blizzard.
The struggle ends in flight.
Hearts find home after the darkness of separation.
column8:
> The hawk soars down the canyon into the sunset. 

Forever flying free.

column1: ","**************************IMPORTANT NOTE*****************************Be sure to select one of the PERKS listed to the right in exchange for your contribution! I want it to be clear that I am offering the album and other awesome rewards in return for your support, not just asking for donations. LOVE AND GRATITUDE!**************************************************************************""…fear not the changing of the seasons, oh my soul leaves only fall so that the grass of spring can grow breathe now, surrender and trust time to find your heart whole love only tears your cocoon so that your wings can unfold…""                      -- lyrics from track 7, ""Leaves Only Fall""

THE PROJECTHello everybody! My name is Daniel C. Wagner, Daniel C for short. I am a full time traveling musician and world nomad. I have fully dedicated my life to creating and sharing magical, beautiful, rhythmic music that is authentic to my way of life.I have been playing the guitar and singing for 14 years now. During the last 6 years I have been traveling, performing in the streets for my daily bread, leading epic jams and sharing healing songs by fireside & moonlight, as well as playing small gigs here and there. Now, I am ready to share my songs and my spirit with a wider audience, and I need your support to make it happen!

I have just finished laying down all the foundation tracks of my first full-length solo album, Changing of the Seasons. It's an intricate piece of music that moves through the feelings of the seasons as they transition, representing the journey of the heart as seasons of love, joy, and pain come and go. Changing of the Seasons is based on my guitar work and lyrics, and also features amazing contributions from friends playing a variety of instruments including bass, djembe, conga, handpan, shakuhachi flute, violin, and cello. There are 13 tracks, one for each of the 13 moons within the four seasons of a year, just one of many subtle patterns to be discovered in this album!I have been writing, dreaming, and crafting these songs for several years now, and they are finally ripe and ready! Every part of every song has a history and a story behind it, and represents a chapter of my life. I am SO excited and proud to release Changing of the Seasons to the world as soon as I possibly can!
THE PROGRESS

During the last 6 weeks, I have just put all of my available resources into recording all of the foundation tracks of Changing of the Seasons, plus much of the vocals, and most of the instrumental textures and solos. The record is already starting to sound fantastic, but I want to make sure that I can create and release the very best version of this album possible! I need your help to finish strong!^ In the studio at Flying Whale Recording, Grass Valley, CAI still have to lay down final vocals and harmonies, and flesh out the songs with more guitar, percussion, and instrumental textures and solos, then make a beautiful, in-depth stereo mix from all of those tracks. Next, a solid mastering session is needed, to get everything sounding balanced, deep, and clear. Finally, I need to order enough professionally printed CD's to fulfill all the orders from this campaign, as well as have enough to sell, give, and trade as I play the streets and stages. That will keep me, and everybody who gets the album, moving and grooving forward!

My name Chris Barrow but I am best known as Chris Casinooo. I am a producer,  writer, and  musician from West Philadelphia, PA.

I've been making music since I was a kid. At the age of 7, I started rapping with my older brother. Back in 2001, due to my brother being unable to make beats for me because of his various projects, I started making beats of my own. After a while, the desire to rap was diminishing while my love for beat-making and producing flourished. In 2007, I started to learn how to play the guitar. I was a roadie and graphic designer for a local band, Joe Jordan's eXperiment. Since there was always a guitar around, I taught myself how to play. I host a series of  online radio shows called BaccYard Recordz Radio or #BYRR where I play local music and beats... And now... Here we are!!

Initially, I was selling beat packages at discounted rates so I can attend Full Sail in a few months. Due to lack of backers, I haven't been able to successfully meet my goal of $7,000 so I am just raising $2,000 for a  portable studio

Lock The Door

For three years, Burke Zack's highly anticipated fourth album, Lock the Door, has been in production. Through many late nights and a lot of seeking God's will for this project, all of the tracks have been produced and album art created.
This album features Judah Akers, Phil King, Kendall Young, Alyssa Schwartz, and Lyle Phillips.
Now, we're at the last step - and that's where you come in. We're asking for your help to raise the money necessary to master this album and print the CD's and cases.

""I can't wait to hear the testimonies of what God does with this album. I've put a lot of my heart into it, and I know it's the best work I've done so far in my music career. But more important than any of that - God gets all the glory for this. He gave me the passion, He gave me the music, and I know He's gonna see it through.""

- Burke Zack

The Need

column5: >The process of mastering an album is the last step in music production. In order for a project to be available to the public, it must first be mastered and perfected. Also, we're preparing for sales of albums at various shows and worship meetings - meaning we need a product to hand to listeners.

column3: >onations of $150 or more will get you a meet 'n' greet pass with Burke Zack at his exclusive upcoming album release event in Nashville, TN!

column5: >Throughout his career, Burke Zack has challenged the norm of Christian hip-hop music. Offered multiple opportunities to sign with a label, he refused each time because his true passion is to preach the gospel when he performs, something often lost in modern Christian music performance. Instead, Burke chose to produce all of his own music, allowing him the freedom to boldly share his own testimony and encourage listeners to real, life-altering repentance and a new life with Jesus.

column1: His first four projects have been a conduit for incredible miracles and salvations, and we receive constant inquiries about when the next album drops. Our hope is that this project's floor starts at the ceiling of the first three - we are ready to see God continue to change the world, one life at a time, through this music.

I Can't Donate, But I Want To Help!

We understand that some of you may not be able to financially contribute to this campaign. That's 100% okay! If you believe in this music, in this ministry, we could really use your help by sharing this campaign across your social media. And if you have a testimony of how God has used Burke's music and/or ministry to impact your life, make sure you spread the word!
""Many are the plans in the mind of a man, but it is the purpose of the Lord that will stand.""
- Proverbs 19:21

","Lock The Door For three years, Burke Zack's highly anticipated fourth album, Lock the Door, has been in production. Through many late nights and a lot of seeking God's will for this project, all of the tracks have been produced and album art created.
This album features Judah Akers, Phil King, Kendall Young, Alyssa Schwartz, and Lyle Phillips.
Now, we're at the last step - and that's where you come in. We're asking for your help to raise the money necessary to master this album and print the CD's and cases.

I can't wait to hear the testimonies of what God does with this album. I've put a lot of my heart into it, and I know it's the best work I've done so far in my music career. But more important than any of that - God gets all the glory for this. He gave me the passion, He gave me the music, and I know He's gonna see it through.""
- Burke Zack   The Need

The process of mastering an album is the last step in music production. In order for a project to be available to the public, it must first be mastered and perfected. Also, we're preparing for sales of albums at various shows and worship meetings - meaning we need a product to hand to listeners.
Our goal of $3,000 includes:
$1,300 - Mastering
$1,500 - CD Production (covers + cases)
$150 - Indiegogo fees
$50 - Campaign marketing costs

We have a few perks to offer, too! For assisting us in this campaign with at least a $30 donation, you'll receive a signed copy of Lock the Door. Contributions of $75 or more will receive signed copies of all four Burke Zack projects. And donations of $150 or more will get you a meet 'n' greet pass with Burke Zack at his exclusive upcoming album release event in Nashville, TN!
The Mission

Throughout his career, Burke Zack has challenged the norm of Christian hip-hop music. Offered multiple opportunities to sign with a label, he refused each time because his true passion is to preach the gospel when he performs, something often lost in modern Christian music performance. Instead, Burke chose to produce all of his own music, allowing him the freedom to boldly share his own testimony and encourage listeners to real, life-altering repentance and a new life with Jesus.

His first four projects have been a conduit for incredible miracles and salvations, and we receive constant inquiries about when the next album drops. Our hope is that this project's floor starts at the ceiling of the first three - we are ready to see God continue to change the world, one life at a time, through this music.

I Can't Donate, But I Want To Help! We understand that some of you may not be able to financially contribute to this campaign. That's 100% okay! If you believe in this music, in this ministry, we could really use your help by sharing this campaign across your social media. And if you have a testimony of how God has used Burke's music and/or ministry to impact your life, make sure you spread the word!
Many are the plans in the mind of a man, but it is the purpose of the Lord that will stand.""
- Proverbs 19:21",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: I'm a former United States Navy Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technician and an Operation Enduring/Iraqi Freedom Veteran. I am also an avid supporter of Wounded Wear, Wounded EOD Warrior and Navy SEAL Foundation. I had the distinct honor and pleasure to sing the National Anthem for over 10,000 people at the 75th Annual Sturgis Rally for the Buffalo Chip's Freedom Day.

My second effort is to be released in June 2016 and features the first single ""My Hometown"" co-written with Mitch Malloy. Produced and Recorded by Andy Andersson (Fuel) at the legendary Sound Kitchen Studio in Nashville, TN. with a plethora of prominent musicians playing on the tracks such as Peter Keys (Lynyrd Skynyrd) on Piano/Organ, ""Cowboy"" Eddie Long (Hank Jr. &
column2: Jamey Johnson) on Pedal Steel, Jason Kott (Steel Woods &amp
column3: Keith Anderson) on Bass and Shannon Boone (Fuel) on Drums. The album has my most mature and personal songs to date.

column1: This campaign is to help finish and provide funding for the marketing, manufacturing and promotion of the album. With your help, myself and an amazing team of professionals can get this album to the national reach and the eyes, ears and hands it needs to get to including YOURS!
I'm asking for and need $25,000.00 to do the following:
<ul>
• Finish the recording and master and manufacture the physical product CD/Vinyl
• Radio promotion and distribution of singles including support for Radio tour.

• National marketing and advertising including materials such as posters and social media and website promo and development.
  • Video production for the single and EPK
If the campaign does not reach its final goal any/all available funds will be used to achieve the stated goals.

This album deserves to be heard by you and the rest of the world! The songs are the best I've written and I really believe in myself, these songs and my team that helped create and are working with me. My first effort which was fully funded by myself did extremely well with the funds I had at my disposal. I want to make this album bigger and better! You guys are the key to making this successful, as with any artist we rely on our support group...Our family, friends and DEFINITELY our FANS! I know I can count on you guys and I truly wanted to make this album for you to see a personal side of me so you can get to know me better through my music.
The music industry is a very hard road and it doesn't come easy. There are gonna be many hurdles, roadblocks, people saying NO, and stalemates. With hard work and dedication and having a lot of great people on my team we can get this album to the next level!
I know money is tight for all of us...ANY help is appreciated. Please share, tell your friends, use the Indiegogo share tools, make some noise about me and my music!
Thanks so much to each and everyone of you. You're truly the best!
","Hey y'all!

My name is Brian Grilli and I'm an independent recording artist.  As some of you know, my debut effort “Damn Good Day” got the national and independent music world to take notice. The title track and first single climbed fast on the charts reaching #1 on Indieworld and New Music Weekly. I was invited to play Muriel Anderson’s All Star Guitar Night at Summer NAMM ’14 w/ Brent Mason, Anders Osborne, John Corabi among others. I also appeared in September 2014 issue of Guitar Player Magazine.
I've shared stages with country stars Brantley Gilbert, Florida Georgia Line, Eli Young Band, Thomas Rhett, Jana Kramer, Sarah Darling as well as rockers Cheap Trick, Styx, .38 Special and Lucero.

I'm a former United States Navy Explosive Ordnance Disposal Technician and an Operation Enduring/Iraqi Freedom Veteran. I am also an avid supporter of Wounded Wear, Wounded EOD Warrior and Navy SEAL Foundation. I had the distinct honor and pleasure to sing the National Anthem for over 10,000 people at the 75th Annual Sturgis Rally for the Buffalo Chip's Freedom Day.

My second effort is to be released in June 2016 and features the first single ""My Hometown"" co-written with Mitch Malloy. Produced and Recorded by Andy Andersson (Fuel) at the legendary Sound Kitchen Studio in Nashville, TN. with a plethora of prominent musicians playing on the tracks such as Peter Keys (Lynyrd Skynyrd) on Piano/Organ, ""Cowboy"" Eddie Long (Hank Jr. & Jamey Johnson) on Pedal Steel, Jason Kott (Steel Woods & Keith Anderson) on Bass and Shannon Boone (Fuel) on Drums. The album has my most mature and personal songs to date.

This campaign is to help finish and provide funding for the marketing, manufacturing and promotion of the album. With your help, myself and an amazing team of professionals can get this album to the national reach and the eyes, ears and hands it needs to get to including YOURS!
I'm asking for and need $25,000.00 to do the following:
Finish the recording and master and manufacture the physical product CD/Vinyl
Radio promotion and distribution of singles including support for Radio tour.
National marketing and advertising including materials such as posters and social media and website promo and development. Video production for the single and EPK
If the campaign does not reach its final goal any/all available funds will be used to achieve the stated goals.

This album deserves to be heard by you and the rest of the world! The songs are the best I've written and I really believe in myself, these songs and my team that helped create and are working with me. column4:
>Please help us TOUR!

Hey, Kaz Hawkins here. We are raising money to enable us to buy a tour bus. Costs on a tour are high and extreme on the road for any band and while we know that this is a given for any working musician we would love your help to fund a new bus for our 2016 tour.

Having our own home on the road would reduce costs for venues hiring us, which would in turn enable us to perform at more gigs. In most cases venues do not provide accommodation so we either pay ourselves for local hotels, guest houses etc, or we would be put up in people's homes which means the band has to split up and this causes extra stress on the road. 

In a perfect world with a proper touring bus, we would all be together, writing the next 10 albums on the road :) We would also be able to hire a driver which means I wouldn't be exhausted whilst performing after driving for 8 to 24 hours, sometimes to the point of collapsing. It takes that to get anywhere from Northern Ireland. We want to give you the best show possible and boy do we put on a show! Currently we have a converted mini bus (G-Bus) that is barely hanging together and will not make it through another tour sadly and as much as the G-Bus has been our home for the last two years we have run it into the ground with so many boats, roads and pot holes and it really wasn't built for the overload of the Kaz Hawkins Band.

Although we have had many invitations and offers to play in Europe, we have unfortunately had to decline them all, as the high costs of travel from Northern Ireland mean that so far we've only been able to afford to gig in the UK. By helping us eliminate accommodation costs, you can positively and directly help us spread the word into Europe and entertain those wonderful fans there that have supported us so magnificently on our journey so far.

We do not have a record label, we are totally independent and self-funded!

We have been collecting awards since 2012 with the biggest ones recently from British Blues Awards gaining the Barry Middleton Memorial Award for Emerging Artist. We also won best Studio Album of 2015 for our debut 'Get Ready' from Blues Matters Magazine and Best Female Act in Ireland at Pure M Magazine Music Awards 2015. Another recent award is the Blues &
column5:
Soul Magazine 2014 Rising Star Award. 

Many other nominations over the past 3 years include
column11: >FINALIST-FUTURE OF THE BLUES UK 2015
column15: >NOMINEE-European Blues Challenge, Classic Rock Blues Magazine 2014
column29: >NOMINEE: BRITISH BLUES AWARD  BEST ORIGINAL SONGWRITER 2013
column33: >WINNER: MRU Awards BEST BLUES/ROCK ACT 2012
column37: >NOMINEE: MRU Awards BEST SINGLE 2012
column41:
>

WHY SHOULD YOU HELP US?

We value you all so much and we hope this will help us get to YOUR city, YOUR town or YOUR country. With our own tour bus the world is open for discovery and we could literally roll up and bring our show to you, who have been waiting so long to see us. In our PERKS for this campaign we will be adding every name from donations on our next release, which for now is a big secret but you will find out before anyone else when the next release is due via this campaign. Your name will appear in print on the sleeve and possibly on a dedicated track as a thank you for helping us spread our music further. We will also be creating a special fan monument on the bus with all your names so that you are with us wherever we go.

WHY SO MUCH MONEY?

At present we have six band members, three male, three female, which means six bunks in a touring van. A typical new and fitted out transit bus or van new can easily cost £100,000, but we have our feet firmly planted on the ground and know that a more modest second hand touring conversion, albeit one that's already had a few adventures, would be within our reach with your help. We have chosen Indiegogo's flexible funding option so that we can receive your donations whether we meet our £20,000 target or not. If we do not reach our target we will continue fundraising outside Indiegogo until we reach the amount we need. What's great about this campaign, is that it gives us the amazing opportunity for you to continue donating even after the campaign deadline ends.

SPONSORSHIP

A lot of bands depend on endorsements and sponsorships to tour. We don't have this but if YOU are a business and would like to sponsor or endorse us we are prepared to carry signage on the road. If you want to see your business travel with us please email our PR Officer at franbarlet@hotmail.com 

SOCIAL MEDIA

THE BAND

Kaz Hawkins- Sings, writes songs, plays guitar, a little bit of drums, harmonica, piano and spoons. Mental health campaigner &
column2:
all round crazy horse.

Nick McConkey- Lead Guitarist, Nick named Dr Nick  as there's no subject he doesn't know something about.

Michael McKinney- Bassist, poetry lover, listener, also too tall for our current bus as he keeps getting his head caught on the roof.

Pet'o Uhrin - Drummer, backing vocalist, joker and all round groove shaker.

Deanne Jones- Backing singer &
column3:
Polkadot Girl, plays with numbers during the day, can harmonize to anything.

Tess Mcilwaine- Backing singer &
column4:
Polkadot Girl, spreadsheets and lipstick are her things in life.

MANAGEMENT–robmontmusic@gmail.com 07504016222

We also have amazing people who have created fan clubs especially for you. Please join and keep up to date with us on social media but don't forget I will be updating you regularly on this campaign with special video messages and tit bits from all of us in the band.

Thank you for contributing to our campaign. We cannot wait to get performing for you. Remember to share this campaign with your friends we would really appreciate the love. We cannot do this without your help.

Kaz, Nick, Pet'o, Michael, Deanne, Tess

","Please help us TOUR!Hey, Kaz Hawkins here. We are raising money to enable us to buy a tour bus. Costs on a tour are high and extreme on the road for any band and while we know that this is a given for any working musician we would love your help to fund a new bus for our 2016 tour.Having our own home on the road would reduce costs for venues hiring us, which would in turn enable us to perform at more gigs. In most cases venues do not provide accommodation so we either pay ourselves for local hotels, guest houses etc, or we would be put up in people's homes which means the band has to split up and this causes extra stress on the road. In a perfect world with a proper touring bus, we would all be together, writing the next 10 albums on the road :) We would also be able to hire a driver which means I wouldn't be exhausted whilst performing after driving for 8 to 24 hours, sometimes to the point of collapsing. It takes that to get anywhere from Northern Ireland. We want to give you the best show possible and boy do we put on a show! Currently we have a converted mini bus (G-Bus) that is barely hanging together and will not make it through another tour sadly and as much as the G-Bus has been our home for the last two years we have run it into the ground with so many boats, roads and pot holes and it really wasn't built for the overload of the Kaz Hawkins Band.Although we have had many invitations and offers to play in Europe, we have unfortunately had to decline them all, as the high costs of travel from Northern Ireland mean that so far we've only been able to afford to gig in the UK. The donation
that we will receive from you will dedicated to enhance the scholarship fund
for the benefit of the Edward Said National Conservatory of Music students of its branch in Jerusalem. This will enable
more students from the Jerusalem city to study music, and will enhance and
develop further the current students capacities and skills. With an overall
objective to facilitate the access of underprivileged children to quality music
education and to contribute in activating the musical life in the Jerusalem
city by catering for and sponsoring more music talents from the young
Palestinian generation, the ESNCM, and through this project, specifically aims
at identifying and sponsoring talented young musicians, and enhance further the
music and performing skills of the current students. By consolidating the
scholarship fund, more students from the Governorate will be able to study
music, more public will be affiliated to the branch and support its programs,
and the sustainability and financial resources of the Branch will be also
enhanced, and the music and performing levels of the current students will be
enhanced.
Each year, the sponsorship programme enables
around 450 students to learn music in the Jerusalem branch as well as in the
outreach programme in the Old City of Jerusalem. Providing opportunities for
wider categories of the society to access music education, the sponsorship
programme contributes to filling the existing gap in Palestinian curricula
resulting from the lack of music education activities in the school system.
The scholarship
fund is an opportunity to strengthen the services and presence in the Jerusalem
governorate in order to increase the opportunity for talented students from the
region to pursue music education and training and enhance their skills, and to

activate musical life in the Governorate.

column2: >La formation s'exile en Estrie pour enregistrer un deuxième album et capter le plus fidèlement possible l'énergie ""live"" de BELLFLOWER.

>Afin de mener leur projet d'album à terme le plus rapidement possible et sans avoir recours au service de crédit conventionnel, BELLFLOWER se tourne vers son public en organisant une prévente officielle de l'album en préparation.

column1: À QUOI VA SERVIR L'ARGENT DE LA PRÉVENTE?

column2: >Le groupe utilisera l'argent amassé par la prévente pour payer une partie des frais reliés à la production de l'album. Les principales dépenses sont la location du matériel, les coûts de déplacement et de subsistance des 9 musiciens, l'enregistrement et le mixage, le matriçage, le design, le graphisme et l'impression des albums (cd et vinyle).

>BELLFLOWER est un groupe indépendant et nos albums sont autoproduits. Le groupe assume donc tous les frais reliés à la production de l'album qui sont présentement évalués à 15 000$. Nous avons fixé l'objectif de cette campagne à 5000$, mais comme vous pouvez le constater, toute somme additionnelle sera utile et grandement appréciée.

column1: COMMENT ÇA FONCTIONNE?

C'est comme un magasin en ligne au fond. Vous achetez votre album, votre vinyle, votre passe à vie ou n'importe laquelle de nos offres qui ferait votre bonheur et vous recevrez votre sélection par la poste et/ou par courriel avant le lancement officiel de l'album, en primeur. Pas plus simple que ça.

Tous les gens qui participent à la prévente, quel que soit le montant donné, auront accès gratuitement au spectacle d'avant première qui aura lieu le 3 décembre prochain au très chic Divan Orange à Montréal. BELLFLOWER offrira en primeur un avant-goût du nouvel album à son public et à ses généreux donateurs. PARTY!

column2: >Le montant inscrit pour chaque item est un montant minimum, pas maximum. Si vous donnez plus, ça va servir à quelque part dans la production, inquiétez-vous pas!

column1: BELLFLOWER s'engage à vous faire parvenir tout ce qui vous est dû avant le 1er mars 2016*. Si jamais un problème survient au cours de la prévente ou que vous ne recevez pas votre commande, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter par courriel, nous nous assurerons de rétablir la situation: themusicofbellflower@gmail.com

column2: >*Vue les délais d'impression, il se peut que le vinyle arrive un peu plus tard. Soyez patient, ça en vaudra la peine.

Surveillez notre calendrier et venez nous entendre quand le band passera près de chez vous.

BELLFLOWER
","BELLFLOWER
BIO DU BAND

Fondé par l'auteure, compositrice et interprète Em Pompa, BELLFLOWER est un groupe montréalais indépendant formé de neuf musicien(ne)s et ami(e)s: Em Pompa (voix, percussions, guitare), Kat Samman (voix, percussions), William Côté (batterie, voix, guitare), Jérémi Roy (basse, synthbass), Jérôme Beaulieu (piano, claviers), Félix Petit (sax, samplings), Alex Dodier (sax), Nicolas Boulay (trompette, flugelhorn), Marie-Noëlle Bois (sax, voix).

Depuis 2013, le groupe a lancé un album (The Lotus Factor), fait plusieurs concerts (dont un passage remarqué au Festival Vue sur la Relève 2015 où la formation a remporté 12 prix coups-de-pouce) et présenté une nouvelle pièce enregistrée live au MMR Studio de McGill:
MAINTENANT...
Trois ans après les débuts du projet, le groupe s'apprête à enregistrer son deuxième album et voici comment ça va se passer:
28 novembre au 2 décembre: Pré-prod (répétition et peaufinage des pièces)
3 décembre: Concert ""avant-première"" au Divan Orange (The Season Spell en concert avant l'enregistrement)
6 au 10 décembre: Enregistrement au Studio B-12
Janvier 2016: Mixage et matriçage
Mars 2016: Lancement(s) officiel(s) (Montréal, Québec, Sherbrooke)
La formation s'exile en Estrie pour enregistrer un deuxième album et capter le plus fidèlement possible l'énergie ""live"" de BELLFLOWER.

Afin de mener leur projet d'album à terme le plus rapidement possible et sans avoir recours au service de crédit conventionnel, BELLFLOWER se tourne vers son public en organisant une prévente officielle de l'album en préparation.
À QUOI VA SERVIR L'ARGENT DE LA PRÉVENTE?

Le groupe utilisera l'argent amassé par la prévente pour payer une partie des frais reliés à la production de l'album. Les principales dépenses sont la location du matériel, les coûts de déplacement et de subsistance des 9 musiciens, l'enregistrement et le mixage, le matriçage, le design, le graphisme et l'impression des albums (cd et vinyle).

BELLFLOWER est un groupe indépendant et nos albums sont autoproduits. Le groupe assume donc tous les frais reliés à la production de l'album qui sont présentement évalués à 15 000$. Nous avons fixé l'objectif de cette campagne à 5000$, mais comme vous pouvez le constater, toute somme additionnelle sera utile et grandement appréciée.
COMMENT ÇA FONCTIONNE?

C'est comme un magasin en ligne au fond. Vous achetez votre album, votre vinyle, votre passe à vie ou n'importe laquelle de nos offres qui ferait votre bonheur et vous recevrez votre sélection par la poste et/ou par courriel avant le lancement officiel de l'album, en primeur. Pas plus simple que ça.

Tous les gens qui participent à la prévente, quel que soit le montant donné, auront accès gratuitement au spectacle d'avant première qui aura lieu le 3 décembre prochain au très chic Divan Orange à Montréal. BELLFLOWER offrira en primeur un avant-goût du nouvel album à son public et à ses généreux donateurs. PARTY!
Le montant inscrit pour chaque item est un montant minimum, pas maximum. Si vous donnez plus, ça va servir à quelque part dans la production, inquiétez-vous pas!

BELLFLOWER s'engage à vous faire parvenir tout ce qui vous est dû avant le 1er mars 2016*. Si jamais un problème survient au cours de la prévente ou que vous ne recevez pas votre commande, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter par courriel, nous nous assurerons de rétablir la situation: themusicofbellflower@gmail.com
*Vue les délais d'impression, il se peut que le vinyle arrive un peu plus tard. Soyez patient, ça en vaudra la peine.
D'AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER?
Répandez la nouvelle de la prévente et de la sortie prochaine de notre album autour de vous et invitez les gens à découvrir notre musique.
Suivez-nous sur les réseaux sociaux, ""likez"" notre page Facebook, ""followez"" notre Twitter, etc.
Surveillez notre calendrier et venez nous entendre quand le band passera près de chez vous.
Liens à partager:
Site web: http://www.themusicofbellflower.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BELLFL0WER/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/bellflowermtl
Bandcamp: http://bellflowermusic.bandcamp.com/
Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/bellflowermusic
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/bellflowermusic
MERCI D'ÊTRE LÀ!

History of Fusion

Fusion Kung Fu was founded in 2014 by head instructor Michelle Pleasant. Our history is brief, having only been around for two years, but we are growing every quarter and plan to continue that growth in the future. We have a strong focus on core strength, proper alignment, working hard, and having fun.
The Fusion Philosophy

Training in the martial arts can be an amazing tool for the development of one’s mind, body and spirit, and, the unification of them in order to navigate one’s life in a holistic manner. While the physical components of martial arts is largely studied throughout the world, the deeper rewards of the arts lie in the philosophy and the knowledge one can gain about themselves and their interactions with the world at large.

The Fusion philosophy is one of wholeness. Our mission is to improve the quality of people’s lives through discipline, consciousness and empowerment. We develop awareness through disciplined martial arts training which include a very diverse range of philosophies and physical exercises.

The combination of intense physical training and an in depth introspection of oneself creates a profound self awareness that has the potential to change one’s life in magical ways. Combining the seemingly contrary arts (Kajukenbo Kung Fu, Yoga, Aikido and Tai Chi) creates a unique learning environment in which balance, perseverance, harmony and acceptance are strongly encouraged and nurtured.
Vision for the Future

Our core vision for the immediate future is to continue to offer enriching classes taught by skilled teachers. We also plan to start offering more community classes free of charge in yoga and aikido, and are exploring the idea starting a kid’s program.

Our long term vision is to have a full class schedule with a huge range of movement classes, including: Kung Fu, Yoga, Aikido, Nia, personal training, group fitness classes, free self defense classes, fee-based self defense classes for starters! All with classes will be taught with the shared passion for the healing power of movement and how it can transform lives.
What your generosity will foster:

• Make possible free community classes in self defense and aikido • Help us purchase desperately needed equipment such as mats, heavy bag stands, sparring equipment, kick shields, exercise balls, medicine balls for starters! • Mirrors • Storage cubbies • Weapons for training • Chin up bar • And perhaps most importantly, scholarships for those who cannot afford to train.

We are a diverse group of individuals who come together to train in a mutually respectful environment. We have fun, work hard, push our boundaries and did we say we have fun? Because we do. We love what this art has to offer and can't wait to share it with others!
","History of Fusion

Fusion Kung Fu was founded in 2014 by head instructor Michelle Pleasant. Our history is brief, having only been around for two years, but we are growing every quarter and plan to continue that growth in the future. We have a strong focus on core strength, proper alignment, working hard, and having fun.
The Fusion Philosophy

Training in the martial arts can be an amazing tool for the development of one’s mind, body and spirit, and, the unification of them in order to navigate one’s life in a holistic manner. While the physical components of martial arts is largely studied throughout the world, the deeper rewards of the arts lie in the philosophy and the knowledge one can gain about themselves and their interactions with the world at large.

The Fusion philosophy is one of wholeness. Our mission is to improve the quality of people’s lives through discipline, consciousness and empowerment. We develop awareness through disciplined martial arts training which include a very diverse range of philosophies and physical exercises.

The Backdrop:

20 years, I picked up a guitar and took my first lesson.  Since then, the music has poured through, but never found a home in the recording studio.  That changed this year when instead of acoustic guitar, I switched to classical guitar, just after returning from Turkey.  I added the beautiful and lush Turkish folk guitar, Baglama Saz, to my repertoire of sounds.  Both instruments have added layers of organic spice to my DJ sets, but the pure and raw sounds of the instruments on their own, with a bit of bell-stomping has asked for the first of many studio albums.
What I Need &
column2:
What You Receive

Producing, Mixing, and Mastering album is both a time-consuming and money-investing process.  Each of these stages of the album recording process is assisted by your generous donation.

column1: I will be touring at festivals this summer 2015 in Colorado, Arizona, and the East Coast.  Your support will fund the album's release in time for the tour.

As a professional Life Coach and Astrologer, I wanted to include the special perks of astrology readings into your donations.  You get to learn deeply about life purpose, relationships, career path, forecasting, or your optimum locations, while supporting the realization of this project.
I've also included perks such as my books on astrology and consciousness and some of my original visionary photography.

My longer term vision includes traveling to countries in both South America and Europe and playing these unique songs—more like shamanic journeys—out in city center plazas and maybe on stages with collaborators, especially dancers, hoopers, and fire spinners.  In addition, I plan to continue to layer these organic elements into future live DJ sets.
To check out my previous ambient and electronic dance music albums, visit celestiowl.bandcamp.com, and for DJ sets visit soundcloud.com/verdarluz
Thanks for the support and please share this campaign with your friends on your social networks.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>
<div>
<div>
WE ARE LUMANATION!
<div>
We are LUMANATION, a band that is also a family, playing music that
ignites and inspires. Our foundation is reggae
incorporates ska, funk, and rock grooves. It is fun, irresistibly danceable,
and genuinely positive music
column2: we bring from deep in our hearts and our

column1: souls a powerful message of positivity and unity.
We want to share our music with as wide an audience as possible - and
this means recording! So we are asking for your support: your support of
our efforts to bring this music to the world
musicians, artists, and studios employed in the production of this album
your support of community-based creation. We can’t do it without YOU!
Please, become part of this creation with us, and contribute anything you
can! $5 or $5000 will be received with equal gratitude
We want to share in the giving, of course, so please check out the
premiums we’re offering as thank you’s! There are some great packages to
choose from, from downloads, to cd’s, t-shirts, even house-concerts..... !!THANK YOU!!!!
A Little More About Us:
Based in Marin County, CA, Lumanation is comprised of 7 dedicated,
talented musicians: Bobby Galyan, lead vocals
vocals
Tim McKee, lead guitar
keyboard. We each bring a unique musical background to the group, and
together we have created the original sound that is Lumanation. At our
shows, people respond to our music with joy and enthusiasm. They dance,
they sing, they are entertained, they become a part of the band, part of the
performance. We feed the audience, they feed us, and we generate a kind
of magic that transcends the ordinary. !
We are ready to share the magic of our music with YOU, and with as wide
an audience as we can reach! Producing this album will represent the
culmination of our artistic efforts to date, and we are so excited to realize
this dream! Your financial contribution will mean that we can make this
recording a tangible reality. Your support and your belief in us is as much
appreciated as your money, and even more important in keeping us going!
So thank you, all of you, for trusting and having faith in our vision. Thank
you for adding your light and your love to the Luma-nation.
<div>

We've done the research and spoken with studios and engineers to develop the best quality recording process for the most efficient amount of money. We are also committed to supporting local studios and service providers, so your investment, will really make an impact with the local independent studios and mastering engineers. All recording, mastering, printing and CD duplication will be done in the US.
$5000 Recording Costs
$4200 Mixing
$3500 Mastering
$2500 CD Print run
$3500 merch store
<div>
<div>
<div>
LUMANATION rewards
For the following Donations, we will be providing unique exclusive thank you prizes.
$10 - download of cd!
$15 - download and sticker!
<div>
$25 - physical cd, download, and sticker!
$50 - t-shirt, cd, download, and sticker!
$100 - custom signed poster, t-shirt, cd, download and sticker! (LTD edition poster only 50 printed)
$250 - hand-written autographed lyric sheet, poster, t-shirt, cd, download,!
and sticker!
$500 - name on cd liner, plus all of the above!
$1000 - Skype concert, plus all of the above!
$2500 - 2 hour house concert, within 100 miles of San Rafael, name on cd liner, lyric sheet, poster, cd, download, and sticker!
$5000 - outdoor show, OR ‘surprise basket’, plus name on cd liner, lyric sheet, poster, t-shirt, cd, download, and sticker
The Impact:

Our music is an expression of pure love. We notice that our audiences are having so much fun that they are transported away from the mundane, and lifted into the magic of movement and dance. Young, old, and in between, our music gets everyone up and moving. People smiling and having fun. This is what life is all about. Friends, family, and community making life count. Your donation will support our quest to complete our album, press it, upload it, and share it with the world. The money we spend will go to local studio operators, mixing engineers, and artists. Their communities and families will benefit from the economics of local production. We will be supporting creative community and local business people down the line.
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

We've saved all our gig money this past year to begin the process, and we are still pouring everything we earn into making this happen. So far we've spent over $3200 on recording and have several more sessions to go. We need your help to keep moving forward with booking the studios and lining up the mixing engineers and cover artists.

Once we have a completed CD, we need to send it out to radio stations, and perform in as many venues as we can to spread the word and build a connection to people. In these modern times, it's important that we spread hope and offer people a reminder of all our common human joys. Music is the perfect medium for that. This album of songs contain messages of hope and perseverance. You can help us light up the world with our vibrant message.

We've spent years honing our talent and the songs, tirelessly performed in clubs, festivals, and casinos. Time after time, people who've never heard us before light up and get grooving. It is a powerful thing to experience connecting with people for the first time. Watching as the music moves them and ignites their smiles. This Album represents our calling card to the future.
Your support will make it all possible.! We will be eternally grateful, and continue to broaden our audience in years to come.

Once the CD is done the work is just beginning for us. We will continue to create excitement and awareness of our band. Creating new connections and relationships that will lead to new gigs, and new venues for us to play in.

Other Ways You Can Help:

While even a small donation is going to have an impact, you can help in more ways than one. Share this with your friends, go to our facebook page and leave us notes or questions. We welcome your energy and enthusiasm however it shows up. Write, call, text, instant message.... we want to invite you to be part of the magic.

column5: >At the age of five, I started going to the Nacional School of Music in
column7:
>and from my early memories, specially sensorial, of music apreciation sessions provided by my father, I knew this would be my way of personal expresion and therefore my life's profession.

When I was 20 years old, I started feeling an desperate need of change and growuth. I wanted to travel! I wanted to expand my studies and deepen my creativity in another pace in the world!

From the acquaintanceships with brazilian musicians, new stimulations and inspirations came and flourished, which I identify as ""sensorial expantion"", promoted by contact with brazilian rythms and, specially from listening to great musician masters like Hermeto Pascoal and Naná Vasconcelos.

At the moment, I felt that Brazil was a place I had to experience. That, then, became a vital need for the upgrading of my work.

The first big change: Move to São Paulo!   

The music panorama of the city conducted to the enrichment of my artistic language and brought forth precious partnerships. The feedback from the people who listened and followed my music and work, contributed hugely to firm my wish to stay and stabilish myself here in Brazil, despite the difficulties of not being native.

Now, after being part of a couple of groups and projects, the imminent need is to record my debut solo work “Nômade”, in a CD. It's being co-produced by brazilian producers and musicians Jonas Tatitand will have songs of my own and recalls from the traditional music of my motherland. There will be collaborations with artist both from Brazil and Mozambique, and also from other courtries, making the crossing between the cultures I shelter and want to communicate.

As an idependent artist, I opted for the crowdfunding as the only viable way to materialize this project in the moment, as the help of all of you is of extreme importance in order for me to reach my goal. This work is the result of my personal and artistic research, and is a project I believe in a lot and it is my pleasure to offer you rewards to the review of the outcomes.

Since I live in Brazil, my options for perks to the contributors of this campaign living abroad are very limited. So I decided to focus only on perks that will help make this project come true. So my perks for you are:
Your name in the acknowledgements in the digital and physical form
An antecipated download link to the full album with an exclusive graphic art design for the contributors
CD's that can be mailed to any country around the world
BUDGET

We did the shortest budget possible in order to make this campaign affordable! For that, some of the musicians and partners lowered and gave up their fees to make sure this project happens, but, besides some logistic costs that are being out used of our own pockets, we would like to pay the artists the minimum they deserve for their art! Therefore we decided to set the highest value as the final goal.

“Experience builds character, says singer-songwriter Clark Paterson.” You have to do shit to truly write great songs.”
From the family farm to the Chicago School of Folk Music
column2: from the high-dollar world of Windy City real estate to seeing the world from a backpack
column3: and from a string of dingy honky tonks to a home, finally, in Nashville, Tennessee, Clark brings worlds of experience to his 35 years on the planet––and to his third and latest record, The Final Tradition.

column1: “I’ve been around/ Tonight, I’m back in town/ Straight-up and battle-hard/ I’m parked in the neighbor’s yard”––“If I Don’t Win”

Recorded in Nashville by indie producer par excellence Eric McConnell (Todd Snider, Loretta Lynn, Will Kimbrough), The Final Tradition is no sunny travelogue. Clark’s songs have real narrative force and reflect the darkness and raw energy typically found in vintage country and punk––call it Grindhouse Country.
“I swore I’d never take the fall/ You haven’t seen the things I saw/ Boxed my heart outta my skull/ I entertained them one and all…”––“This Dog Is Gonna Hunt”

Assisting Clark and Eric are some of the Nashville indie scene’s grittiest players, including steel guitarist Paul Niehaus (Lambchop, Calexico), drummer John McTigue (Raul Malo, Brazilbilly), and Tim Carroll (Elizabeth Cook, Todd Snider). An experienced bunch, they know how to scream out of the gate, such as on “Kansas Saturday Night,” a scorched earth rave-up that would recall The Slits or Social Distortion but for McConnell’s atmospheric production. Songs like “My Hands Know The Touch,” a Crazy Horse-ish waltz, on the other hand, demonstrate that Clark’s friends can punch hard while deftly staying out of the way.

“I got friends down the mines/ I got friends that work construction/ I got girls I think are fine wearing shirts that I unbutton/ I got friends out in Iraq who will always have my back/ I got everything I need/ I got blood enough to bleed”––“Hillbilly Shit”

Clark was raised on his family’s spread near Sandusky, Michigan. “I never once was drunk in high school,” he says. It took Loyola University in Chicago to make that happen. After graduation, Clark took off for a few years with only a backpack and his guitar. “I became a backpacker-dude and had a good run. I’ve played country music in Eastern Europe, South America, Japan, Sweden, Finland and England. I've also been robbed, beaten, and deported.

“Daddy’s favorite farmhand taught me about life/ Taught me about women/ And how to use a knife/ Taught me about sadness/ How to see it in the eyes/ The world is hard for living/ Makes us sacrifice”––“Moonlight In The Hills”
“In the road or in the ditch/ Poor as Hell or filthy rich/ Blow-out win or flat-out skunked/ This dog is gonna hunt”––“This Dog Is Gonna Hunt”

Ultimately, The Final Tradition resists categorization. Clark, himself, resists categorization, too, although he’s happy to share his experiences. “I think the record has a sense of story and purpose that most current records don't,” he says. “I play guitar and focus on writing music that appeals to me and is not being done on the radio. I love old country because it’s earnest and has an edge and there is a narrative that is largely missing from modern music. I love the darkness and the fact that it’s polarizing. And I love 70s punk rock like Iggy and The Stooges, The Ramones, and The Clash. It has balls and a message and always felt honest. I also really really love Nick Cave….”
“If your parents like your music, you’re doing something wrong.”––Clark Paterson

I need your help to get the music out there. I'm asking for a total of $10,000.00 to fund the pressing of the records, expanding the website, printing cd's, making t-shirts, and marketing the album so it may reach it's full potential.I love this album and I know you will too.
If you like the music, please share it with your friends. Heck, direct them to this page where they can get their own copy of the new album.
","“Experience builds character, says singer-songwriter Clark Paterson.” You have to do shit to truly write great songs.”
From the family farm to the Chicago School of Folk Music
column2: from the high-dollar world of Windy City real estate to seeing the world from a backpack
column3: and from a string of dingy honky tonks to a home, finally, in Nashville, Tennessee, Clark brings worlds of experience to his 35 years on the planet––and to his third and latest record, The Final Tradition.

column1: “I’ve been around/ Tonight, I’m back in town/ Straight-up and battle-hard/ I’m parked in the neighbor’s yard”––“If I Don’t Win”

Recorded in Nashville by indie producer par excellence Eric McConnell (Todd Snider, Loretta Lynn, Will Kimbrough), The Final Tradition is no sunny travelogue. Clark’s songs have real narrative force and reflect the darkness and raw energy typically found in vintage country and punk––call it Grindhouse Country.
“I swore I’d never take the fall/ You haven’t seen the things I saw/ Boxed my heart outta my skull/ I entertained them one and all…”––“This Dog Is Gonna Hunt”

Assisting Clark and Eric are some of the Nashville indie scene’s grittiest players, including steel guitarist Paul Niehaus (Lambchop, Calexico), drummer John McTigue (Raul Malo, Brazilbilly), and Tim Carroll (Elizabeth Cook, Todd Snider). An experienced bunch, they know how to scream out of the gate, such as on “Kansas Saturday Night,” a scorched earth rave-up that would recall The Slits or Social Distortion but for McConnell’s atmospheric production. Songs like “My Hands Know The Touch,” a Crazy Horse-ish waltz, on the other hand, demonstrate that Clark’s friends can punch hard while deftly staying out of the way.

“I got friends down the mines/ I got friends that work construction/ I got girls I think are fine wearing shirts that I unbutton/ I got friends out in Iraq who will always have my back/ I got everything I need/ I got blood enough to bleed”––“Hillbilly Shit”

Clark was raised on his family’s spread near Sandusky, Michigan. “I never once was drunk in high school,” he says. It took Loyola University in Chicago to make that happen. After graduation, Clark took off for a few years with only a backpack and his guitar. “I became a backpacker-dude and had a good run. I’ve played country music in Eastern Europe, South America, Japan, Sweden, Finland and England. I've also been robbed, beaten, and deported.

“Daddy’s favorite farmhand taught me about life/ Taught me about women/ And how to use a knife/ Taught me about sadness/ How to see it in the eyes/ The world is hard for living/ Makes us sacrifice”––“Moonlight In The Hills”
“In the road or in the ditch/ Poor as Hell or filthy rich/ Blow-out win or flat-out skunked/ This dog is gonna hunt”––“This Dog Is Gonna Hunt”

Ultimately, The Final Tradition resists categorization. Clark, himself, resists categorization, too, although he’s happy to share his experiences. “I think the record has a sense of story and purpose that most current records don't,” he says. “I play guitar and focus on writing music that appeals to me and is not being done on the radio. I love old country because it’s earnest and has an edge and there is a narrative that is largely missing from modern music. I love the darkness and the fact that it’s polarizing. And I love 70s punk rock like Iggy and The Stooges, The Ramones, and The Clash. It has balls and a message and always felt honest. I also really really love Nick Cave….”
“If your parents like your music, you’re doing something wrong.”––Clark Paterson

Short Summary

We are a small, yet loving spiritual community. Our lovely little Church is in need of various repairs and upgrades so that we can grow and continue to offer spiritual nourishment to the Community. Blessings of any amount, no matter how small, will be welcomed!

Our Request

We recently painted the exterior and some of the interior of our building, put in new lights, a more accessible path to the entrance, and a generous member has given us more comfortably cushioned pews. We as a spiritual community wish to grow in members, love, and spiritual outreach. So we are asking for financial assistance of any amount toward:
<div><ul>
• New ceiling tiles
• Carpet replacement
• More interior painting
• A safe and secure space for youth to gather
• Improvements to the parking lot and grounds.

The Impact

Unity Church on the Mountain has so much to offer! Our building is aging, however. We feel that these improvements are necessary for us to continue providing and better serve our Community's spiritual needs.
What You Will Receive

In addition to our gratitude and the blessings of giving, we will add you to our prayers and send those prayers on to Silent Unity for 30 days of continuous prayer. Since we are a non-profit, you may also take a tax deduction for your gift.
If We Don't Raise Our Goal
If we don't meet our goal here, we have faith that God will provide in time. All funds received through Indiegogo will be deposited into the Church's building fund.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, perhaps you or someone you know can donate their time and energy to us.
If you are just learning about us and are in the Huntsville, Alabama Metropolitan area, we would love for you to visit! Our Sunday service is at 11:00 a.m. CST.

About this recording

Roots represent beginnings. They facilitate growth. They expand to support and nurture. Our diverse roots converge on this CD, bringing together the music of Hungarian, Latin American and North American composers. This recording offers a delectable variety of music from the W.F. Bach Duo Sonata that became the root of our friendship to the folk music that we heard growing up and to our more recent musical adventures in Canada and the U.S.

Our project is nearly complete but we need your support to get it off the ground. Your contribution will help us put the finishing touches on the recording, including art work, pressing, manufacturing and purchasing rights. It will fund the promotion of the CD and will also enable us to pay off some of the money we have already used towards the musicians' honorariums, travel expenses and the commission of a new piece. Any extra contributions will be used towards our other ongoing projects, 

Details

Most of the music featured on this CD has never been recorded before, including Exequiel Mantega's arrangement of Piazzolla's famous Tango Etudes for two flutes, our own arrangement of the ""Aria"" from Villa-Lobos' Bachianas Brasileira No. 6 for flute and bass flute and the fiery ""Danzas del Fuego"" for two flutes, cello and marimba written for us by Greek-Canadian composer Constantine Caravassilis.

We are proud to present Running the Edge for two flutes and percussive piano by Jennifer Higdon, one of the most frequently performed American composers of our time. Last, but not least, Franz Doppler's well known ""Duettino on Hungarian Motives"" gives us the chance to offer our interpretation on a much loved classic for two flutes and piano.
column9:
>


We are a flute duo based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Though born on

column1: different continents and trained in different countries, we have forged a personal and musical connection<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: > that makes playing together as natural and effortless as

column1:
breathing and even more gratifying than playing alone. Our collaboration began in 2010 with performances in each other's graduating recitals and has since then taken us to various venues and chamber music series in the Toronto area. We are looking forward to an exciting new season with appearances in Toronto, the University of Idaho, New York and Monterrey, Mexico. 

Our vision

Professional flute duos aren't very common and the existing repertoire can quickly be exhausted. This presents a wonderful opportunity for us to influence the creation of new repertoire. Our goal is to keep commissioning exciting new music from young composers. This CD will enable us to apply for grants that will help fund such future projects. 

General Budget Outline

Artist's Honorariums: $3000

Graphic Design: $1000

Marketing Expenses: $2000

Travel Expenses: $2000

Production and Manufacturing: $2000

Acknowledgements

We could not have come this far without the artistic contributions of our musical team, including pianists Chad Spears and Oszkár Morzsa, marimba player Michelle Colton, cellist Amahl Arulanandam and composer Constantine Caravassilis. 

Our heartfelt thanks to our technical team: our sound engineer Peter Olsen, our videographer, Alison J. Gray, our graphic designer Yesim Tosuner and our photographers, Mouna Tahar and Zoltán Lehocki. 

We are immeasurably grateful to the First Hungarian Presbyterian Church of Toronto for allowing us to record most of our album on their premises.

Help Seven Factor be able to tour!

We are Seven Factor. We are a passionate group of musicians that have a vision, and we need your help to make it happen. This summer we have been invited out on tour by our friends and fellow industrial rockers KMFDM. This will be our first tour.

Who is Seven Factor? We are a global art project centered around a touring  band. We want to be able to deliver a user driven live action Alternate Reality Game  (ARG) to our fans, through touring and performing as well as through varies forms of media both physical and Digital.
We want to be able to not only bring the game itself, but also connect with our fans on a personal level by going out into the world and meeting at our shows. We hope to be able to get help funding the tour , as well as manufacturing merchandise items, and other ARG related items that our fans can take home and enjoy
What We Need &
Here's what your contributions will go to:

-Transportation: Need new tires for the big wheels!
-Crew / Roadies
-Gas: Have you seen the cost of a gallon these days?!
-Food: Dudes gotta eat!
-Merchandise such as shirts, posters, cds and more YAY!

In exchange for helping us do this, we want to be able to give you guys
some merchandise as well as some other unique perks to share this

experience with us 

    The Impact

    We LOVE being able to connect with our fans one on one. Your contribution will give us a chance to reach even more people,and make even more Human to Human connections. To share our art, and hopefully inspire others to create their own artwork.

Other Ways You Can Help


    Tell your friends on Facebook, Twitter, or however you guys communicate! Come out to a show. Say hello to us. Let us know who you are =)
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!
