0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h3>
AND WELCOME TO THE GEORGE TAVERN!
First
things first, thank you so much for taking the time to be here, with
us, and be a part of our campaign to save The George Tavern. Whoever
you are, wherever you are and whatever your contribution or curiosity
– we are eternally grateful for your support. Without it, we would
have to close the doors to this historic London landmark which has
served the surrounding community for nearly 400 years.
ARE WE?
We
are The George Tavern. A pub, a bar, an East End boozer in the heart
of Stepney, London. We are a live music venue showcasing a wide
variety of independent and established acts every week with a 3am
license on weekends. We are a platform for thousands of artists from
all over the UK and the rest of the world. We are celebrity
photo-shoots and film sets. We are in the annals of Geoffrey Chaucer,
Charles Dickens and Samuel Pepys. We are full-timers, part-timers and
over-timers. Friends, family, comrades, brothers and sisters. We are
locals, regulars, pub-crawlers and tourists. We are a quiet evening
beer after a long day at work and tray of Jaeger bombs with your best
pals. We are indie, rock, classical, jazz, soul, cabaret, electronic,
folk, blues, singer-songwriter, hip-hop and dance. <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >We are new music giving a stage to up and coming bands, helping them on the road to mainstream success

column1: We
are 400 years of pulling pints and 200 years of live music, theatre
and art. We are, in one word, an institution.
WHY
WE NEED YOUR HELP
Adjoined
to our beloved bar is Stepney's Nightclub – an empty, derelict site
which developers intend to knock down and build six luxury
apartments. Should their plans go ahead unchallenged we will not only
suffer in terms of business and trade, but also lose out on what
makes The George Tavern so special to thousands of people – it's
live music. . Fear of noise complaints will undoubtedly mean having
our live music and 3am license revoked. The loss of revenue would
make the business no longer viable.  It would be a very sad day for
us and the wider London music scene if we can no longer showcase live
acts simply because our wealthy neighbours are being disturbed every
night. For The George Tavern to keep going without it's live music is
like the human body functioning without it's heart.  We have
already been fighting plans to build these luxury apartments for over
8 years (see campaign site).
By selling T-shirts, hosting fundraisers and club nights we have made
a start raising money for legal costs to challenge the plans. But
there's only so much income this has generated - which is why we now

turn to you for your help.

(Photo: Georgia May Jagger)

HOW
WILL YOUR MONEY BE SPENT
Quite
simply – legal costs. <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >For the developers, going to court isn't much of a financial burden.

column1: not so straight forward. Having recently appealed to the High Court
we have felt the expensive sting of the legal process. It's no stingy
business. In order to save The George Tavern we have to fight fire
with fireworks. Your collective pledges will go towards the best
possible legal team we can afford.   We have set a modest target
which won't cover all of our increasing legal costs. We therefore
hope to exceed this target and set reach goals which will also go
towards our fees. We really mean it when we say that every penny or
pound counts!
ENDORSEMENTS
Here
at the George Tavern, we have won the support of many famous artists,
musicians and public figures. Should you make a pledge to our
campaign you will be in the fine company of the likes of Amy
Winehouse, Sir Ian McKellen, Kate Moss and Nick Cave! Not a bad
crowd, ay?

(Photos: Leon Bridges, Kate Moss, Sir Ian McKellen and Pauline Forster)

THE
BIGGER PICTURE
In
the last 12 months London has undergone a wave of gentrification on a
scale never seen before. Numerous community assets and historic
landmarks have made way for profits in property development with
little to no concern on how it effects places like The George Tavern.
The
housing company are hoping we give up under such financial pressure.
But we won't. Ever. Whatever it takes and however much it costs, we
will, with your kind support, fight this until the very end. History
demands us not to roll over and give in just because we can't afford
to keep fighting. London is more than lavish apartments for rich
folk. It is a culture of music and art unrivalled anywhere else in
the world. The stakes are high. Your contribution is invaluable.
FINAL THANK YOU!
We
really cannot thank you enough for your pledges. We have been
overwhelmed by the contributions already made by our current
supporters. Now, we look forward to opening our doors to many more
hundreds of people through this online crowdfunder. Your contribution
will not just save a historic pub from going under, it will help
thousands of musicians to keep the London music scene alive.
If
we could give you all an individual group hug - we would! But we
can't... So, instead, we have listed a bunch of great perks for you
all to scramble over!
So
thank you again for being here to read/watch our campaign. Together

we WILL Save The George Tavern!

MORE INFO ON THE CAMPAIGN

Save The George Tavern Campaign Site

Dazed and Confused article - On The Brink The George Tavern staves off gentrification 

Music Heritage Podcast - Save The George Tavern 

PERKS (IMAGES)

You Can Call Me Alan
Why Another Rock Album?

It has been argued that rock is dead, and the world certainly doesn't need another record that doesn't sell to prove the point.  However, I thought I was making the first album, Fighting Through February, as a personal catharsis.  Then, after putting it out there, I started getting messages.  ""So Much really moved me because I just lost my spouse....""  ""Impossible really inspired me to not make people feel like that.""  ""Who I Am really helped me come to grips with my addiction....I think I can beat it this time!""  ""I was moved to tears when I heard.....""   ""It was good to hear that I'm not alone.""  ""I think maybe we all need to hear this, because it speaks to everyone's broken condition....""

So, I'm making this because I believe in three things:
• All of us are wrestling through something.
• All of us have been conditioned to pretend we're not.
• Music is cathartic and acknowledging our brokenness won't make us whole, but it will help us through.
So Didn't ""Fighting Through February"" Cover It?

No.  The truth is I started out Fighting Through February with 21 songs, thinned it to 12, and have written a good bit on the topic of heartache and loss since then.  There are still pretty good odds that for someone, the disease isn't going to go away.  For someone, the spouse is.  For someone the addiction isn't going to go away.  For someone, the job is.

I believe that the healing that came from ""Fighting Through February"" can continue, and the beautiful thing about ""You Can Call Me Alan"" (spoiler alert) is that FTF was about me, but ""You Can Call Me Alan"" is going to invite everyone to acknowledge that they are Alan Smythy.
Where Will Your Money Go?
We're going to make the album regardless!  But, we need your help for it to be as good as possible.  We need:

Software for the studio and pay for musicians.  I'm bringing back Ryan David Orr, Jonathan Mullins, Sumiko Sprinkle, David Holford, and Wil McCaskle, but these guys sure would like to be paid this time!  Your contributions will help this happen.
Proper mastering....I can master this recording at home, but someone in a true mastering studio can master it better!
• Marketing so the record can reach even more people.

• If the funding goes to around $5,000, we will move the tracking of vocals and guitars to Greenjeans Studios in Wellington, KS, under the expertise of Carter Green, and that will make a HUGE difference in the quality of the record.

The Impact

The truth?  We're doing this record with or without the funding, but with funding, it will be better...better for you to listen to, and better to share with your friends who might be going through rough times (because, surely YOU aren't!)
The world doesn't need another rock album, but it does need to know that pain is ok and part of the human experience.
The first record was not marketed at all, and still made an impact on many people.  Really doing this right can make even a bigger impact.
• Make this really good art will build trust for those who are skeptical when listening just because we're unknowns.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

When I went to start this campaign, they had pointers on what to say in each section, and the pointer for this section was, ""People value your transparency"".  I'll change that to ""People need transparency.""  Putting art of any kind out there is risky, but especially art that explores the pain and heartache of humanity.  And the truth is, with the first album having been compared to ""Sgt. Pepper"" and ""The Wall"", we could fall flat on our face with this one.  But we won't.  Everyone on the Stockholm Syndrome team has incredible creativity, talent, and work ethic.  We learned a bunch on the FTF album.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  You can help by sharing this campaign with all your social media outlets (Facebook, Twitter, etc.).  You can help by sharing the demos as we get them ready.  You can help by playing the FTF album for your friends.
Me asking your friends is like me inviting myself to your friend's house for dinner....Creepy, and may result in an arrest.  Tell your friends.

• Use the Indiegogo share tools!

    • And that's all there is to it.  The whole point of this album is that we are all Alan Smythy at one point or another in life....so help fund and tell people about YOUR upcoming record!  See the perks for how this can be your record!

We are HolidayPark!
ENGLISH

column2: >Summer, sun, happiness! Here at ""HolidayPark,"" we love making pop music and ballads that are fun and upbeat! We just finished our first single, ""Heartbeat,"" and now must complete our album of the same name! But to do so, we need your help!

column6: >Music has always been our greatest passion. In the last few years, we have been putting every cent towards buying equipment, so we could finally be able to record ourselves professionally. In 2012, after our first album, we were taken on by a music label. We were excited and highly motivated by the possibility of professional musical careers. After months of investing time, money, hard work and hope, we realized that our ex-label was not fulfilling its promised terms. Because of our agreement with them, however, we lost our copyrights and name...

column2: >But we didn't let that stop us. We founded a new band this year, ""HolidayPark,"" Now we live for the music again, and this time we won't give up the copyrights to any label, let alone our name! But this means that we must take on a lot of risk. By working together and giving it everything we had, we were able to finish our first single, ""Heartbeat,"" Starting on the third of July, our promotional CDs will be distributed to nearly all radio stations in Germany.

column1: Follow the link below to listen to our single, ""Heartbeat,"" so you can hear our music for yourself.
https://soundcloud.com/little-big-talent/sets/s...
And of course this is our first music video!

column5: >Now we are working on our debut album, which we hope to release in the fall of 2015. But to finish it and create another music video for our song ""Broken Down"" (see link above), we need money. More money than we can invest ourselves. Although we produce the videos ourselves and work with our own dance company, creating professional videos and records is still very expensive.

column1: That's where you come in. Please support or share our campaign, so we can keep working independently and bring the summer into your home, and maybe you will soon be able to hear our music at parties all over the world! With your help we can make a new start!
Also, check out our perks! We have some great stuff for you!
Just have a listen, and enjoy the summer!
This is what we need it for:
Mastering professionally:                             $1750
Cover Design:                                                   $100
CD Print 2000 pcs:                                         $3000
Music video production:                               $5000
Live Equipment (PA, MIXER and MICS): $1500
Kahon Drum:                                                     $150

column5: >Thank you very much for your support!

column1: <h4>""Mike aka LittleBigTalent"" (M<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

Mike was born in Tuebingen, Germany in 1987. After graduating he started making small film- and music projects. When he was 18, he traveled through Australia for a year and a half but then had to go back to Germany for his military service. As a soldier in Afghanistan in 2009, he made his first documentary ""In Action."" Afterwards, he volunteered for 18 months for the peace project ""Cinema Jenin"" in Palestine. In this context he taught film and film editing in the university of Jenin. Subsequently, he was involved as director and art director in several films. His first documentary film, ""The Court,"" made its way to the cinemas in 2013. Since May of 2015, his current project, ‘The Forecaster,’ has been in theaters, and his new film, ""The Promise,"" will follow in spring of 2016.

Since he was eight, Mike has been interested in music. He plays piano, the drums, violin and guitar. Bands like ""Fools Garden,"" ""Lou Bega"" and ""Hermes House Band"" have inspired him and made music his biggest passion. He started to produce digital music very early. Known as ""Psychogate,"" he was involved in the Goa scene and later went by the name ""LittleBigTalent"" at House parties. He founded his first pop band ""I AM"" in 2012 and is now active as a producer and musician for ""HolidayPark.""
""Kiko"" (Francisco Barata)

In 1995 Kiko was born in the Portuguese town Viseu. When he was two years old, he moved to Germany with his mother because his father already worked there. During school he earned some money through part time jobs and afterwards worked as a waiter. Even though Kiko's mother was a singer in Portugal, he first discovered music through the ""Emo"" scene. He was a big fan of ""Avenged Sevenfold,"" ""Bullet For My Valentine"" and ""RED,"" but now works primarily with pop music.

In spring of 2013, he met Mike who discovered his singing talent and made him a member of ""I AM"". Afterwards, they worked on several musical projects before founding ""HolidayPark"" with Franci in 2015.
""Franci"" (Francesca Tummarello)
Franci was born in August of 1987 in Hechingen, Germany. She worked in her parent‘s pizzeria for several years as well as working as a hair stylist.

When she was young, she got into music and began training her voice beyond the shower. She was inspired by artists like the ""Fugees,"" ""Rihanna"" and ""Adele"" and, in 2013, she was a contestant on Germany's largest singing competition series.
In March of 2015, Franci met Mike and Kiko who encouraged her to sing again. Together they founded ""HolidayPark.""

DEUTSCH

Sommer, Sonne, gute Laune! Wir von HolidayPark lieben und produzieren Pop- und Balladenmusik die ins Ohr geht und im Kopf bleibt! Nach unserer Single ""Heartbeat"" muss jetzt unser gleichnamiges Album fertig werden! Doch dafür brauchen wir Eure Hilfe!

column2: >Musik war schon immer unsere größte Leidenschaft. Die letzten Jahre haben wir jeden Cent zusammen gekratzt, um unser erstes Equipment kaufen zu können, damit wir endlich professionellere Aufnahmen anfertigen konnten. Mit unserem ersten Album erreichten wir 2012 schliesslich ein Label. Überglücklich und mit höchster Motivation sahen wir dem Start unserer musikalischen Laufbahn entgegen. Doch nach Monaten harter Arbeit, Investitionen und Gutglauben wurden wir von unserem damaligem Label hintergangen. Da wir vertraglich gebunden waren, verloren wir alle Rechte und unseren Namen...

column1: <span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Doch wir gaben nicht auf und gründeten dieses Jahr unsere neue Band: HolidayPark. Jetzt leben wir wieder für die Musik. Und diesmal geben wir keinem Label unsere Rechte ab, geschweige denn unseren Namen! Doch das bedeutet Eigenfinanzierung und Selbstrisiko. Mit vereinten Kräften und allem, was wir aufbringen konnten, haben wir es nun geschafft, unsere erste Single ""Heartbeat"" auf den Weg in die Radios zu bringen. Ab dem 3. Juli 2015 gehen die ersten Promotion CDs an fast alle Radiosender in Deutschland raus.

column8:
>amit Ihr auch mal einen Eindruck bekommen könnt, wie wir uns eigentlich anhören, hier die Tracks zu unserem Single Album ""Heartbeat"":

https://soundcloud.com/little-big-talent/sets/single-heartbeat-1

Und natürlich gibt's hier unser Musikvideo:
column17:
>Doch jetzt arbeiten wir an unserem Debütalbum, das wir im Herbst 2015 veröffentlichen wollen. Allerdings brauchen wir Geld, um es fertigzustellen und ein zweites Musikvideo zu unserem Song ""Broken Down"" (siehe Demos) produzieren zu können. Mehr Geld, als wir selber noch investieren können, denn auch wenn wir unsere Musikvideos selbst produzieren und mit unserer eigenen Choreotanztruppe zusammen arbeiten, sind die Videodrehs und profesionelle Aufnahmen leider sehr teuer.

Und da kommt Ihr ins Spiel. Unterstützt oder teilt unsere Kampagne, damit wir weiterarbeiten können, unabhängig bleiben und Euch mit unserer Musik den Sommer ins Haus zaubern können. Vielleicht werdet Ihr schon bald unsere Musik auf Parties rund um den Globus hören können! Mit Eurer Hilfe schaffen wir diesen Neustart!

Und werft doch auch mal einen Blick auf unsere Perks, wir haben cooles Zeug für Euch.

Hört mal rein und genießt den Sommer!
column19:
>Dafür brauchen wir das Geld:

10 Aufnahmetage á $350 pro Tag:           $3500

Musikvideo-Produktion:                               $5000

Kahon Trommel:                                               $150


Und vielen Dank Euch allen!

column1: Die Band
<h4>“Mike aka LittleBigTalent” (Michele Genti<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
M
column5: >ike wurde 1987 in Tübingen geboren. Während seines Abiturs begann er bereits mit kleinen Film- und Musikprojekten. Mit 18 Jahren bereiste er für eineinhalb Jahre den Australischen Kontinent, musste dann allerdings zurück nach Deutschland, um seinen Militärdienst abzuleisten. Als Patrouillen-Soldat in Afghanistan drehte er 2009 seinen ersten Dokumentarfilm ""Im Einsatz"". Anschließend leistete er eineinhalb Jahre Freiwilligenarbeit in dem Friedensprojekt ""Cinema Jenin"" in Palästina. Im Rahmen dieses Programms unterrichtete er an der dortigen Universität die Fächer Film und Schnitt. Fortan war er als Regisseur und Art Director bei mehreren Filmen aktiv, so kam 2013 sein erster Dokumentarfilm ""The Court"" ins Kino. Seit Mai 2015 ist sein aktuelles Projekt “The Forecaster” auf den Leinwänden zu sehen, im Frühjahr 2016 wird sein neuer Film “The Promise” folgen.

column1: Seit seinem achten Lebensjahr begeistert sich Mike für Musik, ist Pianist, Schlagzeuger, spielt Geige und Gitarre. Inspiriert von “Fools Garden”, “Lou Bega” oder auch der “Hermes House Band” entwickelte sich Musik zu seiner größten Leidenschaft. Schon früh ging es los mit digitaler Musik und den ersten eigenen Produktionen. Erst als “Psychogate” in der Goaszene vertreten, später durch “LittleBigTalent” auf House Partys, dann mit “I AM” und “Yeah It´s Summer” auf dem Weg zum ARD-Fernsehgarten und nun als Produzent und Musiker bei “HolidayPark”.
“Kiko” (Francisco Barata)

Kiko wurde 1995 in der portugiesischen Stadt Viseu geboren. Im Alter von zwei Jahren zog er zusammen mit seiner Mutter dem schon in Deutschland arbeitenden Vater hinterher. Hier wuchs er in Heilbronn auf. In der Schule verdiente er sich mit kleinen Nebenjobs und schließlich als Kellner sein Auskommen. Schon Kikos Mutter war in Portugal als Sängerin aktiv, zur Musik fand Kiko jedoch erstmals durch die “Emo-Szene”. “Avenged Sevenfold”, “Bullet For My Valentine” oder auch “RED” waren seine ständigen Begleiter, bevor er sich nach einigen Jahren der Popmusik zuwandte.

Im Frühjahr 2013 lernte er schließlich Mike kennen, der sein Gesangstalent entdeckte und ihn kurzerhand zu einem Mitglied von seiner damaligen Band “I AM” machte. Fortan arbeiteten die beiden immer wieder an gemeinsamen musikalischen Projekten, bis sie sich schließlich 2015 zusammen mit Franci zu “HolidayPark” vereinigten.
“Franci” (Francesca Tummarello)

Franci wurde im August 1987 in Hechingen geboren. Als Tochter einer italienischen Familie arbeitete sie lange Zeit in der Pizzeria ihrer Eltern und machte erste Erfahrungen im Berufsleben. Auch als Hairstylistin war sie aktiv.

Schon in jungen Jahren begeisterte sie sich für die Musik und begann damit, ihre Stimme nicht nur unter Dusche zu trainieren. Sie ließ sich durch Musiker wie “Fugges”, “Rihanna” und “Adele” inspirieren. Im Jahr 2013 trat sie bei der deutschen Castingshow ""Deutschland sucht den Superstar"" als Kandidatin an.
Am Freitag, dem 13. März 2015, lernte Franci Mike kennen, durch den sie neuen Mut in ihre Stimme fand. Sie gründeten gemeinsam mit Kiko die Band “HolidayPark”.
","We are HolidayPark!
ENGLISH

Summer, sun, happiness! Here at ""HolidayPark,"" we love making pop music and ballads that are fun and upbeat! We just finished our first single, ""Heartbeat,"" and now must complete our album of the same name! But to do so, we need your help!

Music has always been our greatest passion. In the last few years, we have been putting every cent towards buying equipment, so we could finally be able to record ourselves professionally. In 2012, after our first album, we were taken on by a music label. We were excited and highly motivated by the possibility of professional musical careers. After months of investing time, money, hard work and hope, we realized that our ex-label was not fulfilling its promised terms. Because of our agreement with them, however, we lost our copyrights and name...

But we didn't let that stop us. We founded a new band this year, ""HolidayPark,"" Now we live for the music again, and this time we won't give up the copyrights to any label, let alone our name! But this means that we must take on a lot of risk. By working together and giving it everything we had, we were able to finish our first single, ""Heartbeat,"" Starting on the third of July, our promotional CDs will be distributed to nearly all radio stations in Germany.
Follow the link below to listen to our single, ""Heartbeat,"" so you can hear our music for yourself.
https://soundcloud.com/little-big-talent/sets/s...
And of course this is our first music video!

Now we are working on our debut album, which we hope to release in the fall of 2015. But to finish it and create another music video for our song ""Broken Down"" (see link above), we need money. More money than we can invest ourselves. Although we produce the videos ourselves and work with our own dance company, creating professional videos and records is still very expensive.

That's where you come in. Please support or share our campaign, so we can keep working independently and bring the summer into your home, and maybe you will soon be able to hear our music at parties all over the world! With your help we can make a new start!
Also, check out our perks! We have some great stuff for you!
Just have a listen, and enjoy the summer!
This is what we need it for:
10 recording days á $350 per day:           $3500
Mastering professionally:                             $1750
Cover Design:                                                   $100

Music video production:                               $5000
Live Equipment (PA, MIXER and MICS): $1500
Kahon Drum:                                                     $150
Thank you very much for your support!

DEUTSCHSommer, Sonne, gute Laune! Wir von HolidayPark lieben und produzieren Pop- und Balladenmusik die ins Ohr geht und im Kopf bleibt! Nach unserer Single ""Heartbeat"" muss jetzt unser gleichnamiges Album fertig werden! Doch dafür brauchen wir Eure Hilfe!

Musik war schon immer unsere größte Leidenschaft. Die letzten Jahre haben wir jeden Cent zusammen gekratzt, um unser erstes Equipment kaufen zu können, damit wir endlich professionellere Aufnahmen anfertigen konnten. Mit unserem ersten Album erreichten wir 2012 schliesslich ein Label. Überglücklich und mit höchster Motivation sahen wir dem Start unserer musikalischen Laufbahn entgegen. Doch nach Monaten harter Arbeit, Investitionen und Gutglauben wurden wir von unserem damaligem Label hintergangen. Da wir vertraglich gebunden waren, verloren wir alle Rechte und unseren Namen...

Doch wir gaben nicht auf und gründeten dieses Jahr unsere neue Band: HolidayPark. Jetzt leben wir wieder für die Musik. Und diesmal geben wir keinem Label unsere Rechte ab, geschweige denn unseren Namen! Doch das bedeutet Eigenfinanzierung und Selbstrisiko. Mit vereinten Kräften und allem, was wir aufbringen konnten, haben wir es nun geschafft, unsere erste Single ""Heartbeat"" auf den Weg in die Radios zu bringen. Ab dem 3. Juli 2015 gehen die ersten Promotion CDs an fast alle Radiosender in Deutschland raus.

Damit Ihr auch mal einen Eindruck bekommen könnt, wie wir uns eigentlich anhören, hier die Tracks zu unserem Single Album ""Heartbeat"":https://soundcloud.com/little-big-talent/sets/single-heartbeat-1Und natürlich gibt's hier unser Musikvideo:Doch jetzt arbeiten wir an unserem Debütalbum, das wir im Herbst 2015 veröffentlichen wollen. Allerdings brauchen wir Geld, um es fertigzustellen und ein zweites Musikvideo zu unserem Song ""Broken Down"" (siehe Demos) produzieren zu können. Mehr Geld, als wir selber noch investieren können, denn auch wenn wir unsere Musikvideos selbst produzieren und mit unserer eigenen Choreotanztruppe zusammen arbeiten, sind die Videodrehs und profesionelle Aufnahmen leider sehr teuer.Und da kommt Ihr ins Spiel. Unterstützt oder teilt unsere Kampagne, damit wir weiterarbeiten können, unabhängig bleiben und Euch mit unserer Musik den Sommer ins Haus zaubern können. Vielleicht werdet Ihr schon bald unsere Musik auf Parties rund um den Globus hören können! Mit Eurer Hilfe schaffen wir diesen Neustart!Und werft doch auch mal einen Blick auf unsere Perks, wir haben cooles Zeug für Euch.Hört mal rein und genießt den Sommer!Dafür brauchen wir das Geld:10 Aufnahmetage á $350 pro Tag:           $3500Professionelles Mastering:                          $1750Cover Design:                                                   $100CD Pressung 2000 stk:                                $3000Musikvideo-Produktion:                               $5000Live Equipment (PA, MIXER und MICS): $1500Kahon Trommel:                                               $150Und vielen Dank Euch allen!
Mike            -            Franci            -            Alona            -            Kiko            -            Hannes
Die Band
“Mike aka LittleBigTalent” (Michele Gentile)

Mike wurde 1987 in Tübingen geboren. Während seines Abiturs begann er bereits mit kleinen Film- und Musikprojekten. Mit 18 Jahren bereiste er für eineinhalb Jahre den Australischen Kontinent, musste dann allerdings zurück nach Deutschland, um seinen Militärdienst abzuleisten. Als Patrouillen-Soldat in Afghanistan drehte er 2009 seinen ersten Dokumentarfilm ""Im Einsatz"". Anschließend leistete er eineinhalb Jahre Freiwilligenarbeit in dem Friedensprojekt ""Cinema Jenin"" in Palästina. Im Rahmen dieses Programms unterrichtete er an der dortigen Universität die Fächer Film und Schnitt. Fortan war er als Regisseur und Art Director bei mehreren Filmen aktiv, so kam 2013 sein erster Dokumentarfilm ""The Court"" ins Kino. Seit Mai 2015 ist sein aktuelles Projekt “The Forecaster” auf den Leinwänden zu sehen, im Frühjahr 2016 wird sein neuer Film “The Promise” folgen.

Seit seinem achten Lebensjahr begeistert sich Mike für Musik, ist Pianist, Schlagzeuger, spielt Geige und Gitarre. Inspiriert von “Fools Garden”, “Lou Bega” oder auch der “Hermes House Band” entwickelte sich Musik zu seiner größten Leidenschaft. Schon früh ging es los mit digitaler Musik und den ersten eigenen Produktionen. Erst als “Psychogate” in der Goaszene vertreten, später durch “LittleBigTalent” auf House Partys, dann mit “I AM” und “Yeah It´s Summer” auf dem Weg zum ARD-Fernsehgarten und nun als Produzent und Musiker bei “HolidayPark”.
“Kiko” (Francisco Barata)

Kiko wurde 1995 in der portugiesischen Stadt Viseu geboren. Im Alter von zwei Jahren zog er zusammen mit seiner Mutter dem schon in Deutschland arbeitenden Vater hinterher. Hier wuchs er in Heilbronn auf. In der Schule verdiente er sich mit kleinen Nebenjobs und schließlich als Kellner sein Auskommen. Schon Kikos Mutter war in Portugal als Sängerin aktiv, zur Musik fand Kiko jedoch erstmals durch die “Emo-Szene”. “Avenged Sevenfold”, “Bullet For My Valentine” oder auch “RED” waren seine ständigen Begleiter, bevor er sich nach einigen Jahren der Popmusik zuwandte.

Im Frühjahr 2013 lernte er schließlich Mike kennen, der sein Gesangstalent entdeckte und ihn kurzerhand zu einem Mitglied von seiner damaligen Band “I AM” machte. Fortan arbeiteten die beiden immer wieder an gemeinsamen musikalischen Projekten, bis sie sich schließlich 2015 zusammen mit Franci zu “HolidayPark” vereinigten.
“Franci” (Francesca Tummarello)

Franci wurde im August 1987 in Hechingen geboren. Als Tochter einer italienischen Familie arbeitete sie lange Zeit in der Pizzeria ihrer Eltern und machte erste Erfahrungen im Berufsleben. Auch als Hairstylistin war sie aktiv.

Schon in jungen Jahren begeisterte sie sich für die Musik und begann damit, ihre Stimme nicht nur unter Dusche zu trainieren. Sie ließ sich durch Musiker wie “Fugges”, “Rihanna” und “Adele” inspirieren. Im Jahr 2013 trat sie bei der deutschen Castingshow ""Deutschland sucht den Superstar"" als Kandidatin an.
Am Freitag, dem 13. März 2015, lernte Franci Mike kennen, durch den sie neuen Mut in ihre Stimme fand. Sie gründeten gemeinsam mit Kiko die Band “HolidayPark”.",14.0,2,"1 Campaign
|","Tuebingen, Germany",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/holidaypark-album-and-music-video-release-2015/pica

I.D.S.F.A. is a group of miscreants who met in hell many many lifetimes ago, Eventually becoming one of the most popular and influential bands in the underworld. Things got a little carried away one night at an after party,  They Roofied Satan with a dose of their own concocted drug called “Demon Puss” and used Satan as their personal playtoy for the evening. After that fateful night they were banished to the Town Of EEV-Ville, a town located 66.6 miles south of hell,  This is the place where the ones who are too evil for hell are sent. Once they arrived In the town of EEV-Ville, they formed what is now known as The Dept. Of Death, The Dept.'s mission, is to tour the world and spread their infection to all, Once infected, those will then follow alongside the Dept. on their tirade of Death. These infected are called “The Chosen” and they will not stop till death has reached every corner of the globe.

I.D.S.F.A. Is a 2 time award winning Shock Rock band based out of Las Vegas Nevada.

They have won 2 VRMA awards, 2011 “Best Shock Rock” and 2013 “Best Of Vegas” by Vegas Rocks Magazine Awards. They have also been seen in publications like the L.A. Times, Vegas Rocks Magazine Goir Noir Magazine, SoCal Music Today, Vegas Weekly and others.
column5:
>We are doing a crowd funding campaign to help us with our new production entitled 'Bodies In The Basement'. 

The concept will follow the story of 1 victim and their journey through the macabre world of I.D.S.F.A. It will take the audience through the horrors one might experience if “Chosen” by I.D.S.F.A.

This campaign will help us fund the recording of the Concept CD with 13 songs, the filming of a 15-20 minute short film and the building of new props, costumes and masks for new characters. This Production will be a mixture of music intertwined with a short film with live onstage theatrics to tell a dark and  disturbing tale.

This Crowd Funding will feature some great incentives such as 2 'Custom Made' I.D.S.F.A. guitars by the guys over at Evolution guitars. These guitars are incredible and feature a new innovative guitar design called the 'Evolution' with interchangeable face plates. These guitars are valued between $1400-1800 each. These will be available for a discounted price of $1000 through this crowd funding campaign. You will get to work personally with the design team and custom make your guitar with them. These will truly be one of a kind. Visit their website below for more info

https://www.theevolutionguitar.com/
column9: >Fans will also be able to pick up the very first run on our Newest single, a musical salute to the late Oderus Urungus entitled. ""The Genius That Was Oderus"" There were only 100 printed and they will be numbered, autographed then sealed. This is the only way to get a hard copy of this single at this time. You can check out the Lyric Video here.
column13:
>https://youtu.be/pUWkKKzpoiU

If you would like to download a digital copy of 'The Genius That Was Oderus' you can do so on Itunes or here at amazon

http://www.amazon.com/The-Genius-That-Was-Oderu...

I.D.S.F.A. Is endorsed/sponsored by The Evolution Guitars, SIT strings, Zombie Apocalypse Vodka, Clayton Picks and more.

We have played with bands such as Mushroomhead, D.R.I. Anvil, Spineshank, the Adicts and many others.

Visit I.D.S.F.A. here

Short Summary

Hey beautiful People! As a lot of you know, I've been in the music industry for more than 10 years and i've been working hard at, trying to find my way as a singer/songwriter. I'm finally ready to release the songs that have come from my heart. The EP is made up of 6 songs that i've written and have been produced by some of the best in the industry. I believe this is what I was born to do.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

There's a lot that goes into finishing a record. Here is what your funds will go towards.

- Mixing and Mastering

- CD Press

- Album Release Concert

- Cover Art

This is just the first campaign push. There's so much more to do, Like raising money for the Tour and Music Videos. 

The Impact

I will be so grateful to anyone who takes the plunge to help me at all! Every single dollar helps, and is more than appreciated. I don't want to give up on my dream of music, but as all artists know it is a very expensive process  to record, and to do so with the standards I have set for myself. I only want to release high quality music, and with your help I can!

Summary

KOVLO will release their new record this fall and ask for your personal support!

column2: >With the release of their first three records, KOVLO became

column1: one of the most interesting and important Swiss post-rock and instrumental rock
bands. Today they are worldwide known and critically acclaimed. During their
European tours they played so far in Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark,
Italy, Czech Republic.

Would you like to be part of the project? We are making this campaign because first of all we want to make this record as best as we can. Secondly, we would also like to be able to promote it as best as we can.
If you support us, we will be able, for example, to release for the first time a record on vinyl, and not only on CD. We would also be able to do a good promotion and make some cool videos.
The costs for making the record: around 4000 dollars.
For the Vinyl: around 1500 dollars.
For the CD: around 1000 dollars.
For making a video: around 1000 dollars.
For a good promotion: at least 1000 dollars.
We will release the record in any case, but if you support us, we can do it much better and we can do much more.

column2: >This means that even if we don't reach the goal, in any case we will be able to use the money we will raise and make the best out of it!

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

If just can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help! You can get the word out and make some noise about your campaign!

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

column4: >Ramon y su son prépare son second album!

column1: 4 ans après la sortie de Pa'l monte, le premier EP de Ramon y su son, le second album est en route. J'ai sélectionné les 10 chansons (entre près d'une centaine composée au gré de l'inspiration et des voyages des dernières années) qui seront présente sur ce nouveau CD qui mélangera les langues et les rythmes.

Je souhaite, à travers cet album, reconnecter avec mes racines musicales en explorant les rythmes afro-colombiens tel le bullerengue, la puya, la cumbia, la tambora et le currulao auxquels j'ajouterai des sons électroniques, ainsi que la champeta et la salsa urbana.

Les voyages que j'ai fait au cours des dernières années m'ont poussé à dénoncer une problématique qui m'inquiète beaucoup, soit celle de la destruction de la Pachamama et l'oppression qui affecte les  communautés autochtones à travers le vol et la destruction de leurs ressources et de leurs terres sacrées. Par exemple, c'est le cas des industries minières qui débarquent et déplacent les groupes autochtones et non-autochtones afin de creuser et puiser au coeur de ces terres sacrées où des communautés ont vécu en harmonie avec la nature pendant des centaines d'années.
Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Le financement participatif est, selon moi, ce vers quoi l'industrie musicale doit se diriger: les fans permettent aux groupes qu'ils aiment de créer, sachant exactement où va leur argent. Il n'y a pas d'intermédiaires, de commissions ou autres qui empochent.
Afin d'enregistrer cet album, j'ai donc besoin de votre support. Grâce à vous, j'espère amasser la somme de 6 500$. Celle-ci servira à payer:
<ul>
• 3000$ - Les heures de studios (enregistrement + mastering)
• 2000$ - Les musiciens (4X500$)
• 500$ - L'artiste qui fera le design de la pochette de l'album
• 1000$ - L'impression des CDs

Indiegogo offre deux choix de financement: fixe ou flexible. J'ai choisi le financement flexible afin d'avoir accès à vos contributions même si mon objectif n'est pas atteint, ainsi, je pourrai tout de même produire le CD en m'ajustant au montant que j'aurai reçu.

En échange de votre appui financier, vous recevrez différents cadeaux, allant du téléchargement de l'album en primeur, au concert privé. Consultez la liste des contreparties. Toute contribution, même la plus petite, est grandement appréciée!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusic
Instagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson
Site web: www.ramonysuson.com

column2: >Ramon y su son's second album is on its way!
column5: >, Ramon y su son's first EP, the second album
column6: > is on the way! I chose the 10 songs that will feature on the CD which will be mostly in spanish, but also in french and english.
column7: >With this album, I want to reconnect to my musical roots, exploring different afro-colombian rhythms like bullerengue,  puya, cumbia, tambora and currulao, and mixing them with some electronic sounds, champeta and salsa urbana.
column8: >The travels I did in the last few years urged me to denounce an issue that worries me a lot, which is the environmental destruction and the oppression and colonialism that Indigenous peoples in North and South America continue to experience. This has been done through the appropriation of their sacred lands where they have lived in harmony with nature for hundreds of years, resulting in unsustainable development for these communities.
column10: >What I need and what you get
column11: >Crowdfunding appears to be the best thing happening now in the music industry: it's a way that supporters of a band can help their favorite bands create, knowing exactly where their money goes.
column12: >No middlemen, no commissions, or someone else getting the money.
column13: >So to achieve this project, I'm gonna need your help. Through your donations, I hope to be able to get the amount of 6 500$ that I need to record the CD. This will help pay for:

column1: • 3000$ - Studio hours (recording + mastering)
• 2000$ - The musicians who will participate in the recording (4X500$)
• 500$ - The artist who's gonna design the album
• 1000$ - Printing of the CDs

Indiegogo offers two options for crowdfunding: fixed funding or flex funding. I chose the flex funding so I can get the money even though my 6 500$ objective is not achieve, therefore I would be able to record the album, adapting me to the amount I received.

In exchange of your contribution, you will receive different gifts (digital download, t-shirts, a private concert...). Check out all the unique perks I'm offering for your help. I'm grateful for every contribution, even the smallest!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusic
Instagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson
Web site: www.ramonysuson.com

El segundo albúm de Ramon y su son está en el horno!

 4 años despues del lanzamiento de Pa’l monte, el primer EP de Ramon y su son, el segundo album esta en camino. Ya seleccione 10 canciones ( entre casi una centena de composiciones inspiradas en los viajes de mis ultimos años) que serán presentadas en este nuevo disco que sera una mezcla de lenguas y ritmos. 

 Yo espero por medio de este album, reconectarme con mis raices musicales colombianas, explorando los diferentes ritmos afro-colombianos como lo son el bullerengue, la puya, la cumbia, la tambora, el currulao los cuales mezclare con sonidos electrónicos. También habrá salsa urbana y champeta. 

 Los viajes que he hecho en los ultimos años, me incitaron a dencunciar una problemática que me preocupa bastante, la cual es la destrucción de la Pachamama y la opresion que afecta las comunidades indigenas por medio del robo y la destruccion de sus recursos naturales y de sus tierras sagradas. Por ejemplo el caso de las compañias mineras que llegan y desplazan las comunidades indigenas y campesinos haciendo excavaciones en sus tierras sagradas en donde han vivido en armonia con el medio ambiente por cientos de años. 


Lo que necesito y lo que obtendran a cambio

El financiamiento participativo, desde mi punto de vista, es la forma en como la industria musical deberia dirijirse. El publico financia los grupos musicales que ellos les gusta, para que asi estos grupos puedan crear su musica sabiendo exactamente para donde va el dinero. No hay intermediarios, comisiones, o terceras personas que toman el dinero. 

Entonces para poder grabar este album necesito de tu apoyo. Gracias a tu colaboracion espero colectar la suma de 6.500 dolares que va a ayudar a pagar :
<li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >3 000 dolares - Las horas de estudio (Grabación y masterizacion)

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >2 000 dolares - Los musicos que participaran en la grabación (4X500$)

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >500 dolares - El artista que hara la caratula del album

column1: <li>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >1 000 dolares - La impresion de los CDs

column1: La plataforma de internet de recoleccion de fondos (Indiegogo) ofrece dos opciones de campaña : Fija o flexible.

Yo escoji flexible para poder obtener tus contribuciones inclusive si no alcanzo el objetivo de los 6 500 dolares, asi podre grabar el Cd de todas formas ajustando el dinero que me quede faltando. 

 En intercambio de tu apoyo financiero, reciviras diferentes regalos (mirar al lado derecho). 

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusic

Instagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson 

Pagina web: www.ramonysuson.com

4 ans après la sortie de Pa'l monte, le premier EP de Ramon y su son, le second album est en route. J'ai sélectionné les 10 chansons (entre près d'une centaine composée au gré de l'inspiration et des voyages des dernières années) qui seront présente sur ce nouveau CD qui mélangera les langues et les rythmes.

Je souhaite, à travers cet album, reconnecter avec mes racines musicales en explorant les rythmes afro-colombiens tel le bullerengue, la puya, la cumbia, la tambora et le currulao auxquels j'ajouterai des sons électroniques, ainsi que la champeta et la salsa urbana.

Les voyages que j'ai fait au cours des dernières années m'ont poussé à dénoncer une problématique qui m'inquiète beaucoup, soit celle de la destruction de la Pachamama et l'oppression qui affecte les  communautés autochtones à travers le vol et la destruction de leurs ressources et de leurs terres sacrées. Par exemple, c'est le cas des industries minières qui débarquent et déplacent les groupes autochtones et non-autochtones afin de creuser et puiser au coeur de ces terres sacrées où des communautés ont vécu en harmonie avec la nature pendant des centaines d'années.
Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Le financement participatif est, selon moi, ce vers quoi l'industrie musicale doit se diriger: les fans permettent aux groupes qu'ils aiment de créer, sachant exactement où va leur argent. Il n'y a pas d'intermédiaires, de commissions ou autres qui empochent.
Afin d'enregistrer cet album, j'ai donc besoin de votre support. Grâce à vous, j'espère amasser la somme de 6 500$. Celle-ci servira à payer:
3000$ - Les heures de studios (enregistrement + mastering)
2000$ - Les musiciens (4X500$)
500$ - L'artiste qui fera le design de la pochette de l'album
1000$ - L'impression des CDs

Indiegogo offre deux choix de financement: fixe ou flexible. J'ai choisi le financement flexible afin d'avoir accès à vos contributions même si mon objectif n'est pas atteint, ainsi, je pourrai tout de même produire le CD en m'ajustant au montant que j'aurai reçu.

En échange de votre appui financier, vous recevrez différents cadeaux, allant du téléchargement de l'album en primeur, au concert privé. Consultez la liste des contreparties. Toute contribution, même la plus petite, est grandement appréciée!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusic
Instagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson
Site web: www.ramonysuson.com

Ramon y su son's second album is on its way!4 years after Pa'l monte, Ramon y su son's first EP, the second album is on the way! I chose the 10 songs that will feature on the CD which will be mostly in spanish, but also in french and english. With this album, I want to reconnect to my musical roots, exploring different afro-colombian rhythms like bullerengue,  puya, cumbia, tambora and currulao, and mixing them with some electronic sounds, champeta and salsa urbana.The travels I did in the last few years urged me to denounce an issue that worries me a lot, which is the environmental destruction and the oppression and colonialism that Indigenous peoples in North and South America continue to experience. This has been done through the appropriation of their sacred lands where they have lived in harmony with nature for hundreds of years, resulting in unsustainable development for these communities.What I need and what you getCrowdfunding appears to be the best thing happening now in the music industry: it's a way that supporters of a band can help their favorite bands create, knowing exactly where their money goes. No middlemen, no commissions, or someone else getting the money. So to achieve this project, I'm gonna need your help. Through your donations, I hope to be able to get the amount of 6 500$ that I need to record the CD. This will help pay for:
3000$ - Studio hours (recording + mastering)
2000$ - The musicians who will participate in the recording (4X500$)
500$ - The artist who's gonna design the album
1000$ - Printing of the CDs

Indiegogo offers two options for crowdfunding: fixed funding or flex funding. I chose the flex funding so I can get the money even though my 6 500$ objective is not achieve, therefore I would be able to record the album, adapting me to the amount I received.

In exchange of your contribution, you will receive different gifts (digital download, t-shirts, a private concert...). Check out all the unique perks I'm offering for your help. I'm grateful for every contribution, even the smallest!
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusic
Instagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson
Web site: www.ramonysuson.com

El segundo albúm de Ramon y su son está en el horno! 4 años despues del lanzamiento de Pa’l monte, el primer EP de Ramon y su son, el segundo album esta en camino. Ya seleccione 10 canciones ( entre casi una centena de composiciones inspiradas en los viajes de mis ultimos años) que serán presentadas en este nuevo disco que sera una mezcla de lenguas y ritmos.  Yo espero por medio de este album, reconectarme con mis raices musicales colombianas, explorando los diferentes ritmos afro-colombianos  como lo son el bullerengue, la puya, la cumbia, la tambora, el currulao los cuales mezclare con sonidos electrónicos. También habrá salsa urbana y champeta.  Los viajes que he hecho en los ultimos años, me incitaron a dencunciar una problemática  que me preocupa bastante, la cual es la destrucción de la Pachamama y la opresion que afecta las comunidades indigenas por medio del robo y la destruccion de sus recursos naturales y de sus tierras sagradas. Por ejemplo el caso de las compañias mineras que llegan y desplazan las comunidades indigenas y campesinos haciendo excavaciones en sus tierras sagradas en donde han vivido en armonia con el medio ambiente por cientos de años. Lo que necesito y lo que obtendran a cambioEl financiamiento participativo, desde mi punto de vista, es la forma en como la industria musical deberia dirijirse. El publico financia los grupos musicales que ellos les gusta, para que asi estos grupos puedan crear su musica  sabiendo exactamente para donde va el dinero. No hay intermediarios, comisiones, o terceras personas que toman el dinero. Entonces para poder grabar este album necesito de tu apoyo. Gracias a tu colaboracion espero colectar la suma de 6.500 dolares que va a ayudar a pagar :
3 000 dolares - Las horas de estudio (Grabación y masterizacion)
2 000 dolares - Los musicos que participaran en la grabación (4X500$)
500 dolares - El artista que hara la caratula del album
1 000 dolares - La impresion de los CDs
La plataforma de internet de  recoleccion de fondos (Indiegogo) ofrece dos opciones de campaña : Fija o flexible.

Yo escoji flexible para poder obtener  tus contribuciones inclusive si no alcanzo el objetivo de los 6 500 dolares, asi podre grabar el Cd de todas formas ajustando el dinero que me quede faltando.  En intercambio de tu apoyo financiero, reciviras diferentes regalos (mirar al lado derecho). Facebook: www.facebook.com/ramonysusonmusicInstagram: https://instagram.com/ramonysuson Pagina web: www.ramonysuson.com",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

My Story

So here's my story. I live in Beit Shemesh which is a medium-sized town tucked away in the hills of Jerusalem, I'm originally from Montreal, Canada. My life here is pretty sweet. I adore my wife and family. I take time to enjoy exercise, nature and watching my kids grow up. I'm trying to grow myself too, every day, mainly through the teachings of Chassidut (chassidic philosophy on life).
Getting Serious

All this is fairly blessed and typical, but the music, well, is a bit out of the ordinary. While I've always been involved in making and sharing music in some capacity (playing drums in rock bands, entertaining with my guitar and niggunim in shuls, camp, and schools, humming and recording original tunes into my phone etc...), I first hit play in a real recording studio and cut a few of my own tracks about 18 months ago.

column3: '>Here's one of the best things that came out of those early sessions. It's a heavy rock song called
column6: '>CLOSER and it's based on a verse from the book Devarim (Deuteronomy) as well as an experience I had traveling to Rashb""I/Meron on Lag b'Omer:

column1: <div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/R8ezpByH_2k?autohide=1&amp
And here's the whole collection of songs I made last year.
It includes a real barn-burner about traveling to Uman that's gotten a lot of attention and much is much beloved (or loathed - the message, not the music - depending on your point of view).
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/IRrhwDhs1RU?autohide=1&amp

column3: '>Yes, it's been a wild year and a half. Starts and stalls. More recording, some live performances - most recently at the Klezmer Festival in Safed, lots of praying, learning and improving. With every new song, I feel like I'm honing my musical voice and getting closer (no pun intended) to the artist I could be.

column1: Why did I start recording, why am I doing this?

The short answer is this: I always had this burning desire to make music but there were always so many obstacles, both self-imposed and others, standing in my way -  and this lasted for years. Then, after an epic journey to Uman for Rosh Hashana, as if by some mystical magic, my deepened connection to R. Nachman and other great Holy Men, tzadikim, gave me the courage to just go for it.
And now,  I'm ready to take the next step!

Which is recording and promoting a new 5 song EP. I've already written a lot of it. The songs are sounding pretty awesome so far - a serious cut above what I've already done. Some of the track titles are:
""Patience""
""Bigger man""
""Direction Up""
The first demo track is already out in the world, you can hear it, it'called 'Deepest Moments.'
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/JfvBrDY1hB4?autohide=1&amp

A lot of people have given me great feedback on this one and it isn't even finished yet. It needs polishing, more guitar riffage and beats!!! Disclaimer:: I think it'll probably be one of the mellower track on the album.

Overall, I want to blend an easy listening style with a bit of edginess and aggression - think 311 and Linkin Park mixed with the Beastie Boys, mixed with Ed Sheeran and with just a smattering of Matisyahu.
I'm almost there.
What's next?

To make a long story short and without going into all the technical details -  To fulfill this dream of producing the phattest, dopest, illest sounding new Jewish music this side of the Mediterranean, right here in local studios in Beit Shemesh will require your kind assistance.
Yes, I get by with a little help from my friends.
What your hard-earned money will go towards:

- MORE STUDIO TIME Approximately 50 hours should do it. Including recording editing/production work, and mastering. And no fancy Tel Aviv. It's all homegrown and cooked right here in Beit Shemesh - who would have thunk!?

- GEEEAARRRR I need some new gear like an electric guitar for recording, a drum-pad and keyboard for making beats. I need to hit the road on many a performance so the gear will come in handy for these musical escapades.
- PROMOTION The album has to be promoted to be heard, primarily through videos, Facebook and Instagram ads.
Idealism

column3: '>Do I have idealistic goals that transcend the music or that I somehow want the music to be a channel for?

column1: I would like us to all be more unified, here in Israel and around the world. I LOVE that so many different kinds of people get excited about my music - young and old religious or not - who cares!? The right music is a unifying force for good!
I have a deep desire to make meaningful connections with people of every age, background, races, color, and creed.
Music is a fantastic way for me to pursue this desire. I want us all to part together (in  a kosher way) right now...to create good vibes day and night, all the time.
But at the end of the day, I'm just an artist. I have to be honest and say that, for me, creating music is an and end in of itself.
If people enjoy it and come together around it, that's the gravy,
What happens if (yikes) I don't raise the $$$?
Even if I don't raise all the money, I'll still make the record. I've gone this far independantly, and I won't quit - that part is up to me.
The degree to which you'd like to make it easier for me -  is up to you : )
Please check out the options for donating and the corresponding perks. I know the perks aren't so exotic much but they're from the heart - just like my music is.
Thank yous
Thanks to all my collaborators
Thanks to everyone who's already contributed, their money, time energy and spirit to my music
Thank you to my wife and family
and a BIG SHOUT OUT to all those who support this project.
I hope to catch you all at the CD launch party in Jerusalem or at the inauguration of the holy temple, where, naturally, I'll be one of the edgier acts on the bill (whichever comes sooner).
Peace, Love and Unity
Shmuel AKA BeINONI

So here's my story. I live in Beit Shemesh which is a medium-sized town tucked away in the hills of Jerusalem, I'm originally from Montreal, Canada. My life here is pretty sweet. I adore my wife and family. I take time to enjoy exercise, nature and watching my kids grow up. Here's one of the best things that came out of those early sessions. It's a heavy rock song called  CLOSER and it's based on a verse from the book Devarim (Deuteronomy) as well as an experience I had traveling to Rashb""I/Meron on Lag b'Omer:
And here's the whole collection of songs I made last year.
It includes a real barn-burner about traveling to Uman that's gotten a lot of attention and much is much beloved (or loathed - the message, not the music - depending on your point of view).

Yes, it's been a wild year and a half. Starts and stalls. More recording, some live performances - most recently at the Klezmer Festival in Safed, lots of praying, learning and improving. With every new song, I feel like I'm honing my musical voice and getting closer (no pun intended) to the artist I could be.
Why did I start recording, why am I doing this?

The short answer is this: I always had this burning desire to make music but there were always so many obstacles, both self-imposed and others, standing in my way -  and this lasted for years. Then, after an epic journey to Uman for Rosh Hashana, as if by some mystical magic, my deepened connection to R. Nachman and other great Holy Men, tzadikim, gave me the courage to just go for it.

And now,  I'm ready to take the next step!

Patience""
Bigger man""
Direction Up""

I'm almost there.
What's next?

To make a long story short and without going into all the technical details -  To fulfill this dream of producing the phattest, dopest, illest sounding new Jewish music this side of the Mediterranean, right here in local studios in Beit Shemesh will require your kind assistance.
Yes, I get by with a little help from my friends.
What your hard-earned money will go towards:

- MORE STUDIO TIME Approximately 50 hours should do it. Including recording editing/production work, and mastering. And no fancy Tel Aviv. It's all homegrown and cooked right here in Beit Shemesh - who would have thunk!?

- GEEEAARRRR I need some new gear like an electric guitar for recording, a drum-pad and keyboard for making beats. I need to hit the road on many a performance so the gear will come in handy for these musical escapades.
- PROMOTION The album has to be promoted to be heard, primarily through videos, Facebook and Instagram ads.
Idealism
Do I have idealistic goals that transcend the music or that I somehow want the music to be a channel for?
Yes
and....
No.

I would like us to all be more unified, here in Israel and around the world. I LOVE that so many different kinds of people get excited about my music - young and old religious or not - who cares!? The right music is a unifying force for good!
I have a deep desire to make meaningful connections with people of every age, background, races, color, and creed.
Music is a fantastic way for me to pursue this desire. I want us all to part together (in  a kosher way) right now...to create good vibes day and night, all the time.
But at the end of the day, I'm just an artist. I have to be honest and say that, for me, creating music is an and end in of itself.
If people enjoy it and come together around it, that's the gravy,
What happens if (yikes) I don't raise the $$$?
Even if I don't raise all the money, I'll still make the record. I've gone this far independantly, and I won't quit - that part is up to me.
The degree to which you'd like to make it easier for me -  is up to you : )
Please check out the options for donating and the corresponding perks. I know the perks aren't so exotic much but they're from the heart - just like my music is.

Thanks to everyone who's already contributed, their money, time energy and spirit to my music
Thank you to my wife and family
and a BIG SHOUT OUT to all those who support this project.
I hope to catch you all at the CD launch party in Jerusalem or at the inauguration of the holy temple, where, naturally, I'll be one of the edgier acts on the bill (whichever comes sooner).

MY STORY

I want to share a bit of my story with you. I started making music in high school, but felt like the music I was making, lacked purpose, so I took a break from it for a while. Fast forward to 2015 when it hit me that life is short. I realized that I should pursue my dream to inspire others through my music and leave a positive impact on the world. My son and I were living in Los Angeles at the time but ended up homeless, which prompted our relocation to Las Vegas (Click here to read more about that).

Once we settled in, I was able to continue to pursue my music career.  I have worked extremely hard over the years, and have accomplished a lot in a short time. I'm grateful that I've been able to show my son and others that we can do anything we set our minds to. My goal is to make music that people can relate to the way I did in my song ""Sunshine."" Check out a live performance of 'Sunshine' with my band below.

 

In December of 2017, I hosted a Toy Drive to collect toys for children in need. FOX News caught wind of my Toy Drive and invited my son and I to perform live on TV to help promote the event. I'm proud to say we raised over 100 toys to donate to HELP of Southern Nevada. Check out the clip of our performance below.

 

 

Yahoo recently featured an article they wrote about me along with an interview on the front page of Yahoo.Com. Check it out by clicking here.

I've had a successful year thus far, here are some of my 2018 highlights.

- Named as a performing artist at the Life is Beautiful Music + Arts Festival
where I share the bill with world-renowned artists such as The Weeknd and Florence + The Machine
- Named 'Best of Las Vegas 2018' by The Las Vegas Weekly Magazine
- Opening act for KRS-One at The Novo in Downtown LA *Click here to check recap video
- Featured in the Las Vegas Review-Journal *Click here to read the inspirational article
- Named as a performing artist at the Indie Week Music Festival in Toronto, ON.

Check out this interview I did on ABC News.

 

THE ALBUM

The album is filled with incredible songs that touch on topics such as life, relationships, family and more. It speaks a lot about my personal experiences. I wholeheartedly believe in the project and genuinely feel that listeners will appreciate it. I receive emails and direct messages from people from all over the world expressing how much my music has helped them and I'm confident this project will have that same positive effect. I have released albums in the past, however, I believe now it's time to raise funds to take my career to the next level and breakout nation-wide.

 

THE FUNDS

As you can imagine, producing a high-quality album is an expensive mission to accomplish. However, I'm confident that with your backing you can help me make the world a better place through my music. We can do this! I'm hoping to raise $16,000 during this campaign which would allow me to finish and promote the album. Normally a record label would cover these costs, but I don't currently have the backing of a label so I must do it independently with your help. I've listed the areas where the funds will be allocated down below.

Production - Professionally recording, mixing, and mastering the songs allowing me to compete with major artists.

Promotion - A portion of the funds will be allocated for public relations to assist in bringing awareness to the album. It's important for me to be able to reach the masses with this project.

***If I exceed my goal I'll be able to produce a music video for the album with the additional funds raised.

 

THE IMPACT

Back when I was homeless in LA, I used to drive for Uber and Lyft so I could earn money for a place to live. That's when I realized the impact my music had on people. The passengers that I would pick up would ask to hear my music, and when I shared it with them, they would often shed tears.

Check out this short clip where I speak about these experiences.


Here is a music video for my song 'Crown' which has been well received and described as inspiring many times over. 

My goal is to continue to inspire people across the globe, and my next album will help me in doing so.

 

THANK YOU

I am incredibly grateful for any contributions, no matter the size. I would not have made it where I am today without supporters like yourself. If you're not in a position to contribute or would like to do more, please spread the word on social media, that helps more than you know!  Indiegogo has great sharing tools next to the ""Back It"" button, so feel free to use them to assist me in expanding my reach. Thank you in advance for your support, you are much appreciated.

Follow me online:
Web: http://www.mikexaviermusic.com
IG: http://instagram.com/mikexaviermusic
Twitter: http://twitter.com/mikexaviermusic
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/mikexaviermusic
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/c/mikexaviermusic
Soundcloud: http://soundcloud.com/mikexavier

Nick Teehan

I've been a musician all my life and a songwriter for 10 years. I'm trying to take things to a new depth with my most intimate and polished work. I've personally funded production on this album, a music video, t-shirts,  a songbook of original sheet music
column2: all the stuff my fans have been asking for for years.  I have the tools and materials to have a truly successful release that can help elevate my work and bring it to a national and international audience, but I need your help to complete our mission.

column1: What We Need and What You Get:

This release has called on every contact I have to get things done, and some of those fees have been deferred in anticipation of this crowdfunding campaign.  There are also upcoming costs including printing vinyl and producing merch, and promotion and publicity for the release. The break down is as follows: $3000 in outstanding production fees, $3000 in vinyl and CD printing, $2000 in publicity and promotion.

As incentives I've racked my brain and come up with the following incentives, available in a bunch of different configurations: downloads, CDs, Vinyl, T-Shirts, Songbooks, Ransom-style thank-you notess, made-to-order personal songs, post-cards from my cat, singing voice-mail telegrams, and personal watercolour portraits by Canadian watercolour artist Terra Hazelton (@terradawndoodles on insta)
The Impact

My 2012 release There is Not a Snake had a great release show and some nice publicity, but These Little Things has a different set of goals.  I have always been able to reach the audience I'm exposed to. Your contributions will give my unique brand of music thousands of new ears across Canada, and I know you're going to love the exclusive access and advanced copies of my work. I've sold nearly every copy of my back-catalogue grinding out shows in my hometown, I can't wait to take this thing over the top with your help. The better this campaign goes, the more unique stuff I'll come up with to keep my fans entertained and delighted.
<h3>Risks &amp

I'm doing a lot of weird perks. More than the average campaign. One reason is that I just came up with tons of good ideas, but another one is that I truly like being creative and unique. The prospect of at least one person using the singing telegram to deliver weird news was too much to pass up.  Some of these, like the paintings and the printed songbook, rely on deadlines that I won't have complete control over. I have no idea how many ransom notes people will want, but I would love to be challenged to do too many. The vinyl also won't be available by Christmas.
Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you won't have the funds or ability to help with my campaign, and that's cool. Others (I'm looking at you, McGee) have accidentally bought the same CD several times and we need to work on our trust.  

Here's what you can do to help out: share this stuff on social, sure, but more importantly tell your friends. Tell people about my old songs about mannequins and raccoons and dachshunds.  Tell them the story of this record, the winter cabin where I wrote and recorded it, the story about haunting my wife, and how to spell my last name T-E-E-H-A-N and how to pronounce it ""Tee-in"". 

Your contributions make all the difference ""these little things"" are so important. Can't wait to see what you're all capable of.
","Nick Teehan

I've been a musician all my life and a songwriter for 10 years. I'm trying to take things to a new depth with my most intimate and polished work. I've personally funded production on this album, a music video, t-shirts,  a songbook of original sheet music
column2: all the stuff my fans have been asking for for years.  I have the tools and materials to have a truly successful release that can help elevate my work and bring it to a national and international audience, but I need your help to complete our mission.

column1: What We Need and What You Get:

This release has called on every contact I have to get things done, and some of those fees have been deferred in anticipation of this crowdfunding campaign.  There are also upcoming costs including printing vinyl and producing merch, and promotion and publicity for the release. Hi, I'm Sebastian Tree, an extremely passionate Singer / Songwriter from the UK. I have invested my whole life in to my career and I really love what I do. I am hoping now you guys can be a part of this incredible journey too and help me generate enough money to help promote my new Single!

I am looking to generate £6000 of funding to promote / advertise my new single on Facebook and Instagram. £4000 of the budget will be spent on these 2 platforms as they are the most effective when it comes to music marketing. I will spend £1000 on other sites such as YouTube, Twitter, Apple Music and Spotify. I will use £700 for the music video and
£300 for merchandise after the release date. 

If I don't get the exact funding I need, then I will just use the money I do get from this campaign on advertising the single on Instagram and Facebook.

If I can achieve the funding I require you would literally be the record label I don't have. All a label would do in todays market is mainly promote this song on Instagram and Facebook. Well I've took marketing courses and studied social medial for 4 years now so I don't need to pay anyone to do it. This is where I know how to target and reach an audience on all Social Media platforms....I just need the funding to run the advertising and make the music video.

I will run a 6 week Social Media campaign, generating interest around the release of the song. I know who my target audience is and how to maximise this budget. I have ran campaigns before and in the past paid other companies to do it. The truth is, if I'd of spent the money on advertising myself, rather than pay these marketing companies, I would of seen much greater results. There is no one more qualified than me to run these campaigns. I have heavily invested time and money in to studying Facebook, Instagram, Spotify and YouTube.  I know how the algorithms, analytics and all the technical side to marketing works on these platforms. I may help other people do it too in the future! So Im asking you to fund me and I will work day and night getting the right people to hear my music. Please help me on this journey.

I have been writing songs since the age of 8 and will never stop till the day I die. I am always challenging my art and striving to improve my writing skills. I really feel this is the best song I have written to date and I would love the world to hear it. I have been working with an amazing talented Producer called Ben Preston who helped me finish the music and produced the track and now we need your help to promote it! I wrote this song because of what I was seeing in the world. The message and theme behind the lyrics are people will always be stronger when listening to each other and working together. I think this relates to so many things in the world and needs to be heard by as many people as possible. I believe if we do more listening and less talking, people/communities can and will be great again. I hope you can contribute in spreading this positive message around the world.

Obviously there is no guarantee that this funding will make this song a success but it is the only way people will get to hear it. I believe in the track and I believe a lot of people will relate to it and hopefully use it as motivation to make a difference. 

 

SUCCESS SO FAR...

In my previous releases I have had the following success all through my own finances, belief and brilliant support from family and friends
• National Airplay on BBC Radio 2
• Latest Single (Something in the water) entered Viral UK Top 50 on Spotify (Only unsigned Artist in this playlist)
• Latest Single(Something in the water) hit New Music Friday on Spotify (Only unsigned Artist in this playlist)
• iTunes Top 10 Single in the Download Chart
<li>2nd Single made the Sky Sports &amp
• 2nd Single featured on Channel 4's TV soap 'Hollyoaks,' in March 2017.
• BBC News and Local TV Interview
• Performed live for BBC Introducing twice
• 4 Sold Out shows in Birmingham
• First Single / Music Video aired at The New York Film Festival
• Hand picked out of 50,000 artist to perform at BBC Amplify in London. A new event celebrating 10 years of BBC Introducing

I have made many mistakes along the way, invested in people and companies that on reflection was an error of judgment on my behalf. But these experiences have only made me stronger, more wise and more determined to succeed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't make a contribution but you can still help by sharing this campaign with others you may personally know who may be able to raise finances for this project.

Another way you can help is by simply sharing this on social media to create awareness and give much needed exposure to this campaign using the Indiegogo Share tools!

Thank you so much for your time and I really hope you can help me in the next chapter of my career. It's been an unbelievable journey so far and I'm hoping with your help we can get my Single heard around the world, spreading a positive and great message to everyone who gets to hear it. 

Thank you, 

Yours Faithfully, 

Sebastian

In August of 1988, 17 year old Hanzaburo Araki made his professional musical debut to a sold-out house in Shimonoseki, Japan on the shakuhachi, a traditional, end-blown, bamboo flute. The 6th generation of his family to master this instrument, Hanz studied the music of his father and grandfathers solemnly and earnestly, making his debut a short 3 months after picking up his first shakuhachi.  It was with that same focus that he made the shift to the Irish music of his mother and grandmothers.

A detailed whistle and flute player, Araki is also known for his unparalleled singing voice and the ability to interpret songs with both a respect for their history and a contemporary relevance.  He has made 13 albums to date, 5 of them solo efforts, and this 6th will serve as a culmination of 30 years of learning, playing, singing, touring, recording, listening, and developing as a musician and a performer. 

It's worth mentioning that his 30th Anniversary album will be the first he records in Ireland.  In that, the album will simultaneously glance back over the last 30 years, and gaze ahead at the next 30 while in his beloved West Kerry, where his great-grandmother was born.

I hope you'll join him to celebrate the achievement of longevity and commitment, and support the making of this album.

Thank you!
Colleen Raney
Little Sea Records
