I decided to launch a pre-sale campaign for my debut album, ""Ferris Wheelin"" with the dream of releasing my first ""solo"" record on vinyl!
I am passionate about my local music scene and will donate 10% each of album pre-sales to my favorite music non-profits, WSCA-106.1FM (Portsmouth Community Radio) and PMAC (Portsmouth Music &

Through scrounging, saving and selling some of my gear, I managed to put the funds together to release my album. I have set a goal of raising $2000 to help recoup roughly half of ($4000+) what it cost to have vinyl records made, from recording to mixing, mastering and vinyl pressing.
More than anything, I'd love to share my music and help my non-profit friends above !

What do you get? I have perks including 150 gram vinyl records pressed at Burlington Record Plant in Vermont. I have a few signed vinyl ""Test-Pressings"" + Digipak CD's and digital downloads. Also hand silk-screened t-shirts with album cover art by Dylan Metrano.
If I don't reach my goal, I will still give the above music non-profits 10% ea of what I do raise. Let's think positive though! With a little help from you, I'm sure we can get there :)

This is an important time to support the arts. For eons, independent musicians and artists have labored at their passions, whether their works ever saw the light of day. As this world of ours spins ever faster, there is no better time to light a candle!

Being a Taurus makes it such that I am stubborn and loyal. I am going to work at making this campaign a success with your help. I will follow through on the goods without question.
 
If at all possible, please consider helping me get the word out and sharing this campaign! Copy and paste the URL, email it to your friends, share on Facebook or via Indiegogo's share tools.
 
Thanks so much for taking the time to read this!
 
Jonathan Blakeslee
 
 

 

","I decided to launch a pre-sale campaign for my debut album, ""Ferris Wheelin"" with the dream of releasing my first ""solo"" record on vinyl!

I am passionate about my local music scene and will donate 10% each of album pre-sales to my favorite music non-profits, WSCA-106.1FM (Portsmouth Community Radio) and PMAC (Portsmouth Music & Arts Center).

Through scrounging, saving and selling some of my gear, I managed to put the funds together to release my album. I have set a goal of raising $2000 to help recoup roughly half of ($4000+) what it cost to have vinyl records made, from recording to mixing, mastering and vinyl pressing.
More than anything, I'd love to share my music and help my non-profit friends above !

If I don't reach my goal, I will still give the above music non-profits 10% ea of what I do raise. Let's think positive though! With a little help from you, I'm sure we can get there :)

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Short Summary

I am a Chicago-based keyboardist, vocalist, producer, and songwriter. In the last 10 years, I have released three albums of original music as well as been featured on numerous recordings for other artists, some of which even won Grammys. I have also performed around the world with the likes of Gallant, Brett Dennen, Lupe Fiasco, The Heard, Naughty Professor, Hey Champ, and Hanging Hearts.

I began work on my new album, Really Human, in the fall of 2016. Not long after that, I reached out to one of my favorite artists, electro-soul legend Georgia Anne Muldrow, to help produce a few of my songs. After she agreed to help, working with her quickly set the tone for this new album, as my songs were taken to new heights of electronic groove glory! While my touring schedule over the past few years slowed the album's progress somewhat, I was able to buckle down on a lot of the album's recording and mixing in the latter half of 2018.

Right now, the album is about 95% complete and I released the first single and video, ""We Broke,"" last summer to wide acclaim. And now I need your help — my friends, family, and fans — to release this exciting new project in the most effective way possible. As my most ambitious and personal project yet, I can't wait for the world to hear it.
<h3>What We Need &amp
Finishing the Album
<ul>
• $800 to finish mixing the last few songs
• $1000 to master the completed album
Music Video
• $1500 to Chicago filmmaker Cam Be to direct the video for the next single ""Full Grown,"" produced by Georgia Anne Muldrow
Pressing to Vinyl
• $1700 to Gotta Groove Records to press 100 copies of the album to vinyl.
Album Art Work
• $500 to a local artist to create original artwork for the album cover.
Why Vinyl?

These days, a touring band's merchandise is one their most important revenue streams, especially on the road. Although CDs are certainly cheaper to print, people are buying fewer of them as CD players are becoming less and less common. Vinyl records, on the other hand, have been making a come back over the past decade. In fact, they are the only physical format for music that has been increasing in sales over the last few years.

Listeners appreciate the higher sound quality of vinyl as well as their potential for becoming collector's items. And most new artists — myself included — also include a digital download card with the vinyl purchase, so the music can also be listened to digitally. If you're going to buy music in a physical format, you might as well buy the highest quality option while showing off your collection.
And, not to mention, I've always dreamed of releasing my music on a vinyl record.
<h3>Risks &amp

Printing to vinyl is not only an expensive process but it can also be a very long one. With so few pressing plants in the US, their orders become backlogged quickly — orders can easily take between 3 to 5 months to be delivered. We will have to wait to release the album digitally until the records are printed, so planning an official release date could take longer than we hope. But if that is the case, that only gives us more time to prepare and to promote the album leading up to the release date, which is a good thing.
Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate you taking the time to read about my campaign and listen to my music. I totally understand if now is not the right time for you to make a monetary donation. With that in mind, here are a few other ways you can support the campaign for free. And remember: As an independent artist, every bit helps!
<ul>
• Spread the word to your friends via social media and word of mouth,
• Check out the Indiegogo website for share tools,
• Come to a show soon!

Short Summary

I am Rachel Michelle Jackson and I am a singer/songwriter and speaker. My desire is to minister to people in a real and honest way. My prayer is that this music and the words that come forth will bring healing, deliverance, restoration, and salvation. I have been ministering through word and song for 17 years, reaching out to women, children, youth, and college-aged students. My past music received regular airplay on several radio stations across America. When this new EP is complete I have goals to reach people in that way again. I have lead worship in many settings from church camps to inside prison walls. I am youth pastors wife in Sand Springs, OK at Angus Church. Me and husband Jared have 3 kids together and have been married for 14 years.
<ul>
• This project is very important to me because it reaches people and I love people.  Having new music that reaches this culture of today will open doors to hearts and relationships.

• With your contribution and donation, you will help me create a 6 song EP.  It can help make all the difference in the world just having my songs produced and packaged in the most professional way with amazingly professional and talented musicians/producers is important.  I want this done with excellence and value.

Any time I have been lost in life, hurt or endured a tragic situation, I have always had music, writing and singing as something that brought healing to my heart.  So many of us turn to music to help us through good and bad times.  Music influences how we feel, think, and even what we beleive. I want to take all those times in my life, make something amazing that connects with people.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>
• The funding needed will be the amount of $6000
• There will be some cool perks like a free digi download, personalized handwritten thank you letter, thank yous in the album art, plus a video chat with me thanking you personally.
The Impact
<ul>

• This project is valuable because you would be single-handedly be changing my life because of the opportunities that will be given due to this.  You will also be taking part in changing others lives I reach cause without I cant do this.
• I will be sharing stories and the success record of this projects with you through a email newsletter. So we can rejoice together the impact this is making.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute financially, which is understandable, there are ways to help out regardless!
• You can spread the word.  Share my video.  Tell your friends.  Text everyone you know!  Put my indiegogo link on all your social media and so on!

And that's all there is to it.

","Short Summary

I am Rachel Michelle Jackson and I am a singer/songwriter and speaker. My desire is to minister to people in a real and honest way. My prayer is that this music and the words that come forth will bring healing, deliverance, restoration, and salvation. I have been ministering through word and song for 17 years, reaching out to women, children, youth, and college-aged students. My past music received regular airplay on several radio stations across America. When this new EP is complete I have goals to reach people in that way again. I have lead worship in many settings from church camps to inside prison walls. I am youth pastors wife in Sand Springs, OK at Angus Church. Me and husband Jared have 3 kids together and have been married for 14 years.
This project is very important to me because it reaches people and I love people.  Having new music that reaches this culture of today will open doors to hearts and relationships.

With your contribution and donation, you will help me create a 6 song EP.  It can help make all the difference in the world just having my songs produced and packaged in the most professional way with amazingly professional and talented musicians/producers is important.  I want this done with excellence and value.

Any time I have been lost in life, hurt or endured a tragic situation, I have always had music, writing and singing as something that brought healing to my heart.  So many of us turn to music to help us through good and bad times.  Music influences how we feel, think, and even what we beleive. I want to take all those times in my life, make something amazing that connects with people.
What We Need & What You Get
The funding needed will be the amount of $6000
There will be some cool perks like a free digi download, personalized handwritten thank you letter, thank yous in the album art, plus a video chat with me thanking you personally.
The Impact

This project is valuable because you would be single-handedly be changing my life because of the opportunities that will be given due to this.  You will also be taking part in changing others lives I reach cause without I cant do this.
I will be sharing stories and the success record of this projects with you through a email newsletter. So we can rejoice together the impact this is making.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute financially, which is understandable, there are ways to help out regardless!
You can spread the word.  Share my video.  Tell your friends.  Text everyone you know!  Put my indiegogo link on all your social media and so on!
And that's all there is to it.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Sand Springs, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/new-cd-production-conciliation-by-rachel-jackson/pica

Who is Starstruck Multimedia?

Originally formed in 2011 as a brotherhood of like-minded individuals, Starstruck has evolved into a multimedia brand specializing in music, media and art. Founded by multimedia artist, Jaron Ikner, also known as southwest hip hop staple, Black One, the brand has always tried to remain ahead of the curve and push the thresholds of creativity. Events, live streams, artist development, and media production are just some of the talents Starstruck brings to the table.

Looking to once again push the envelope, Starstruck has evolved into a record label/artist development house in order to help cultivate and showcase some of the amazing hidden talent that exists in the world. With burgeoning talent such as Lizzy Page, Vinney Mendez and Johnny Rubix, Starstruck is determined to become a household name in due time.
The ideal goal is to raise 3000 dollars to cover touring expenses and merchandise costs.
<ul>
• Perks will include FREE tickets to future Starstruck Multimedia events, Free merchandise, personalized messages and gifts, and much more! Check the ""perk"" category for more infor mation
• All funds raised will go towards the touring campaign.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please feel free to share this page through your social media networks.

Summary
Peace &
My name is Honey Gold Jasmine and I would like to introduce you to my world through music, comic book art and video but I need your support!
SUPANOVA 7: Gold Soil is the first comic book + music EP bundle of the SUPANOVA 7 series.

It follows the ‘Down to Earth, Outta this World’ journey of a Gold Soul living on the planet SUPANOVA 7 whose whole existence changes when she listens to her innerG and ends up being sent to Earth. Now she must experience a world in the body of a human named Honey Gold Jasmine when before she was pure light. It’s the year 2084 and music creation has been made to be illegal UNLESS you choose to take a pill with pre-programmed music produced by the government. The starseed holds the key for a tree that taps into the Planet(work) to keep Earth in harmony.
The series consists of multimedia components and explores themes about freedom of expression, afrofuturism, anti human trafficking, and self love.

With your donation, I can film my next music video HIGHER POWER, a lyrical video for DAT REAL DAT JAZZ, produce the 2nd annual Increase the Piece music therapy to also showcase the work of other artists putting in time to share their light and finally, create my merchandise for shows, tours, and an online marketplace. Each level of donation unlocks a special package that will be sent to you directly, in honor of your support. 10% of the proceeds go to Beats, Rhymes, and Life so their youth can shoot a music video as a part of their music therapy program. These videos will be featured at the film festival. Help us spread the light and message towards achieving our higher selves and be LITERALLY LIT!
<h3>What We Need &amp
I have hella perks that I know you will love! Get a piece of the SUPANOVA 7 vibe when you support the journey:
Close up of EYE SEE YO INNER G shirt design options
Here's a breakdown of the budget:
Goal Total: $6000
Beats, Rhymes and Life youth music video:  $600 (or more, hopefully with a surplus of donations, we can give more!)

column2: >2 Music Videos: $1700

column3: >- stipends for cast in the music video (actors, artist cameos, dancers, etc.)

column1: IndieGoGo Platform Fees: $270

As independent artists and activists, we give a lot to preserve the beautiful, yet radical culture in the Bay Area through our work, especially with the youth. Unfortunately, we exist in a world where this work isn't appreciated through mainstream funding but it is still extremely necessary. With your donation, we can shift this paradigm and be creators of the content that inspires innovation and uplifts our community.

We want to be able to produce work that we are not only proud of but also serves as a message to the youth that they do have to sell their soul to make it in this life. Your donation would be greatly appreciated because we will be empowered by your support to continue this journey while also creating pathways for other local conscious artists to do the same.
<h3>Risks &amp

We need your full support on this campaign to get to 100% of our goal. We are working with a tight budget and we need the full amount to be able to make sure we can fully produce the films, provide funds for Beats, Rhymes and Life's the youth film as well &
column2: secure the items for the perks as well.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
Even the smallest contribution counts (: Please share with your social networks &
column2: tell people about it! We will also holding events that you can attend to show your support.

column2:
>The Heart Of Love Secrets

Music is a medium to explore things. I like exploring God. That's how Love Secrets was born. I was singing in the Spirit, enjoying some quality time in worship on my old upright piano when the Spirit rang, ""You are singing My love secrets"". What a mysterious, wonderful thing.

Mighty Grace camped around the foundational truth that Jesus Himself is our righteousness. We died with Him on the cross, we were raised with Him as new co-heir creations, we're now clothed in Him, hidden in Him, seated with Him in heaven, and forever mystically united as one Spirit with Him. Jesus finished the work quite well.

The journey forward is discovering and knowing God in a real, personal way. This boldness to know God as a friend flows from knowing your Christ-identity
column3:
the unshakeable reality that you are one with Him! We can restfully enjoy and explore all the ooey-gooey treats of God's personality and wonder without ever being achilles-heeled by, ""Have I done enough?"" In other words, confidence in your Christ-righteousness is the vehicle to His love secrets.

Let's swim in the love-friendship-union we have with God. My hope is that this album would be a medium for you to explore more of His love and that along the way, you'd discover a deeper friendship with God full of love-secrets meant just for your ears.

Read my full biography on my website: http://johnmarkpantana.com
column6:
What You Get

Love Secrets will be a (13)-track home-studio album created by myself and a team of incredible individuals! We are planning to start the recording in January 2019 and finish by April 2019. Once recording is complete, we will send the tracks off to be mixed and mastered. Our expected worldwide release date of Love Secrets is Summer 2019. Here's what the funds we're trying to raise will go towards:

column1: <li>
$2500 // Production
<li>
$3000 // Mixing
<li>
$1500 // Mastering
<li>
$1000 // Merchandise
<li>
$2000 // Equipment + Band

We cannot meet the vision for this album without your help! You can back this project financially by choosing from a myriad of pretty fancy perks. Every backing reward is discounted for a limited time. Here's a list of rewards:
<li>
$5 // Love Secrets E-Book
<li>
$8 // Love Secrets Digital Download
<li>
$30 // Love Secrets Tee's + Love Secrets
<li>
$40 // Love Secrets Hoodie/Sweatshirt + Love Secrets
<li>
$50 // Love Secrets B-Side
There's more. Check out the perks on your right. You can sing on the album, host me for a show, or become a primary financial sponsor for this project and receive the whole kit-and-kaboodle.
column3:
>Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, you can still help by the following:

column1: <li>
Share this campaign with your friends. Facebook, Instagram, etc.
<li>
Pray for heavenly progress and enjoyment during the recording.

column3:
>The Album Forecast

Here's the current plan for the album. As we record, it may slightly update, in which case, all backers will be notified. 

Edit: As you can see, there were 15 songs planned and the official album only has 13 songs. The two songs that were cut will be featured on the B-Sides of Love Secrets.
column5:
>Closer Look At Merch

I've been working for months with my designer, Andrew Lennon, to create some high quality merch for you. We love the way everything turned out. Take a closer look at the designs.

WHO WE ARE

Hard Drive is a hard-driving aural modern traditional old time authentic millennial bluegrass collective made up of Tatiana Hargreaves, Aaron Tacke, Sonya Badigian, and Nokosee Fields. From brother duets to raging fiddle tunes, Hard Drive brings a sense of deep intuition and silliness to the world that encompasses old-time, country, and bluegrass. They float gently around a Bermuda-Triangle-type space/time warp that connects North Carolina, Oklahoma, and Minnesota, and they are constantly expanding at the approximate pace of the universe.

WHY WE ARE

How did Hard Drive get started? Sonya and Tatiana met on the day they moved in together via a blind roommate setup in North Carolina. Nokosee moved in soon after and began cooking mysterious, musical potions late into the night. At their Mt. Airy campsite in 2018, Aaron Tacke joined in their noise rituals, giving birth to the first hard-driving sounds of Hard Drive. Four months later, inspired by their late night session back in June, they recorded an album in Louisiana in 36 hours. The collective was formed.

Help support our effort to release the evidence on June 1st by pre-ordering a CD!

Follow @random_access_mash on Instagram for more frequent updates.

EXPENSE BREAKDOWN

Creating a hard-driving aural modern traditional old time authentic millennial bluegrass collective is expensive, and Hard Drive wants to be transparent with you about where your money is going and why they’re asking for this exact amount.

$2000 - paying off studio time, mixing, and mastering with Joel Savoy, human miracle, at his studio, SavoyFaire, in Eunice, Louisiana

$1600 - printing 1000 CDs from *~the internet~* and paying our album artwork creator Sally Jablonsky for her supreme sense of intuition

$700 - licensing fees for the high number of copyrighted songs we accidentally recorded

$200 - CD shipping costs and assorted promotional materials

= $4500

 

POSTER OPTIONS

If you choose a perk with a poster, you can review your six options here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1sa6mzarEQu8...

The poster will be around 11x17 or a similar set of dimensions TBD and will be delivered by August of 2019.

Hey guys! I'm Jeremiah Cole. I was born and raised in Wilmington, DE, but have called NYC home for almost 20 years. I grew up performing and studying at arts institutions like Wilmington's Cab Calloway School of the Arts, the Philadelphia High School for Creative and Performing Arts, and later New York's American Musical and Dramatic Academy. I dropped out of college at the age of 19, signing my first management contract and recording my first demo. Major label meetings followed, but nothing panned out completely. 3 managers, a production deal, and several years later, here I am. Over the years I've had the pleasure of co-writing and recording countless songs, mostly unreleased, and performing at many venues. Under the name Jeremy Cole, I released my first official singles and videos in 2010 and 2011 respectively, ""Can't Crash"" and ""I Want Your Body"" while signed to a production deal. I've appeared on television in ""Showtime at the Apollo"" and ""The Voice"". I've also done guest vocals on house records, but I have NEVER released a completely cohesive project or anything, for that matter, that was completely independent and my own creative vision. I decided after a few years of inactivity, frustration, and depression to take matters into my own hands. But I can't do it all on my own. This is where you come in! Your support will not only help me record, mix, and master the project, but also promote, stream on all streaming platforms, and produce release parties and performances. I have been so inspired by the support many of you have given to me over the years. Keep it up! I need you now more than ever. No amount is too small. I decided on the title ""Reborn for the First Time"" because I've been at this thing for a long time, so it is a rebirth of sorts, but it's definitely the first time I'm doing it on my own terms. Much love and thanks always...

Jeremiah Cole

Our Story

Our journey, like many others is no different. It has ups and downs, peaks and valleys, struggles and celebrations. But what set me apart from the many is that I never gave up on fulfilling my dreams and my purpose, and now it’s time to give others the opportunity to do the same.

I grew up in a single mother household, the eldest of 4, living in Hackney. I found my love for music in my early teens and without question, I chose making beats in my bedroom over the street life that surrounded me.

Developing my skills as a producer, engineer and artist I began to build a name for myself, inviting many local artists to record their songs in my humble bedroom studio. This became a place where many aspiring artists and producers were able to hone and develop their skills.
Fast forward 15 years later, after achieving awards, sold out concerts and tours, travelling the world and collaborating with many of the UK’s profilic artists....VixMix Studios is born.
A place where all calibre of creatives can share common ground... creativity.
Whether it's your first time in a studio or you’ve had years of experience, VixMix Studios is committed to being a major part of your artistic growth and helping to establish your identity.
We’ve worked with everyone, from your everyday up and coming local artist, to your favourite A-list celebrities. We have a part to play in the process of their creativity.
We are launching our second studio room, double the size of our first and we want you to be part of the entire process, from conception to birth and onwards.
This is an opportunity for you to be part of something that could elevate your dreams or the dreams of others.
“If you want to go fast go alone, but if you want to go far go together” - A wise man.
<h3>What We Need &amp
Help us turn this...
into this...
What WE Need:
We need to raise £12,000 for acoustic treatment, design and high end equipment.

We want to give our clients the best and memorable experience from the moment they walk into the room until the moment they leave. With the best equipment, design, and acoustic treatment, we can achieve this.
Design:
Professional acoustic treatment
Building a recording booth
Wood flooring, Painting
Paying labourers
Starlight ceiling installation
Equipment:
Adam Audio S3H x2
Yamaha HS8 x2
Sessiondesk Gustav Workstation
Universal Audio Apollo X8 Quad
Mac Pro (Configured to top specs)
SE Electronics Gemini II Microphone + Accessories
Wires + Cables
Other:
Security systems
Chairs, Couch, Tables, Desk
Insurance
What YOU Get:
We have many perks in which contributors will truly enjoy and get to experience the new studio in all its glory:
<ul>
• Personal updates on the progress of the studio
• Get your name engraved on the Legacy Wall in the studio
• Invitation to the official launch of the studio
• 10% discount on services for 6 months
• Record a 7 song EP
• Plus many more
Funds will still go towards the building of the studio if desired goal is not reached, and perks will be fulfilled once the studio is completed.
Not interested in any perks? Not a problem. You can still contribute any amount of your choice. We will forever be grateful.
The Impact
<ul>
• We aim to expand our reach in developing young up and coming creatives (incl. writers, artists, producers and engineers).
• We aim to expand our reach in giving more young people an alternative to the temptations of the streets and opportunities to hone and improve their artistic skills.

• We have worked with the likes of Chip, Gracious K, Zinny X, Ms Banks, D Double E, Not3s, Mr Eazi, Reggie ’n’ Bollie, Guvna B, Nick Brewer, The Compozers, Tion Wayne, One Acen, Mae Muller and Many More.
Risks &
<ul>
• Impact on clients being able to access high quality service when they need it
• Inability to manage increased number of clients - more clients means additional space required
• Risk of not being able to provide high quality equipment that meets the needs of diverse clientele
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
• Sharing and spreading the word on social media, or word of mouth
• Giving away or selling us your used (good condition) equipment
• Offering us your DIY skills or connects.
Thank you in advance for choosing to be part of building a legacy in the hearts of the people.
- VixMix Studios
<div>
","Our Story

Our journey, like many others is no different. It has ups and downs, peaks and valleys, struggles and celebrations. But what set me apart from the many is that I never gave up on fulfilling my dreams and my purpose, and now it’s time to give others the opportunity to do the same.

I grew up in a single mother household, the eldest of 4, living in Hackney. I found my love for music in my early teens and without question, I chose making beats in my bedroom over the street life that surrounded me.

Developing my skills as a producer, engineer and artist I began to build a name for myself, inviting many local artists to record their songs in my humble bedroom studio. This became a place where many aspiring artists and producers were able to hone and develop their skills.
Fast forward 15 years later, after achieving awards, sold out concerts and tours, travelling the world and collaborating with many of the UK’s profilic artists....VixMix Studios is born.
A place where all calibre of creatives can share common ground... creativity.
Whether it's your first time in a studio or you’ve had years of experience, VixMix Studios is committed to being a major part of your artistic growth and helping to establish your identity.
We’ve worked with everyone, from your everyday up and coming local artist, to your favourite A-list celebrities. We have a part to play in the process of their creativity.
We are launching our second studio room, double the size of our first and we want you to be part of the entire process, from conception to birth and onwards.
This is an opportunity for you to be part of something that could elevate your dreams or the dreams of others.
“If you want to go fast go alone, but if you want to go far go together” - A wise man.
What We Need & What You Get
Help us turn this...
into this...
What WE Need:
We need to raise £12,000 for acoustic treatment, design and high end equipment.

We want to give our clients the best and memorable experience from the moment they walk into the room until the moment they leave. With the best equipment, design, and acoustic treatment, we can achieve this.
Design:
Professional acoustic treatment
Building a recording booth
Wood flooring, Painting
Paying labourers
Starlight ceiling installation
Equipment:
Adam Audio S3H x2
Yamaha HS8 x2
Sessiondesk Gustav Workstation
Universal Audio Apollo X8 Quad
Mac Pro (Configured to top specs)
SE Electronics Gemini II Microphone + Accessories
Wires + Cables
Other:
Security systems
Chairs, Couch, Tables, Desk
Insurance
What YOU Get:
We have many perks in which contributors will truly enjoy and get to experience the new studio in all its glory:
Personal updates on the progress of the studio
Get your name engraved on the Legacy Wall in the studio
Invitation to the official launch of the studio
10% discount on services for 6 months
Record a 7 song EP
Plus many more
Funds will still go towards the building of the studio if desired goal is not reached, and perks will be fulfilled once the studio is completed.
Not interested in any perks? Not a problem. You can still contribute any amount of your choice. We will forever be grateful.
The Impact
We aim to expand our reach in developing young up and coming creatives (incl. writers, artists, producers and engineers).
We aim to expand our reach in giving more young people an alternative to the temptations of the streets and opportunities to hone and improve their artistic skills.

We have worked with the likes of Chip, Gracious K, Zinny X, Ms Banks, D Double E, Not3s, Mr Eazi, Reggie ’n’ Bollie, Guvna B, Nick Brewer, The Compozers, Tion Wayne, One Acen, Mae Muller and Many More.
Risks & Challenges
Impact on clients being able to access high quality service when they need it
Inability to manage increased number of clients - more clients means additional space required
Risk of not being able to provide high quality equipment that meets the needs of diverse clientele
Other Ways You Can Help
Sharing and spreading the word on social media, or word of mouth
Giving away or selling us your used (good condition) equipment
Offering us your DIY skills or connects.
Thank you in advance for choosing to be part of building a legacy in the hearts of the people.
- VixMix Studios",2.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","London, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/vixmix-studios-expansion/pica

Art Chakra is Touring through Europe and India!
The members of Art Chakra, Roland Ramos and Diana Lovrin, are cultural ambassadors that create and hold space for creativity to thrive.

Our mission is to introduce our culture of high vibrational music and songwriting process with cultures different than our own to intermingle and enrich minds, music and artistry of all parties involved.

Art Chakra was born out of conversations between friends that were transformed into songs as a means of processing existential matters leading to catharsis and release, acting as a mirror for self reflection.

The beauty of our music lies in its simplicity and honesty: In a world of production-heavy, midi-driven electronic music - (though we can get down to that too!!!), Art Chakra is reminiscent of how an acoustic guitar and harmonies can touch you at a deep level.
In addition to Art Chakra, Roland is the creator of Artifications: a web-based documentary spotlighting the Art Scene world-wide, and runs the Artifications Art Gallery in Brooklyn NY.
Diana's other pursuits include: Dance as Medicine, DJing, and self empowerment through various Healing Arts modalities.
Both Roland and Diana host open mics (and other creative spaces) and understand the importance and the healing powers of creative sharing.
<h3>What We Need &amp
We are aiming to raise $4444 to help us pay for the costs of plane, train and bus tickets, travel health insurance, as well as room and board, and of course
column2: food!                                                              As the day of departure comes closer we realized that without investing in some kind of physical promotional objects, once we move on to the next place, our new fans will have to rely on digital algorithms to keep our memory fresh...The people need a tangible way to receive our music! Instead of CDs, we will put our album on USB Cards. Another investment will be towards these awesome brass pins - all of which are part of the gifts for your pledges!

column1: $12 T-Shirt Super Sale Alert! Limited time only: until 12.23.19
$10: A shout out and personalized thank you on our social media (FB and Instagram)
$20: A shout out and a download of our first EP
$40: All of the above, plus a personalized digital picture of Art Chakra on tour doing something cultural in Europe or India - we can create it or you can come up with a mission for us  :-)
$50: All of the above, plus free entry to our Open Mic + 1 beverage!
$50: Art Chakra T-Shirt, download, &
$60: Art Chakra logo brass pin, download &
$75: Sound Healing with Tuning Forks: 30 min Tune Up with Diana
$80: 1hr guitar lesson with Roland
$100: open for negotiation. Name your prize!
$150: Art Chakra will write and record a personalized song just for you!
$175: Body Work with Sound Healing: 1.5hr session with Diana
$200: 3hr songwriting workshop w Roland
$300: book the Artifications Studio for an event
$444: Art Chakra plays your event
$1000: Art Chakra pin, T-shirt, download,  and Art Chakra plays your event!
The Impact
Cultural interaction through art is Alchemical! An open heart and willingness to play is pure magic! We are the magic makers and it's custodians
column2: A tide that raises all ships! It is our mission and obligation to bring our heart-centric live performances worldwide to spread joy and inspire means of self-expression through the universal language of music. This is how we save the world.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
Whether its a chunk of change, spare change, a good thought, a prayer, or a link share, it means the world to us!
We can't wait to share all we got in our hearts with you, through our recordings, concerts, gifts, merch, workshops, art exhibits, open mic jam sessions and more!
Thank you for helping our garden grow!

Short Summary
Hey y'all! I'm Dre Peace. An indie-soul artist with an avant garde style that will spark joy in your spirit. I have graced stages all over this country
column2: starting when I was a small child. Ranging from Disney, Gap Inc., Canton Blues Fest, Kentucky Derby, NASCAR to professional athletic events and government celebrations locally and nationally. One half of the phenomenal duo, The Tryangles, my roots are in rock, jazz and alternative music. With vocal ability, a theatrical performance style and overall artistic expression
column3: I create a beautiful experience that no one can miss.

column1: Having worked a lifetime already to achieve my dreams, the past few months have been trying. I continued to TRY. Never giving up. Fueled by my need to simply experience more, I left. Leaving nearly everything where it was, I took myself. With only one goal in mind, and no distractions
column2: The Grammys already feel familiar. To celebrate that momentum, I created The Details Tour. Naming it simply because I don't have all the details yet! However, I have the vision, drive and talent. I needed to create space for the opportunities to present themselves

column1: Now, with a target of 20 shows in 18 cities, I've identified the areas with whom I'd like to first share my eclectic sound in a series of intimate performances.  While I understand that this mostly, self funded initiative is unconventional - I have no big company behind me. With your support in mind, I am asking for YOUR help. If you’ve experienced any show, concert or performance of mine, you understand! I want to spread that same light with my voice throughout the country.
<h3>What We Need &amp

There are several sponsorship tiers with merchandise gifts ranging from albums to private concerts! All this to show my appreciation of your donation to this campaign. Please review the perks to the right, and select a level that stands out to you.
Every patron of levels 2-4 will receive a copy of my debut EP
column3: Half. I understand this is not a conventional way of releasing an album. It needed to be more personal. This musical work of art deserves more than a digital download. With the help of Brandon Scott, Mike Early, Rob Riley, Storm9000, Daniel Moss and Cece Beckham, we are finally ready to share this art with the world. I carefully wrote every song, Bjazz perfectly marrying the sounds to lyrics.

column1: Each album is hand-painted, uniquely titled, numbered and original. A stunning, handcrafted piece of art to be both audibly and visually enjoyed.  I'm in the process of making two hundred of these albums. With nearly 120/200 complete, several have already been accounted for. Purchased albums will be viewable by the public for 24 hours before being removed and shipped.
These are the remaining custom albums: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wjc661gmvixx7sn/AADx...
Your contribution will support:
<ul>
• transportation
• lodging
• marketing / promotions
• flyer / poster printing
• merchandise inventory
• general tour expenses
I know this will be daunting at times, exciting at times and even scary at times
column2: but I'm ready to spread my music all around the world. This is the start, this is the beginning. Will you be a part of my beginning?

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
• Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can’t help! Any of these actions would help tremendously.
• Share this campaign with a personal word of support on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat and Twitter!
• Provide or reach out to friends / family members who live in or near any of the cities listed to reduce lodging costs for 1-3 people. Lodging is confirmed for cities marked with an asterisk.
• Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
• Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

-Dre Peace ☮️

Sharing my Music
Hi! Thanks for taking a few minutes to check out what this is about.

If you don't know me (extra thanks for being here!), I'm a solo music artist based in NYC. Writing music and performing have been the focus of everything I've done, everywhere I've been, and everywhere I'm going. I am a passionate storyteller, in love with the vulnerability it requires and the connections it creates! Sharing my music with my community, friends and listeners has always been my highest joy and ultimate dream.

A few years ago, I funded and released a full-length album. Since then, my writing has evolved into a VERY different, entirely new sound, and I am bursting with excitement to share this new music with you!
I'm thrilled to start working on a four-song EP with an unbelievably talented producer and team here in Harlem. And this is where I need your help!
<h3>What We Need &amp

The EP will include four tracks, and while I bring the song and my performance to the studio, it's my producer's job to actually capture my vision and create the musical experience for you all! This means my producer will be recording me, arranging and playing any additional instrument (bass, guitar, violin, cello, drums, synth, piano... this guy truly does it all), spending hours perfectly curating each sound to meet my vision, and sending on to his team for additional mixing and mastering for the finished track.
This is hundreds of hours of work, and I certainly want the entire team to be paid for their time, talents, and dedication.
For your help making this music happen, you will receive some ~super cool~ perks in addition to my eternal gratitude!
Crystal Perks

Some donations will include a very special perk personally made by moi. An artist through and through, I also run a hand-made jewelry business where I create pendants, earrings, and out of crystals and semi-precious stones! With your donation, I will send along a crystal pendant to wear, hang on your wall or rear-view mirror, give to a friend - whatever your crystal needs may be.
Other perks involve hand-written, personalized poems and playlists, recordings of unreleased songs, private shows, and more.
Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you're in no position to help financially - there is a lot you can still do to help! Share my campaign on social media! Instagram, Facebook, anywhere you scroll. Stream my music, share with your friends. Your support means the world.

Introduction

Hello, my name is Rowdy Wendland. I am a young musician about to complete my undergraduate degree in Jazz Performance at Friends University. I grew up in Wichita, KS, and started playing music when I was 11, and later picked up the guitar when I was 13. I’ve been immersed in the music scene of my area and music education for my whole undergraduate career, and I’m ready to make my first statement as an artist. I am in the process of producing my first album, and I need your help to make it the most professional and transparent representation of my art.

About the Project

Before Everything is an album meant to bring together all of my musical and life experiences up until now: the point of my life where so many things I have been wanting, waiting for, and working toward are all about to happen.

Just as the title describes, Before Everything represents everything I was, and have grown to be, up until this pivotal point in my life, symbolizing the journey of youthful existence and the readiness to move forward. It will be a sort of send-off project for my musical career and personal life, because just a few months after the release of the album, I will be getting married, moving to a new city, buying my first house, and starting graduate school and–through that–my professional career. I am about to begin the rest of my life, so it truly feels like ""everything"" is about to begin.

The music on the album features a variety of sound worlds, pulling from my varied musical background, with elements of jazz, neosoul, r&
column2:
b, metal, and classical music. Each composition comes from different points of inspiration in my life, like the beautiful university campus where I spent so much of my time composing and seeking inspiration, the love I felt for my now-fiancé, the struggles and difficulties I faced while coping with the reality of my mother’s cancer diagnosis, and other self-reflections. The goal with the music, and most of my composition, is to express and share my story, but also, to connect with the audience – to help them feel seen or acknowledged through any sort of connection they make with the music and the intended self-expression they might relate to.

Goals

The more I've worked on this project, the more I realize all that has to go into it. I am pledging a goal of $9,000 to cover the costs of performance, recording, production, manufacturing, and advertisement. To break this down a little bit further: the musicians participating on the album are some of the best musicians in my area, and I want to ensure that they're appropriately compensated for their contribution. I will be recording the music with the best studio in my town, as well as collaborating with highly experienced mixing and mastering engineers to capture and develop the music at the highest possible quality. These components will cost somewhere between $6,000–$8,000.

Aside from these things, there are several other expenses, which include the development of album cover art and inserts, copyright and legal processes, the manufacturing of physical CDs, the distribution to streaming services, promotional material, and advertisement spending–just to name a few things, which will be covered by the remainder of the campaign goal ($1,000–$3,000).

This is an immense undertaking for me personally and professionally, but it will be more than worth it. I greatly appreciate any contribution you can make, no matter the amount. Please feel free to share my project with anyone who you think may be interested! This, too, can help tremendously. Have a great day!

I greatly appreciate any contribution you can make, no matter the amount. Please feel free to share my project with anyone who you think may be interested! This, too, can help tremendously. Have a great day!",3.0,0,"1 Campaign
